title: Great Drone
text: This drone is great, it's very similar to the maverick pro. I would say the only pitfall to this that I wouldn't recommend for beginners is that the drone is very light so in not so perfect weather conditions if you aren't used to flying a drone it can and probably will get away from you. For a beginner drone I would recommend the hs700 since its a little bigger of a drone and carries more weight but otherwise this drone is solid for somebody who has flown a drone before and would definitely recommend to others!!.

title: Great little drone for the hobbyist
text: Makes great areal pictures is pretty easy to use and fun at parties!! There was a big wreck near our house and worried about the kids we did fly it over close enough to put our fears to rest but discovered it was a neighbor and was able to notify his wife for him. I don’t advocate getting in the midst of rescue operations but couldn’t resist checking it out and did maintain a good distance. Great little case for storage and travel  and the features all work as Described

title: Seems to be a good unit
text: Got this for my grandson for Christmas and the weather’s been to rough to fly it yet.

title: Flys great
text: First time out the fight when great , right out of the box all was great, had a fun time, my wife is looking at getting one

title: Easier to fly than expected.
text: The auto take off and land feature is perfect for beginners. I recommend flying in low mode until you get more acquainted with the controls. The return home feature saved me as I lost sight of my drone. Highly recommend.

title: This can't be native 4K
text: When the video I captures from the 720 was compared with my Mavic air 2, the difference was night and day... Dji wins by a mile with image stabilization and clarity ....

title: Bad controls
text: Holy stone makes good products but this one had bad problem with the controls idk what was wrong but drone took off with gps on and it lost contact with remote

title: Drone
text: Takes awesome pictures when your able to make the drone respond to remote. Not for beginners, def need a class to teach more in depth. Continues to reset into beginners mode, not allowing height travel. Constantly goes to “unconnected”. Very difficult to operate due to no mounting access of your phone or iPad, you have to hold phone with remote, awkward.

title: Easy to fly
text: Like it

title: Drone performance and customer service
text: I have had several different drones in the past, in performance, and for the money,this drone tops them all. It’s easy to fly and does everything it’s supposed to. Customer service is extremely responsive to any question or problem. My experience in the past with other companies has been very negative. Customer service is extremely responsive to any question or problem. My experience in the past with other companies has been very negative. Not only do they answer the phone properly they are knowledgeable in their product. This is a company I am happy to do business with.

title: Great drone for the price and experience.
text: The drone was somewhat simple to set up and was fairly easy to start flying.  The only issue is that my phone wasn’t able to pick up the feed from the drone, but my wife’s was.  I’m guessing it’s because my phone isn’t a top of the line phone or something. When I was able to fly it with the feed off the wife’s phone, it was pretty cool to see it in action. It’s going to be really cool for hikes and other nature locations when we go on hikes to get some nice views and pictures

title: Just didn't work with my Android cell phone.
text: The company did refund my purchase price. I could fly it just fine. I could take excellent pictures, I just couldn't see what I was taking until the flight ended & looked at the card on the computer. The tech guy after exhaustive work recommended I get a new phone. (That would cost about three times the Drone. I'll wait until I actually need a new phone (I-phone) & repurchase that Drone to play with.

title: Waste of money! Bad quality
text: Bought this because it went on a flash sale. Waited too long to use it and tried it twice now. The video quality is horrible and my phone with the case on it doesn't work with the remote control because my phone is to big. Overall a huge disappointment and waste of money.

title: best drone will  respond
text: I brought two of these Holy drones because the RTH worked and will respond when needed.

title: The greatest toy
text: This is one of the greatest toy drones that I have experienced. It performs as advertised and takes photos that are impressive. There are better drones in higher price brackets and less expensive drones that provide less but this is the best drone for it's price bracket and you will get your money worth.

title: Outstanding customer service!
text: I am writing this review purely for the customer service! Our drone broke first use due to a malfunction, but Holy Stone did not hesitate to fix the issue and we received a brand new drone! I hesitated to write a review until I knew this second drone would work and success, it worked perfectly and we finally were able to test out all the features. The quality of the video is so clear. The stabilizer does a great job at keeping the video smooth. The only time it looks shaky is when the wind picks up a bit, but it’s hardly noticeable. This is my husband and my first drone so it was also SUPER easy to learn the controls. 5 stars!

title: Good drone for beginners
text: Fairly easy set up.  Handles well.  Camera is pretty good for the price.

title: App Is Useless And The Drone Won't Work Without It
text: The Holy Stone drone app is terrible. Just look at the reviews on the Apple app store or Google Play. I never could get the app to connect to my phone or the drone, and this particular drone needs the app for the overwhelming majority of it's function. So I had a drone that I couldn't use at all, because the app was glitchy. I promptly returned the drone for a refund. Thankfully Amazon has a solid return policy.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I recently purchased (1/29/22) the HS720E for real estate photography. This drone was very easy to set up and operated perfectly. Unfortunately, during a flight capturing high level photos of a property, the drone's RTH ( Return to Home) feature did not respond correctly and flew off into a group of trees, severely damaging the drone. Holystone customer service was exceptional and couldn't be more responsive..! After two email exchanges explaining the situation, I had a brand new drone in six days..! If customer service is an important aspect in deciding which drone to purchase, look no further than Holystone.

title: Returned
text: The quality of the camera looks like it’s from an iPhone 3. If you’re looking for a high quality picture drone, this isn’t it. Video looks absolutely nothing like the promo video you see on this listing. Look at the customer review videos for better depiction of what it actually looks like.

title: Would recommend to beginners!
text: Great starter drone. Small and easily stored. Great price, great quality.

title: Just no.
text: I have experience with quad-copters. I can fly a tiny one all around the house without hitting anything. I figured with the GPS and all the features of this it would be a breeze. I wanted to take some shots of my uncle's property in Montana <--didn't happen. I read the manual and did all the setup and calibrations.  I started with a simple flight test in an outdoor open space. No thousand feet movie shots or anything. The controls were non-responsive. Once they did work..I did an easy 5 foot up...30 foot out and then GPS "return to home". It took 2 minutes for the copter to get five feet up ...then about 4 to get out to 30 feet. When I hit "return to home" the thing flew back at me like a ninja star and I had to knock it out of the air to prevent it from hitting me in the face. Cuts on my hand were about 3mm from needing stitches. Returned.

title: Very easy to fly
text: Followed calibration every flight and so far have had no issues.  Flies very stable and camera stabilizion does make a noticeable difference.  Flight time isn't bad at all.  I got a landing pad as well just to keep the drone cleaner.

title: Love it!
text: [[VIDEOID:8976d6a9cfc991d8d8f4c298a999419a]] This is the 4th drone that I have owned and my favorite overall so far. The flight is fairly stable but not the best. My Contixo drone would hover like it was on a tripod. The Holy Stone drifts a little. The camera quality and ability to move it remotely far exceeds the Contixo. The electronic stability built into the camera works very well. The return home function works very well and often returns to about a 10 foot circle. When operating try to keep it in sight and you won't have any issues. If you are using it around large buildings the signal gets weak quick. But it will return if the signal gets real bad. I feel this drone is a great value and excellent drone for beginners.

title: Good deal!
text: Wish drone had small battery for memory of gps so calibration is not required every time you change main battery.

title: Awesome
text: It is easy to learn to fly for beginners. The remote could be a little bigger it is hard hold with big hands like mine.

title: Excellent customer support!
text:
This isn't my first drone, or rc flying vehicle. I have flown the 720 for a couple of weeks now, and it is built well, and was pretty stable.
I had a couple of issues with it, though.
First of all, I would have a hard time unlocking the motors. I would push the "lock/unlock" button, and I would get the double beep constantly! I would have to try multiple times before it would unlock and start up. Annoying...
Today, I was bringing it for landing. I was around 50 ft up, coming pretty much straight down, when it pitch violently left, flew across a river, and ended up in a tree on a bluff! It is not retrievable.... Very annoying!!!
Very disappointed!

On the plus side, the camera is really clear, and the video stabilization worked great!!!

Update: I contacted HS, and explained what happened. They asked about the circumstances, and then promptly sent me a replacement! I performed a test flight today, and the lock/ unlock issue I had with the last unit did not happen with the new one. I will update again after some time with the replacement!
Thank you Holy stone!

title: Great customer service
text: Drone arrived promptly- very pleased with overall quality of product- had some initial issues which were promptly resolved by excellent customer service. Very pleased with purchase looking forward to using it for many years.

title: Not very stable.  No collision avoidance.  Poor customer service
text:
This drone, while inexpensive, is not for use anywhere near any obstacle. When taking off, it is supposed to go straight up. Mine went sideways 10 feet and crashed. There was no wind.

The manual says that when the drone returns to home due to low battery or lost signal, it cannot avoid obstacles. It does not have that warning in the section on manual return to home. However, it will not avoid obstacles returning to home.

UPDATE:
The manufacturer offered to send a free replacement with the defect corrected. Updated to 4 stars based on GREAT customer service.

The video is more stable than the less expensive Holy Stone drones, but not nearly as good as a more expensive DJI. Also the video can only be taken straight ahead and you can pan up and down, but not side to side.
New update:

The manufacturer may good on their word to send a replacement drone. However, the camera on the replacement does not work. I contacted them, and they asked me to send a video, which I did. I never heard back from them.

I thought your customer service was good, but they do not follow through. If you have a problem with yours, return it before the return. Is over.

title: Phone holder inaduqute to hold your phone. Do you want to risk your $1000 phone falling on ground
text: Everything is made really good except for the cheap phone holder.  I almost broke my new phone trying to use this.

title: Love this drone, battery charging problems
text:
First, I love the drone. Its my first experience with one. Very easy to fly. Automatic take off and landing works great. Return to home function is amazing. If it weren't for that, I would have lost it already. Took off one star for the charging cable. The one that came with the drone doesn't work at all. Put my own on it and it works ok. Charging is also a problem. Had the thing on the charger over night with both batteries on it. First battery was still blinking after about 8 hours of charge. Unplugged it and plugged it back in and it flashed for a few seconds then went solid green indicating it was fully charged. Having the same experience today. Its been on the charger for 5+ hours and is still charging the first battery.

I ordered a couple more batteries that come with a charger that I've seen recommended so I will see if that works better.

Overall I am very happy with it, just wish I could fly it more than every other day.

title: It's Low Cost for a reason
text:
I have flown a number of high level drones and while this one offers a number of fine features, I cannot recommend it.

-The controls are iffy depending on terrain.
-The "Return to Home" feature is highly unreliable.
-I bought a 128gig Class 10 Micro SD and the unit would not format the card nor record to it.
- The remote control eats up AA batteries at an unaffordable rate.
-Unlike DJI products this must be WiFi paired for each flight and often loses the WiFi signal.
-The unit is especially sensitive to wind ... even less than ten knots.

There are better units for not much more money. This is being returned for an upgraded to a Mavic Mini 2

title: Well Built Drone!
text: This looks to be a great drone for a more advanced beginner. I have experience already with drones, but nothing quite this nice. I watched many reviews online, and for the price point everyone seemed very impressed after initial flight. I'm in Michigan and it's snowing, so I can't fully test just yet. It arrived a day early (thanks Amazon!) and everything was packaged securely. The carrying case is very nice with probably the smoothest zipper on it I've seen anywhere. The case is rigid enough to keep it all safe. The drone itself is not flimsy at all. It seems very durable and well made. After watching so many videos I already knew how to start and calibrate, but it has a nicely detailed book that is once again packaged nicely inside the case. Loading the app was easy; as was the functionality of the app. I have higher ceilings in the house, so I did a very quick test flight and all controls and features were functioning as anticipated. Now I play the waiting game for a nicer day to fly outside. I recommend this drone to anyone that already has some basic drone flying skills. It looks to be a great purchase!

title: Garbage even for the price.
text:
First flight it took off and hovered at around 20 feet for 20 seconds then dropped from the sky and crashed on the pavement. I put no input on the controls as it was hovering and it just crashed down.

I had the HS510 and never had an issue like this.

title: Holy Stone is standing by their product, which means a lot.
text:
For the money its a decent drone, the range does leave something to be desired.

I bought this for Christmas(my wife bought it for me but I chose it).
I finally got some good weather to really put the drone through its paces, and have to say its pretty nice.
The picture quality is really good, videos are crisp and clear, and the LED lights come in handy for nighttime use(flying it around a cornfield at night was super fun!)

I am impressed with how fast the drone is, and its wind resistance is decent, but it does tend to drift when close to the ground.

The Range....is terrible for what was advertised you get maybe 1/4th of the 1.2km thats advertised... I'd prefer if it went further or if you could fly the thing past the one tree on the property without it losing connection and RTH.

Update: The thing fell out of the sky. It was Returning To Home after I pressed the button, and it lost connection approximately 100 feet(30m) from me and just fell. The motors shut down and it dropped like a rock. I have maybe 3 hours on it at this point. I did manage to get it to start up again and fly, but I have no idea why it shut down. The battery was a fresh one, and was firmly latched in its spot, so unless something vibrated lose....i dont know what happened.

SECOND UPDATE: Holy Stone contacted me based on this review and offered to replace the drone based on my negative experience, I have recieved the replacement, and will send it up as soon as I get a good day to test it out. Based on how they appear to be standing behind their product I'd say it was worth the price I paid.

I am tentatively listing this as 4 stars until I get a chance to properly put the replacement drone through its paces.

title: Best Value in drones for super high quality at an affordable price
text:
I've been a long time R/C hobbyist long before remote flying models were called drones(e.g. planes & helicopters). This is my first drone and have been wowed by the Holy Stone HS720E. Although I have wanted a camera flying drone for years after seeing my friends DJI Phantom; however, I couldn't see spending the $800-$1500 in something that I can crash and break or lose like I have done many times with my R/C hobby is the past. Recently, I have seen many competitors bringing the price down on these drones offering the same features of the high cost manufacturers. I was hesitant in falling into the cheapest price trap since I was always a believer of "you get what you pay for" but after immense research of reading many reviews online I am SO GLAD I MADE THE PURCHASE OF THE HS720E by Holy Stone. This thing is incredible, very high quality, does all the features that my friends $1000 drone does and comes with a really nice case, is compact, durable, easy to fly and provides amazing videos and pictures. I have been wowed and am now a firm believe of Best Value Shopping is real!!!

First, I must say that the case is of very high quality rubberized material and definitely provides great protection and is custom fit to have the drone, remote, battery, charger all fit in snug without movement. The instruction booklet is well written and had me up flying and taking awesome videos as soon as my batteries were charged. Even more important is the quality of materials, design, and build of the drone and remote. This screams high quality and when in flight the drone is so stable even on fairly windy days. The flight time is great too. I flown for over 20 minutes each time and each time there was still more flight time left on the battery to go longer; however, I didn't want to take any chances. The "return to home" feature really works well and a couple of times I lost site of the drone but hit that button and the drone within minutes appeared right over my head. The follow function and point of interest work really well too.

I am an engineer by trade and quite a stickler when it comes to quality of electronics and I am really impressed with this. Holy stone makes quality drones and really provides some hefty competition against those popular High Dollar drones you see at bestbuy. If you are searching for a drone to buy definitely get this one. You will be happy.

title: Very Nice Product! My Husband loves it.
text: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift and when he opened it he was like a little kid again. It has held up well considering a few light bumps into the wall and he says it is very good for first time users as well. It comes with links for how to videos which he has been watching. It did not have a memory card so he bought one for it to allow him to take video.

title: Not staying connected to phone and does not respond to controller consistently
text: It was compact and seemed inexpensive it did not control as I thought it would per the reviews in the GPS mode or the controller it would seem to lose signal with one or the other

title: Drone
text:
Excellent quality....for us there was a little learning curve but several phone calls to them ironed out our
problem which was strictly caused by us by not fully understanding. After they explained it to us, the lightbulb came on! We cannot wait to try it in an open field this summer. The quality is great and well worth the small cost!!!

title: Pretty awesome!
text: Phenomenal. Incredibly fun and so simple my 11 year old takes it up daily on his own. Camera quality is above average.

title: Performs surprisingly well for the price
text: I would say this is at the high end of the "budget drone" market, and I rated it five stars in that context. The image stabilization is quite good, and on the whole it feels like flying a "real drone" instead of a toy.

title: A great drone from a company with great customer service
text: The HS720E is a great drone for everyone, This very easy to learn and fly this drone. The 4K camera takes great pictures and video the EIS is a great feature that was added. The best thing I like about the drone is the screen on the remote, so if you lose the connection with the FPV or remote and the drone is returning to home you can still track the distance and height on the remote. The only this I would have liked to see is the FPV connection go through the remote with a cord, I have had full FPV in wide out areas out to 2,200 feat. Last holy stone has amazing customer service, they are helpful and fast with services.

title: Nice drone. Great customer service
text:
I purchased this drone and had used it several times. The video and photo quality are excellent. The drone is easy to fly.
I ended up having an unexpected technical issue with the drone and contacted Holystone. They were able to help me out and replaced the drone with no difficulty.
I was pleased that they were so willing to replace the drone so quickly, as I really do like this little UAV.

title: Some design issues. Video is nothing to rave about if you really know anything about real 4K video
text:
SEE MY UPDATE AT THE END OF THIS REVIEW -SCROLL TO THE END OF MY REVIEW

The Holy Stone 720e is the first drone I've ever owned or flown. As other reviewers have stated, it's an easy drone to fly. It's stable, GPS works well, the return to home function almost always returns it to within a couple of feet of the launch spot. The Learning Mode should be disregarded. Instead, in the menu, set the parameters of distance and height that you want to start out with. Unlike some other users, I found the distance before the return video feed dropped out to be only a few hundred feet. Fortunately, the controller reaches much farther and the Return to Home function will bring the drone back if you lose sight of it. Just be sure to set your Return to Home altitude high enough to clear any obstacles around or on the path.

VIDEO
Video is one area where I have some expertise. I've worked in broadcast television, produced BluRays, including 4K BlurRays and before retirement I worked for a major audio/video manufacturer.

The 720e frequently receives high marks for video. But there are many caveats. If you expect to create professional quality video with this drone you are likely to be disappointed unless you're prepared to spend lots of time in post production trying to clean up the files. Even using DaVinci Resolve, I'm unable to get a decent, realistic color balance.

CAMERA CONTROLS
Limited, with no manual adjustment of shutter speed or aperture. Rudimentary Brightness and Contrast controls provided in the Ophelia GO app are almost useless. Using the auto ISO setting results in constant changes in levels, particularly if you are shooting in high contrast situations. There is no real exposure control and White or near white elements in the scene are often overexposed or blown out. The dynamic range of the very small sensor is limited and because the files are highly compressed, there is little you can do to recover in post. Shooting in fixed ISO100 results in washed out images.

LENS
The fixed, wide angle lens borders on a fisheye perspective unless aimed perfectly level. Depending on swivel up or down, horizon lines will be distorted.

The internal processing skews the image towards the blue/magenta end of the spectrum, which can be corrected in post. Unfortunately, the lens suffers from severe chromatic aberrations with colored fringes around high contrast areas such as dark tree limbs against the sky. The lens on my drone was decentered with acceptably sharpness in the middle and right side of the frame, but decidedly soft on the left side.

Shooting towards the sun or a sky with bright clouds results in loss of contrast, typical of inexpensive lenses. I devised a lens hood using sticky foam tape attached on the top edge of the camera. This reduced loss of contrast dramatically, although the magenta cast in the center of the image still remains when shooting towards the sun early morning or late afternoon.

ADDITIONAL TIPS
If you want to record 4K, you will need the appropriate Micro SD card inserted in the slot of the 720e. Otherwise, the return video the Ophelia app will record to your phone or pad will be 1080P.
Once you've mastered flying to a point of reasonable skill and confidence, you'll be thinking about a drone with a larger sensor and better optics.

All said, it's an acceptable first machine and I'm enjoying the learning experience but at this point it's an interim drone that will be passed on to a friend or grandson. If only the video and still images were as good as my iPhone or any number of other smart phones.

UPDATE: After approximately a dozen flights over a four month period, the micro SD card socket failed. It refuses to seat the card, rejecting the card. Unfortunately, being one month out of warranty, Holy Stone told me the unit was not repairable but offered to sell me a new drone replacement for 15% off retail. Knowing that dealer margins are higher than 15%, I would have expected a replacement at dealer cost.

Additionally, video reception from the drone is poor with limited range, likely due to the antenna design and location. It is a straight wire protruding horizontally from the left rear about 1/2". In as much as it is likely vertically polarized it should be located vertically. I bent the wire down and it improved reception distance dramatically when flying away from the launch point. However on the return the signal is blocked by the battery, resulting in loss of signal.

So now I have a drone with very limited video range and because of the failed micro SD card socket, I'm unable to record to the card.

I have also experienced a couple of out of control crashes, one resulted in having to replace a broken motor arm.

This is not a product I could recommend with any degree of confidence.

ADDITIONAL UPDATE:

Reviewing the video files recorded on my micro SD card, I found several with the corruption suffix that I noticed before the card mechanism in the drone completely failed. This indicated to me evidence of a pending failure within a week of receipt of the 720e. I documented this and forwarded to Holy Stone. Fiona and Becky in their customer service department reviewed the data and I now have a replacement drone on the way. Thank you.

Lesson learned. If you have any indication of failures early on with any purchase, contact the suppliers customer service. Keep all your warranty and purchase information.

FOLLOW UP. The replacement 720e arrived and functions as expected. Because of the great customer service I am pleased to recommend the unit and change my review to five stars.

title: Great Fun
text: Well the company is great I had to buy another one just to see the way it was thanks holy stone your great. :-)

title: Perfect if this is your first real drone
text: This is a fabulous drone for a first real drone.  Slight learning curve but not wildly difficult.  Do you however plan to crash it a few times because you're still learning. But it's pretty hardy. I've had it fall out of the sky on me from a broken propeller from well over 12 ft and it still works just fine.

title: Awesome Customer service and great Drone
text:
Ok, I just had to do this review and praise Holystone for their product and most of all their customer service!!. I am in the medical field and I bought my drone last year, for travel and vacation. Of course its in the middle of the pandemic, I anticipated things to get better, but it only got worse. I did not open the drone back then and of course got more and more busy for work. I only opened the drone 3 weeks ago, to take some b4 and after videos of my roof that was gonna be worked on.

I found that the right front arm of the Drone was damaged, right out of the box. OK, I called Amazon that said, its a manufacturer's issue and I should call Holystone, and if I got no resolution, I should call back. I called Holystone, they told me, of course its out of the 90 day warranty, but get this? Due to my circumstance, with me being in the medical field and not getting a chance to open it until now, they will replace it, fully, at no charge to me, and I don't have to send back the broken drone. Ok, the replacement came, and guess what, the camera got stuck and only worked once. I called them again. They immediately said, we will send you yet another new drone, no cost to you, keep the other 2 drones. I was a bit upset due to the delay and my eagerness to fly the drone. Still,, the third drone came, and, as they say, 3rd times a charm. I am happy with the replacement, and now, I actually have 3 drones. I will fix both the arm on the first and the camera on the 2nd, and fly them all. These guys at Holystone are awesome.
The HS720E takes awesome videos and pictures, is easy to fly, and for the money spent, it is an awesome product so far. Thanks for listening and resolving my situation HolyStone!!

title: Unstable, especially in light winds.
text: I would not recommend. Very unstable even after multiple successful calibrations.. I managed to get about three stable flights, other attempts were unsuccessful. The drone will hover then just take off on its own. There’s no way that I would trust this drone to fly on its own. Great camera that’s rendered useless if you can’t trust it to fly where you tell it. I found that it also lacks enough power even in the slightest wind. Absolutely could not handle 10 mph gusts. Quality is good but unfortunately I don’t think the consistency of performance is up to par. I will be returning and looking probably in a higher price range.

title: Loses connection and goes AWOL
text: I have a number of drones with "real" controllers and have no issues. This one appears to use WiFi on your phone to control it (you can't fly it without attaching a phone). I flew it in my living room on Christmas with no issues. Very stable in the air. But when I took it outside it stops responding to commands at about 50' away with a clear line of sight. I have to use the return-to-home feature to get it back. Was flying in my living room last night and it went AWOL from the controller, went full throttle, and started bouncing off things... TV, wall, ceiling, and couch. Zero control. Kill switches and throttle kill didn't work. Slight damage to my ceiling. Luckily no damage to my TV. There is a Reddit group for owners of these and others are reporting the same issue. When you call the "support" line it is a call center that is reading from a script. On the plus side - It is a very nice size, is very stable at hover and the camera is very, very good. But if the drone is going to go AWOL and fly away, what good is it?  Most drones when they lose connection to the controller will enter a fail-safe mode and return to home automatically. This drone doesn't.  I have requested an exchange. If the process is easy to use and the new drone flies correctly I will update this review.

title: Unexpected failure. UPDATE: VERY SATISFIED
text:
Second flight and one of the blades sheared off sending the drone that was set to ‘slow’ racing off. Hit the RTH - nothing - the drone found the trees.
Upon retrieval entire blade was missing - no wonder it took off to one side and the RTH did not function.

UPDATE: 5 stars for service and prompt resolution, within 2 days. Definitely a company that stands busy their product.

title: Great Drone & Very Easy To Operate!
text: I got my Drone and it was very easy to get everything set up and I use it all the time now! The best thing for me and I will use this for a very long time!

title: Great quality images and great for newbies
text: I never flew a drone before and it was very straight forward to get it up and flying. It’s def not a toy either. Excellent construction and image quality!!!! Overall one of the best gifts I’ve ever received!!!

title: nice drone
text: very nice drone for beginner, good customer service

title: Great little drone
text: Awesome little drone for the cost. Intuitive to use for a beginner as well however recommend watching a few YouTube videos before flying and setting up. Had a. Issue with front right arm and company made good with sending a new one. A tad difficult to replace and would prefer to have plug connections on the motor leads than having to soldering them to the circuit board. but at the end of the day it is manageable of doing.

title: Good entry drone for beginners.
text: I liked the manual’s presentation which shortened the learning curve on flying this drone.  The drone came in a very nice compact case that made it easy to carry with you on vacation or just out to a place to fly.  The drone itself is very easy to fly and produces nice video or stills to support my photography hobby.  The return to home works really well and it does pretty well in wind.  My only wish is that it had a 3 way gimbal that would improve the steadiness of the video and keep the horizon on level.  But, for the money, it does a good job.

title: Many great features, easy to control/fly
text:
Customer service is very helpful. The only delay I have had in responses are due to time differences. Otherwise the many team members I have talked to have been great. I purchased the HS720E as an intro to the 4K drone filming. I have had many other drones and I wanted to give this one a try. I have only had it short time, so I will update this review if anything changes.
On first impressions, the drone is a lot smaller than I thought it would be. The 720E has a small carrying case, which seems to be nicely crafted. This makes it easy to take along for almost any trip or event. It also came with 2 batteries and a charger.
The initial setup is relatively easy and strait forward. It only took 15-20minutes from opening the box to flying (minus battery charge time). After first flight, it is super quick to pull out, unfold, pair, and fly. On a full battery, I was able to fly for nearly 30minutes in slightly gusty wind.
In the lowest speed mode, the drone moves very slowly which seems to make a nice smooth picture. Video quality looks great, but the controls can be a little jumpy. Need to practice a little more with this drone to see if it’s me or the controls. I have added a quick video as an example. The video was taken during a slightly gusty time (2-6mph) to test GPS and EIS.
Pros:
GPS auto return
Single button take off and landing.
Slow speed flight with EIS helps make for a nice picture.
Follow me, point of interest, way point flight are great features and work fairly well.
Size - great for anywhere
Controller feels nice in hands, app has nice features
Customer service is great!

Cons:
Battery charger only charges 1 battery at a time, even though both batteries can be plugged in at once.
Charging the batteries takes 5+ hour per battery.
Only has 2 speeds, slow (tripod mode) and high (which is more like a medium).

title: Great customer service.
text: I got this for my husband as  beginner drone for Christmas. We were having some difficulty, and contacted customer service, who went above and beyond to help rectify our problem.  He is now having a great time with his drone. It has been a lot of fun for a first drone, and is easy to learn on.  I recommend this company and it's commitment to it's customers.

title: Small drone Big heart
text:
Beautiful design and awesome features. Feels well balanced and solid. Picture and video quality is very nice. Handling is smooth even at high speed gear. Took it out to almost 400ft distance and a altitude of 101ft. This is my first drone and I strongly feel I made a great choice. This will be coming with me to all my camping , boating,biking ,vacations etc. A lot of beautiful memories with my family will be made with this drone. And I can’t wait!
Thank you Holy Stone

title: Amazing little drone
text:
Very pleased with this product, I will be posting flight videos to YouTube @MJ Casa Adventures if you are curious about video quality.

As far as setup is concerned, it is very easy and user friendly. I do recommend taking the time to read the entire manual as there was some valuable information within the pages.

Happy flying!

title: Excellent Drone
text:
Read the instructions carefully and ensure you have calibrated it and that you have as many GPS links as possible before flying.
I had some issues - topping out at 49 ft, not rotating in place - that were resolved by learning the App and getting a good GPS signal.
I like it and recommend it.

title: Camera app only works out of the box on some androids
text: Nice sturdy product. Did have an issue with Ophelia app as the camera did not communicate. Looking online this is not unusual till you find out putting your phone in airplane mode during use resolves the issue.

title: Drone is 5-Star, Video Control App has no Documentation
text:
This is a work in progress. Initial unboxing and flight testing went well in my immediate area (15-20 feet).
Downloaded "Ophelia Go" app (no app instructions - Default is beginners mode that limits height & distance. Poke around the internet & YouTube for limited info).

This is an update . . . The original HS720e was immediately replaced by Holy Stone. Outstanding customer service!! I really don't know if the original drone or its controller had a manufacturer defect but the new unit appears to function correctly. However, there is a growing consensus within the drone community that the Ophelia GO control app is causing a significant degradation in drone performance. This drone will fly to the advertised distance without the phone/app interface (flying blind). With a phone for visual interface and advance control, thing become unpredictable. Quite a few people report visual feedback to the phone stops at roughly 350 meters. Control interface is lost shortly thereafter with Return-To-Home activated.

There is no documentation available for the Ophelia GO control app. Users are literally try to figure it out on their own. I think the HS720e itself is a 5-start drone, the software that controls it is so bad that it drags the rating down.

title: Holystone HS720E Review
text: This is my first drone.  Is friendly to use.  Sometimes, the connection with Ophelia app is unstable but when resolved operate well.  The image stabilization is good and resolution are great.  It is highly recommend operate in a open area until dominate the control and the command response times.  Finally, do not feel bad if you crash the drone during learning affortunatly spare parts are available.

title: A Very Nice Drone
text: Drone comes in a really nice case. Easy to set up and use. Great camera. Comes with 2 batteries too. All this at a price that is very affordable.

title: Lots of fun  easy to fly great price one day dilverly 😎
text: Well what can I say this is a great drone HS720e I'm new to flying after reading the manual a few times and taking it out to a big field to fly it was very easy I was very surprised how smooth it flew had a little wind not a problem the control was nice and easy to operate I really like the return to home after loosing site of it a few times work's fantastic, very well made  I did watch a videos on you tube good one is Captain drone I would suggest that if you are thinking of buying , also I had a few questions about the video was not working on my phone it was not do to the drone it was do to my Android phone moto e 2020 cell phone I have a SD card installed and I down load to my computer Wow what very nice  sharp and clear pictures very happy also working with Holystone  Cathy in customer support has been great they go out of there way to help , I had a question I sent a e mail  on Saturday and I had a answer Sunday night ,how is that for service.😀 I hope this helps any one thinking about buying a drone this is a great unit and price. Have fun..😁

title: Nice flying drone that's easy to learn
text: This is actually my first drone and it is everything it says it would be. I bought it for the 4K camera, relatively small size (not DJI Mini small but still less than 500g), generous included accessories, and good reviews for how it flew. It did not disappoint on any of those fronts. Instruction manual was actually done with good detail and in understandable English. Drone flew like a champ the first time and was steady and easy to control. Initial video and pictures look good. Very pleased.

title: A
text: A

title: Yaw (turning on the vertical axis) issue.
text:
Out of the box, the HS720E is having an intermittent issue of not wanting to turn on the vertical axis (yaw). Batteries are fully charged in both drone and controller. Calibration completed successfully. I have sent Holy Stone an email. Not sure if this is an app issue or a mechanical/ programming issue.

Lets see how their customer service/ tech help replies.

title: It is very easy to get started. 720e makes it simple
text: Flying a drone can be intimidating at first but 720e makes it simpler. I did have some issue with the software - follow me function didn't work even though gps was accurate and go home feature worked fine. I contacted the company and they responded within a day. Highly recommend for beginners.

title: Great folding drone at a good price
text:
[[VIDEOID:e6089609489325ad7708617d78b79c81]] I have been away from drone for a few years. I'm no die-hard at this but I recently wanted back in. After reviewing various drones with GPS capability (using your phone to help steer and navigate the drone) I found this one, the Holy Stone 720e.

Everything others said was good about it really is. It comes with the drone, a set of replacement props and screwdriver, a 4K digitally stabilized movable camera, controller, manual and nice hard shell case.

It's foldable arms make it really easy to transport and store away. It's got some heft to it and the flight time is really around 23 minutes per battery. Plenty of time to sail it off, play in the sky and return it.

It maintains its altitude and position on it's own. These are features beginners love. Once linked with GPS you can sail it off and with a click of a button have it return and set down pretty much where it took off from.

The camera is first rate with 4K resolution and swivels from forward through 90 degrees downward. Strong winds cause jitter on the recording which is complete expected. At this price there only so much they can do. In light wind and no wind, the picture quality is "to die for".

You get two powerful batteries that recharge in 5 hrs at most at the same time. An instruction manual that goes over every feature and extra props and screw driver to make fixing those early crashes easy.

To fly it, you put in a charged battery, turn it on, connect your phone directly to it's WIFI, turn on your controller, get GPS signals and launch it. It's really fairly simple. Don't want the GPS assist, turn it off and launch.

I gave 5 stars to the drone in every category because this is an excellent casual unit, good for non-die-hards and beginners. It's controller has useful features that you need and more for variety. It manages the drone comfortably.

I've include a still taken overhead of my house and one video I recoded to a smaller size to include in this review. This really is a fun drone.

title: MUST REGISTER WITH FAA
text:
Due to weight you do have to register the drone with FAA but only takes 5 minutes and a $5 registration for 3 years. I have only flown this drone twice and picture quality is amazing! Make sure to buy a micro sd card because if you're trusting your phone to record it will 'skip' frames but on the sd card it is smooth.

ALSO!!! The app will start you in beginner mode which only allows you to go about 50 feet... and when you hit that invisible barrier only half of your controls will work.. I think the reasoning behind this is it forces you to turn around and come back.. you can turn that off but its a good feature to get your feet wet which is great for me because this is my first drone.

title: Save $100 more and get a real Drone
text: Save $100 more and get a Dji Drone.this drone ain't worth that price.get the dji mini se better.Dji mini SE way!!! Better than this

title: Awesome.
text: Very good buy, for the price does a lot. A lot of fun to be had.

title: Good Low Budget Drone
text: I like the camera quality. Thus far I am enjoying it particularly the ability to adjust the flight settings in the app from beginners mode.

title: A bunch of fun flying this drone
text: Excellent drone to fly. As a beginner I enjoy learning something new about it each time that I fly it. I highly recommend this HolyStone drone.

title: Really good quality
text: This drone came fast and it Flys  nice.  And yes I would recommend for anyone to buy this drone.

title: Made well, like the DJI Mavic
text: Great drone, portable, flies and responds well, nice carry case and made well.  Fun and satisfying.  Great for roof inspections.

title: First drone
text:
Update to the update.
Customer service is awesome. After explaining everything that happened in great detail and going through the process a one tine replacement will be sent out. 👍🏻 Cant wait to get back to learning I’ll post another update after learning again.

Update review
Well second flight. Played with orbit and follow me and did some up and down to learn functions the went to fly about fifty foot circle and wow it just took off straight a head. None of the controls worked like return home and the emergency stop to no avail and after searching for over three hours no where to be found. Waste of my cash.
I just received this holy stone 720e today (first drone ever). And after watching you tube for the last two days. And reading instructions today. I was able to take a short flight and really enjoyed the ease of operation and the controls. I’m sure in time I’ll get better with all the functions but till then I’ll be happy to have fun flying Thank you for making an awesome product

title: Excellent Product + User Friendly + Awesome Quality
text: This drone offers excellent quality and features at a low cost. Customer support goes above and beyond to meet your needs.  Its very easy to fly and quality of the video is like you spent thousands of dollars on it. I really like the return to Home feature and the image stabilizer. Makes a rookie look like a Pro.

title: Fun
text: Had some problems at the beginning, but I was able to work with the company, returned one. The one I have now for about 6 weeks is working very will. It connects to the control and my phone. Follows commands, it's fun to fly.

title: User Friendly
text: Easy to use, great battery life, portable, storable.  Awesome video, (4k is amazing) Remote is intuitive. App works fantastic with IOS. GPS feature is amazing.  I'm still learning about all the features but its fantastic so far.

title: Great first drone. Great to learn to fly with.
text: [[VIDEOID:560d65fd1924b7b3c798050d13972e7d]] This is my first drone. It is great for beginners. I used the safety fly mode at first the i turned that off to allow myself to fully operate the drone. Tripod mode is awesome. Remeber it uses wifi to connect to your phone so keep range in mind. In theory tho you could see if an range extender could be used paired with a power inverter to keep video alive. It has return to home but i am too scared to try rth just yet. Overall i am pleased with holy stone. Hopefully i can get some good footage and get some good clips to edit.

title: Amazing drone.  All the features of the more expensive drones
text: [[VIDEOID:f8dd9e2adc019654c7d3e0c9936972fb]] Holy Stone packed all the features of the much more expensive drones at a fraction of the price.  This is for sure a very easy and fun drone to fly.  One key take-off and land, return to home, follow me and orbit just to name a few.  The 4K camera takes very good pictures and videos.  The EIS (Electric Image Stabilization) makes both the pictures and video much more stable!!!  The controller is so easy to use and fit in your hand very well.  Did I forget to mention that this drone comes with two batteries and a case!  What more can you ask for?  I would for sure recommend that Holy Stone HS720E to anyone looking for a feature-packed drone at a great price.

title: My Drone Wishes Fulfilled
text:
[[VIDEOID:664063e9519c0a1b2b3ec8496ca7429]] Although I was a complete drone neophyte a month ago, I've been attempting to pick it up at every possible turn. I bought a Holy Stone HS110D a month ago after scouring drone listings and scoffing at the ridiculous prices. Little did I know I was receiving an experience on-par with what those more expensive drones had to offer.

I took it out for a spin, realized I needed to become a better pilot before sending this $100 item whirling through the air, and made the decision to pick up a toy drone for some indoor practice. After seeing what was offered and thinking about my Holy Stone experience thus far, I decided to go with the same brand again.

I bought an HS340 and began using it every chance I could get. I bought extra batteries and, at the same time, purchased enough replacement parts for my HS110D to keep it going for the foreseeable future. I was sold on Holy Stone and my drone piloting skills were getting better day over day. I started becoming more comfortable with the HS110D, understanding more about wash and how to take off and land properly, the impact flying upwind and downwind had on speed, and how to generally keep the drone under my control.

While I was loving the experience and becoming more comfortable with drone flying in general, it became more and more clear that I was more interested in taking photos and videos than I was in flying the drone itself. It's fun to fly, and I'm grateful for being a more capable pilot and living up to the FAA's expectations of me, but I really just want to take great aerial shots.

I sat back down and began my research. The HS110D doesn't have GPS capability and, as I learned, since the GPS allows the drone to maintain position, it was going to be key to taking some good pictures. I also learned how important gimbles and stabilization were. When I looked at the drones offering those features, the prices started making my head spin again. Although I didn't want to cubbyhole myself into the same brand if that wasn't going to be the right fit, and wanted to keep an open mind, it soon became clear that the best choice would be to continue my journey with Holy Stone.

I kept running across their name in independent lists of the best drones under $500 for, not only taking pictures, but handling wind, which had been one of my issues as well (it being March, the windy month, in the southeast U.S.). At this point, I was already familiar with their lineup, so I went straight to the model I kept seeing in those lists: the HS720E.

The drone had a 4K capable camera, electronic image stabilization, and GPS. I was excited to see the price and quickly decided to buy it. The morning it came in, winds were 15 mph with 28 mph gusts. I approached flying cautiously, but just had to see how it handled in those conditions. After my experience with the non-GPS drones, I was flabbergasted. I launched it and there it sat, hovering in the air, not moving more than a foot from the target with gusts and reliably moving right back to where it started each and every time.

Each day since, the wind has been a challenge and would be for nearly any drone, but I've managed to take it up at some point each day, getting more and more comfortable sending this $300 object whirling off into the air. In-fact, I'm more comfortable sending this $300 drone through the air than I was the $100 one.

The skills I picked up manually flying the HS340 and HS110D and ensuring it remained in the same spot were useful but are seeming less and less needed with the HS720E. This thing really does stay where you put it and the distance and height indicators on the remote are extremely useful. I would wager that you could fly this entirely with those two indicators because you always know exactly how high and far it is from the launch site.

The features in the app seem to work well and offer a wealth of options concerning the RTH feature. If you're using this for the first time and seeing that it doesn't fly far, be aware that it comes in beginner mode. I was extremely happy to see this.

By default, the drone won't fly higher or father than 49 feet. You can change those to the maximum range or decide to keep them at a lower setting to keep you in the clear. Say, for instance, there are trees all around you at a distance of 100 feet and canopies extending out, but at a heigh of 100 feet. You can set the maximum distance and height to, say, 90 feet, and never worry about the drone drifting into the trees.

Beyond that, the GPS adds so much more than automatic hovering. You can define the path you want it to follow using a map inside the Ophelia Go app. You take the drone above the treetops and draw out your path. After following it you can use the return-to-home feature to bring it right back to you (just make sure you set your maximum height and distance settings properly!).

The camera quality doesn't disappoint, though it's certainly not a Go-Pro. Although it can take shots in nearly any level of light, images look best when taken with good lighting. The camera looked a bit washed out on the HS110D, but not on the HS720E. When my wife saw the first video she said, "You could take shots for real movies with that." It's really smooth, even when the drone has a considerable amount of drift. No, it's not the same level of stabilization you get from a mount of course, but for my purposes, it's absolutely perfect.

The ability to angle the camera was even more useful than I thought as well. I can easily tilt it down when manually landing or taking off to ensure I maintain position, not needing to rely quite as much on how adept my depth perception is. When you tilt it to maximum position, you do see the props, but tilting it down just slightly gets over this and is in-fact a perfect angle for aerial photography. The way I look at it, the straight-forward view on this drone is best for FPV.

Not considering the flying abilities for a moment, this drone just feels solid. While the lightness of the HS110D was impressive in its own way, the heaviness of this is impressive in another. It's just enough to add more wind handling capabilities and has 43% more battery power than the HS110D to-boot, so they obviously found a great balance between weight and capability. I've been buying electronics for, gosh... sigh, I'm old... 30 years now and I can tell you this is just pure quality. It feels like a premium item.

I know this review is getting longer and longer, but there are just so many impressive features here. The case the product comes with is extremely nice and I don't see it wearing out anytime soon. I would have expected to pay close to $50for the case alone. And, considering the batteries cost $45 on Amazon, you wouldn't necessarily expect to get 2 of them, but Holy Stone gives you an extra one. They also give you some extra props, although I decided to go ahead and buy some extras.

Well, the wind just died down and I'm going back out with my drone! I hope this review can provide some insight. If you're nerve-wracked over whether to make such a pricey purchase, but you've had fun with less expensive drones and want to take a step-up, I'd say to go ahead and buy it! If you can afford the more expensive drones but are considering this because it seems to have the features you want, I'd tell you to buy it too! I've seen plenty of videos where people have a DJI or Parrot along with this one and are testing them both out, often with more success out of the Holy Stone.

Look, I know there's got to be a reason to buy a $1,000, $2,000, or $3,000 drone, but I'm not on a tight production timeline, trying to get a movie filmed in the face of hurricane strength winds, I don't need this for espionage, and I'm not trying to deliver anything with it or rescue fallen hikers - I think the HS720E is perfect and I'm extremely happy with my purchase.

Note: If you're having trouble with video stuttering, it could be your SD card. I was having that issue and purchased a new SD card today with higher write speeds. A quick test showed the problem was resolved, but I haven't taken any stunning videos or photos with the new card just yet.

Video Note: The winds died down enough for me to take it up. This video is brief. I set the return to home to 75 feet, pressed auto-takeoff, then return-to-home. I've tested the RTH upwards of 40 times at this point with no issue. I'll be posting a better video demonstrating panning and the like as soon as I'm able to get to a field or park. Also please note that after watching this video on the reviews page, I notice the Amazon player has pixelization when the tree is in-frame and stutters. The video from the drone was perfect with no stuttering and no pixelization artifacts. The quality, although close, does also appear to be slightly lower on the Amazon page.

4/23 Update: The video the note above referenced has been replaced, but I wanted to leave it and the other notes there for posterity. I've had a chance to take the drone to a local park and fly unencumbered. I've had no change in opinion, this drone is awesome.

The newly posted video is a step-up from the previous and compiled from clips taken once the wind died down a bit in April. While I'm pretty happy with it, it wasn't a planned montage. My next goal will be to completely plan out each shot before flying and editing. I'll post an update once it's ready!

title: 2nd HS drone. 1st one wasn't good. This one is great so far but App needs improvement. UPDATED.
text:
UPDATE 2: Went to fly the drone to take a video to send to HS since they requested it showing the app issue I’ve been having. As soon as the drone lifted off the ground it became unresponsive. Just kept flying up and away. Tried manual controls on the remote, nothing. Tried emergency stop button, nothing. It’s like it just didn’t want to respond to anything. After a few emails back and forth with HS customer service where they asked me a bunch of questions, they have agreed to send me a replacement. I’m hoping the replacement drone doesn’t have these issues. The app issue seems to still be the same. So I’m also hoping that gets fixed soon. I think it’s a great drone but the original issues with the app and now this fly away situation, makes me have doubts about this drone. But I’m staying optimistic and hopeful. Maybe the original one was just a fluke and got past HS quality assurance dept. Will update review once I receive the replacement.

UPDATE 1: Been in contact with HS customer service regarding the app issue. Drone keeps loosing connectivity with phone. FPV looses connectivity and no image is displayed. Even within close proximity. HS customer service is telling me to try with Android device. Told them I don't own an Android device. They then told me to borrow an Android device in order to try the Android version of the Ophelia Go app. At this point, unless they can actually help with this issue, I may just have to return the drone. Not much choice left. If the app doesn't work as intended, then I can't use the drone's intelligent flight functions like follow me, tap to fly, ect. Good thing that at least the controller and drone seem to remain connected and I can fly the drone that way. Waiting for a reply from HS customer service. We'll see what they say.

ORIGINAL REVIEW: I've had this drone for about two weeks now. So far it's been pretty good but also has some issues. More on that below.

Pros:
Two batteries providing 25 mins of flight time each; timed the flight time. 4K footage is great. EIS helps keep the footage stable. Really fast on high speed. Very stable on low speed. Seems very durable and well built. Even when loosing FPV connectivity, you can continue controlling the drone with the transmitter. LCD screen on transmitter is great and flight telemetry is great to have. Love the red & green lights on the bottom. Along with the white landing lights. They're great at night when identifying the drone in the dark sky. The RTH feature is great. Comes back on it's on when battery is low or when loosing connectivity. Having the GPS and RTH feature, it seems impossible to loose the drone. The single button props unlock is great and different from other drones where you have to use a combination of both joysticks.

I don't want to fault the drone itself for the below but you can have the hardware without the software and vice versa.

Cons:
With the latest app update on iOS, the app keeps crashing. Also, when the drone goes past the 500M FPV distance limitation, the image freezes but doesn't refresh when back within range. It's even loosing connectivity while it's within the 500M FPV range. When trying the waypoints feature the map on the app doesn't load up, and when it does, it's very laggy. Comparing this to other drone apps where you can see the actual drone on the app screen/map, it doesn't show it on the Ophelia Go app. Not a huge fan of the dual battery charger. Battery can easily come disconnected. Seems difficult to use. Would rather have a microUSB connector like on other drones. The only bad thing about RTH is that the drone returns flying in a backwards facing position. You can always spin it around to face the direction it's flying back in, but I think it should do that on it's own.

So overall, great drone. Super fun to fly. Great flight time. But the app is not the greatest. Sure you can fly the drone without the app, but then you don't have the features the app is suppose to provide.

title: Loses connection easily; resolution doesn't look 4K; spare parts n/a
text:
Update: Two months ago a spare battery charger wasn't available on Amazon and shipments from China have taken more than the promised 25 days. Now the conroller for the 720e is not available at the holy stone store or Amazon, where it refers you. Wondering if this is a discontinued product.
ORIGINAL: Wanted badly to like this drone. Packs up neatly; appears solid; runs quieter than DJI and Bebop 2 drones I've used BUT the first major problem I noticed was a LOT of jerkiness. Which HS now says is partly due to their controller needing an update. However, I was flying with the latest update available just two days before they said that, so that seems doubtful. As others have noted here and elsewhere, a simple rotation command results in the drone drifting badly or rotating VERY jerkily. This, in comparison to my older Bebop 2, and older DJI 3 and 4's. Of course it is cheaper than DJI. But the Bebop has only its fisheye lens and no gimbal, and makes this 720E appear to have NO electronic stabilization ! Unless I got a lemon, the resolution was also no better than the Parrot's Bebop 2, when set to highest resolutions available for both video or still shots. The sod field shot did not lend itself to trying to zoom in very well at all. RANGE: Most worrisome was that using a Pixel 4xl Android phone in VERY rural areas without broadband service, I still lost connection within hundreds of feet. Fortunately, the RTH worked on the controller but not in the Android app. And the connection did not restore itself automatically--I had to manually re-connect to the drone once it was near my controller/phone location again. Although the phone indicated a good Wifi connection, the app did not. This happened twice, in rural areas 10 miles apart, on two separate batteries, fresh, both within less than 500-800' away. Before that, the video would 'jump' during rotations or manuevers as well. As others noted, there was a big lag time in video many times, so that you over-rotated or over-corrected because of the great lag. Never had that happen with Bebop or DJIs. No apparent reason for that jerkiness or that lag time or lack of feedback time. I do not know how some of the reviewers got "cinematography results" but this was NOT usable footage for anything with an artistic purpose, and almost prevents basic operations, so I returned the unit. I reported this to HS and maybe 5 different reps emailed me with suggestions. It appeared they were not reading my details or each other's preceding emails in the chain of emails. I believe that using 5 gHz in wifi,while less crowded, is not a good choice when trying to get good range--higher frequencies may have greater bandwidth ability, but they usually have less range as tradeoff. HS reps kept blaming my Google Pixel 4xl as if it did not have dual band wifi,which is clearly not true. Some other drones connect your cellphone to their controller via usb cable and that provides a more reliable link, not dependent upon radio waves. HS appears to link your cellphone directly to the drone for app video/telemetry and wifi at 5g and no directional antenna in your phone / drone, is not good for that, IMHO. The controller, meanwhile, does have at least one active stubby antenna, and fortunately it was able to transmit the Return Home signal to the drone while the cell phone app by HS failed. Tried to post this several days ago but this site wasn't accepting 'verified purchaser' reviews so I was unable to counteract the higher reviews posted earlier. In summary, WAY too jerky for no explicable reason (not a wind factor involved there); way too much lagtime; too short a range despite rural area; the camera resolution did not appear 4K, subjectively speaking. It would have been even worse on a large screen. Hoping HS can work out the erratic controller jerkiness, maybe revert to 2gHz wifi linking, and somehow get better resolution recorded to the SD card because my SD card video wasn't that much sharper than what was later played back from SD card at higher rez.

title: Loses connection easily; resolution doesn't look 4K; spare parts n/a
text:
Update: Two months ago a spare battery charger wasn't available on Amazon and shipments from China have taken more than the promised 25 days. Now the conroller for the 720e is not available at the holy stone store or Amazon, where it refers you. Wondering if this is a discontinued product.
ORIGINAL: Wanted badly to like this drone. Packs up neatly; appears solid; runs quieter than DJI and Bebop 2 drones I've used BUT the first major problem I noticed was a LOT of jerkiness. Which HS now says is partly due to their controller needing an update. However, I was flying with the latest update available just two days before they said that, so that seems doubtful. As others have noted here and elsewhere, a simple rotation command results in the drone drifting badly or rotating VERY jerkily. This, in comparison to my older Bebop 2, and older DJI 3 and 4's. Of course it is cheaper than DJI. But the Bebop has only its fisheye lens and no gimbal, and makes this 720E appear to have NO electronic stabilization ! Unless I got a lemon, the resolution was also no better than the Parrot's Bebop 2, when set to highest resolutions available for both video or still shots. The sod field shot did not lend itself to trying to zoom in very well at all. RANGE: Most worrisome was that using a Pixel 4xl Android phone in VERY rural areas without broadband service, I still lost connection within hundreds of feet. Fortunately, the RTH worked on the controller but not in the Android app. And the connection did not restore itself automatically--I had to manually re-connect to the drone once it was near my controller/phone location again. Although the phone indicated a good Wifi connection, the app did not. This happened twice, in rural areas 10 miles apart, on two separate batteries, fresh, both within less than 500-800' away. Before that, the video would 'jump' during rotations or manuevers as well. As others noted, there was a big lag time in video many times, so that you over-rotated or over-corrected because of the great lag. Never had that happen with Bebop or DJIs. No apparent reason for that jerkiness or that lag time or lack of feedback time. I do not know how some of the reviewers got "cinematography results" but this was NOT usable footage for anything with an artistic purpose, and almost prevents basic operations, so I returned the unit. I reported this to HS and maybe 5 different reps emailed me with suggestions. It appeared they were not reading my details or each other's preceding emails in the chain of emails. I believe that using 5 gHz in wifi,while less crowded, is not a good choice when trying to get good range--higher frequencies may have greater bandwidth ability, but they usually have less range as tradeoff. HS reps kept blaming my Google Pixel 4xl as if it did not have dual band wifi,which is clearly not true. Some other drones connect your cellphone to their controller via usb cable and that provides a more reliable link, not dependent upon radio waves. HS appears to link your cellphone directly to the drone for app video/telemetry and wifi at 5g and no directional antenna in your phone / drone, is not good for that, IMHO. The controller, meanwhile, does have at least one active stubby antenna, and fortunately it was able to transmit the Return Home signal to the drone while the cell phone app by HS failed. Tried to post this several days ago but this site wasn't accepting 'verified purchaser' reviews so I was unable to counteract the higher reviews posted earlier. In summary, WAY too jerky for no explicable reason (not a wind factor involved there); way too much lagtime; too short a range despite rural area; the camera resolution did not appear 4K, subjectively speaking. It would have been even worse on a large screen. Hoping HS can work out the erratic controller jerkiness, maybe revert to 2gHz wifi linking, and somehow get better resolution recorded to the SD card because my SD card video wasn't that much sharper than what was later played back from SD card at higher rez.

title: uncontrollable
text: This is not a beginner's drone--and that's OK. We knew that going in and spent the time to read the manual and set it up. It flew predictably for the first three flights. The fourth flight went fine until the battery reached 50%. The drone took off vertically on its own. We could not control it, and it crashed into some tall trees and fell to the grounds, badly damaged.

title: High quality build, easy to learn.
text: Best drone I have, also the most expensive. The expense though is worth it, it looks and feels very high quality, not like the "toy" drones. The default beginner mode settings also make this drone easy to fly.

title: Disappointed
text: The first time i flew my new Holystone 720E I was very happy.  Easy to use, good performance, great camera.  Alas, it did not last.  My third time flying it, the front right motor failed.  I thought it was the props.  But that wasnt the case. It would try to start spinning, but only jerk and sputter a few times while the other props spooled up.  Tried everything,  couldn't get it to work.  Amazon was nice enough to process a refund.  Very disappointed.

title: Re-evaluation of Holy Stone 720E
text:
After doing a reasonable amount of research regarding the average ratings of various drones currently available on Amazon, I selected the HolyStone-720E and was very much looking forward to this item (my birthday present). Consequently, I re-read the instructions several times, and then placed the drone on the ground and attempted to locate the drone signal with my cell phone. Sadly, that's as far as I got - it never got off the ground, because no matter what I tried, there was absolutely no drone signal at all. The familiar names of all the neighboring wi-fi signals from surrounding homes were there - but none from the Holy Stone drone. My son also tried it several times - but again, no luck. Finally, we spoke with a Holy Stone Customer Service agent. After confirming that my Samsung S10+ and my wife's 4 month old Apple phone were both on the 'approved' list, we tried it once again while the agent was still on the phone. And, once again, a drone signal could not be found. The agent then checked several phone settings, but they were fine. He concluded that the drone was faulty and that we should return it and have a replacement sent out. After concluding this conversation, we even tried my wife's iPhone, without success. I recognize that no electronic item is 'perfect' and that a certain number will fail once they leave the factory. While this model had good reviews overall, I did not want to risk going through the same thing with a replacement drone, so I simply chose to return it for credit. I very much wanted this drone to work. Based on the number of positive reviews this has received, I believe that it's likely that a replacement would have worked properly. So, if there is any fault in the situation, it lies with me in not allowing Holy Stone a 'second chance'.
==============================
I have now upgraded my review of this drone to five stars. I reconsidered and was sent a second drone to evaluate. After re-reading all instructions, I took the drone to a nearby park; found a spot with no trees within 75 yards in any direction; then placed it on a large sheet of cardboard (from a box I dismantled). I am pleased to report that it rose about 50 feet above me and I flew it around me in several directions until I was certain that the controls worked well. I can now recommend this 720E drone. Well Done Holy Stone!

title: THE MANUFACTER BACKS THEIR PRODUCT
text: Holy Stone has done good here, as I had the misfortune of a bad experience. My drone suffered a broken arm within a minute of a first flight attempt. I was a little upset. So, I was very surprised when Holy Stone contacted me directly about the issue. Today Holy Stone has totally replaced my drone with a new one!  They pay attention to their customers, which is not common place.  Perhaps I should of contacted the company in the first place, as it really surprised me when they contacted me first. The new drone seems to be working flawlessly. Now it's time to make some countryside videos. :-D

title: Very nice drone!
text: Great drone, takes really nice photos and video.  Having 2 batteries is nice addition so you can enjoy more flight time

title: Great drone for the price
text: I bought a used drone from Amazon and the drone was in very good shape for a fraction of the cost.

title: Nice Drone!
text: The manual is fairly thorough, but doesn't actually tell what needs to be done and in what order, or whether you can use just the controller or just your phone or you have to use both. Also doesn't say whether turning gps off automatically turns on the optical sensors for indoor flying. Several times the drone has taken off from a hover for no reason and you have to countersteer it until it stops moving around! It is pretty fast, has red lights in front and green in back so you can tell what direction its facing in the dark. Charger charges both batteries at the same time, which is nice. Case is nice as with all HS products. Haven't used it much yet,  you definitely need room, the rth function needs alot of room overhead! Look forward to many hours of flying fun!

title: Well-designed, fully-functional RC drone
text: Well-designed, fully-functional RC drone with higher level features. RC incorporates video via cell phone. Easy to learn. Priced competitively.

title: Excellent performance and value, and easy to learn for beginners
text: I photograph for historical societies, taking pictures of their properties and fund raising events. Up to this point, all my photography has been still images, mostly for use on their website and occasionally for print purposes. One thing they've been asking me for is drone photography, and so I decided to find a sensibly priced drone with good photo and video capabilities. I watched maybe a dozen online videos and decided that this drone had a good balance of quality, features, and price. I am not disappointed. The learning curve is pretty short, and I was up and running pretty much right away. Controls are easy to master, and there's some duplication between the remote control and your phone, using the prescribed app. Every function worked perfectly; take off is super simple and landing can be done manually or by allowing the drone to return home. I had connection with 17 (yes 17) GPS satellites. I'm not using a 5G phone, but it worked flawlessly with my iPhone X Max. The cell phone holder on the remote control is large enough to handle big phones like this one. There is a limitation to the movement of the drone's camera. It only rotates on one axis. It will pivot up to 90 degrees up or down, but not side to side, etc. For some that might be a problem, but at this price point that's what you can generally expect. The drone comes in a really good case, and has a set of propellers, miscellaneous parts, and a screwdriver. The instruction manual is thick, but that's because it comes in three languages. Mine looked like English, German, and Italian. Anyway, this is a product you need to consider when you put your list together. I don't think you'll be disappointed.

title: Easy for anyone to fly
text: Although this is very easy to fly, very young or those that have never used a drone may have to read and watch some youtubes before flying.

title: Great people to work with.
text: Well my first drone flew away and crashed.  I call the company Holy Stone and the replaced it at no charge. The Holy Stone Team has been awesome thus far. I recommend trying their products. I can't wait to see what the future hold for Holy Stone.

title: So far, So good
text: Just had my first beginner flight today and it was very easy to handle, even in a moderate breeze. Obviously, I'm just getting used to being a drone pilot so I haven't tried all of the features, but what I have tried worked quite well. Auto take-off and landing; RTH; and some basic maneuvers. I'm gonna enjoy this...

title: Mine flew away, replaced by customer service
text:
This drone is actually a pretty good one and fly's great but..... mine did not return to home. It was approx. 300 feet away flying great. It was getting a good distance away so I hit the return to home button and it did not select on the remote, it just kept on flying away and never did respond to lost signal or the return to home button. Batteries had a good charge. I never seen it again. Don't trust the return to home to work every time.
