title: Impressed!
text: This is a solid drone for the money!  Once you get it setup, it's relatively easy to fly.  The balance and response is extremely smooth and the takeoff couldn't be easier.

title: Nice for photography and videography
text:
This camera kit costs exactly half that of the cheapest drone kit from a famous "three-letter" drone manufacturer. For the price, it's excellent IMO and (from experience with two Holy Stone drones) their support is fast and good. I use mine exclusively for photography and videography. My only mildly-negative comment is the electronic image stabilization for video, while effective, does reduce the field of view from wide to normal-ish.
If I should lose this drone, I would replace it with the same purchase.

title: Well worth the money
text: Awesome product!  Fun to fly

title: Excellent value and Exceptional Customer support
text: The HS720E is an exceptional drone for the price.  It does lack the gimbal for the camera but the cushioning system is nice.  This unit actually comes with a full manual making setup and flight very easy.  I needed to contact customer service due to an issue I had about a month and a half after purchase and was very please to NOT get any run around and support standing behind the product with a replacement.  It is one thing to get a good price but a much better value to get great customer support!!  This is not a professional level drone but if you are look for a nice overall drone for the beginner or novice, it is very nice.

title: Great drone at a great price!
text:
First drone. It’s a blast to fly. Camera is great.
Would definitely recommend.

title: This is a decent drone for a BEGINNER adult
text:
Pro:
It does fly and take pictures and videos to your phone and microSD memory card (not included). The battery charge is sufficient for training flights. Solid design. A convenient case. Picture and video quality is OK but requires some color correction when you upload them on your computer.
Con:
A very confusing manual that was certainly written by a person whose English is not a native language. The manual is a tiny book very inconvenient to read in a field. A purely designed program you have to install on your smartphone. Still not sure if the drone can fly according to a preset route.

title: This thing is no good!!
text: This drone is not good!!!  It doesn’t hover in a steady position and sways when trying to take off or land.  I’ve already crashed two and they broke into three.  The first one I broke just failed mid flight after aborting a return to home.  It just stopped completely and did a nose dive straight to the ground.  For an extra 100 dollars go and get the djmini2.  Trust me!!  Do not buy this!!!!

title: Holy Stone HS720E
text: Amazing drone! It’s takes great video!!! Fights the wind great. Had it at 200 feet and it was gorgeous views!! The costumer service was beyond amazing!!! 5 stars all the way!!! Recommend buying either this drone or any of the Holy Stone Drones!!! I also have the HS160 and I fly that inside! That drone is much smaller but super fun to fly!! Recommend buying any drone from this company!!

title: Don’t waste your money
text: The HS720e is a subpar drone at best. Given the price point you could and should reconsider buying something along the lines of a DJI mini SE.

title: Fly with care
text:
Edit: within 1 hour someone responded to my email acknowledged that it's possible that flying near houses can cause loss of GPS signal due to wifi interference.

In short they are sending me a replacement.

Edit: took it for a night flight. Clear night... No wind. It flipped while I was doing a rotation. Crashed. Completely destroyed.

What started as wondering if consumer drones could utilize GPS and how much one would cost has now turned into a new hobby.

Highly recommend you watch videos of other who have purchased and published them. Then I recommend you go to big wide open area with a nice at minimum 1-2 meter square flat area free of grass etc.. best to do it on pavement.

The drone is easy to fly, the features work as advertised. Very rarely does it not respond to the commands.

Now the only complaint I have is I really with the phone holder on the remote was more robust. I also wish I could have a larger tablet to watching the video as I fly.

title: Not User Friendly
text: I have had this drone for two weeks and still cannot figure out how to get the compass to set.  Something is wrong.

title: First flight=last flight
text:
I bought this along with a Mini 2. I went on a trip to mexico to a very isolated area and wanted to get some drone shots while i was there, this was meant for my nephew to fly while i used the mini 2. A little background from me, i build fpv racing drones, as well as long range gps drones that are programmed to come back to the lift off location if connection is lost to the transmitter. The mini 2 does this well.

I took it for a test flight today, i flew it for about 2 minute. The drone hovered fine, responded to stick commands a little sluggishly, but otherwise fine. I took it to to 30 meters and flew it over an empty soccer field. As soon as i got past the goal on the side it began to break up a bit (keep in mind that this drone claims 500 meter fpv feed), i kept going to 150 meters and all of a sudden i lost ALL signal. In my mind at this ppint i was only dissapointed at the range but that was it, i believed it would return to me so long as i pulled the stick back as i had flown in a straight line. Little did i know the drone would completely freak out and bank right and dissapear into trees and shrubbery never to be seen again. Please understand that i had line of sight of the drone and tried to bank the other way but it did not reapond to any command, after the crash it seems the battery slipped out as i was never able to reestablish a connection to try and ger an idea of where it went. I lost what i feel is a lot of money for a defective product that does not return to the launch location and loses control when fpv connection is lost. This is a bad buy, dont listen to the youtube shills like i did.

title: Great Drone
text:
My first one crashed and got a hold of Customer service they were very helpful and sent me out a replacement. This drone Flys by itself almost its so easy to fly and takes Awesome video and stills.
I would Highly recommend this drone for anyone looking for one

title: I would highly recommend the HS720E
text: this is by far the best Drone of all three i have bought from Holy Stone and the customer service is great that means a lot for beginners

title: First Drone Experience
text: So this is my first drone, overall the experience has been very positive and for the most part trouble-free. I did have to read and re-read the instruction manual a number of times but did figure things out on my own. Once airborne it has been a blast, very happy with my drone choice.

title: You get what you pay for...
text:
For the price of the drone it does a decent job when it actually works. I had issues with it not wanting to fly once in the air it was as if the control wasn’t working or the drone wasn’t responding then would randomly connect and begin to fly again. Also had issues with the live feed recording after about 500-600ft of distance it would lose signal. I bought this drone to video my 15 acre property and now I’m wishing I would have just paid a little more money for a better drone.

Update: I was sent a new drone at no cost and was told to keep the old one as a spare. Have not had any further issues since. I am very impressed with HolyStone’s customer service, they’ve exceeded my expectations and for that reason I give them 4 stars.

title: Love my 720E
text: Yes, Wow! Upgraded from 700D.  So much more stability. Rotating panning is so much nicer. And the smoothness of flight, starting and stopping video impressive.  Has two speeds and other extras.  The package includes 2 batteries. A nice carrying case will be easy to pack for traveling.  Still working on practice flights. I can tell already this was a good upgrade and still within a nice price range,  Even if your new to drones, select this one.

title: I like this drone!
text: This is my first drone. I have flown it a few times now and I have learned the basic controls, which were easy for me to learn. The controls that are available using the app are a little different story. I am still trying to figure out some of those controls. However, this drone seems to have good range, and for what I plan on using it for (surveying areas I will be in, like wilderness areas), I think it will be great. I think this drone has some real nice features, and it should meet most peoples needs. The only feature I wish it had that it does not, is an obstacle avoidance feature. But if I pay attention to what I am doing, I see no issues that I cannot overcome.

title: Very impressive drone
text:
[[VIDEOID:42e2029623ccf0c810ae3f6e86163ecf]] @ 3 bills for this drone, I'm quite impressed with it. It's feature rich and has some features you don't see on drones double the price. It doesn't have a 2 or 3 directional gimble so you need to turn the front of the drone towards the area you want to record and or take a photo. However, I'm VERY impressed with the quality of the videos. I've included a pic and a video. The pic was taken from 285' in the air and the video I've included shows how smooth the video can be. Some of the jerkiness of the recording is me getting familiar with the drone controls. Take off and landings are literally a button press, I like using the take off/Land button. I like when the battery gets low the drone comes back to the location "home" it took off from or you can do this by a press of a button. I see this feature as a safety net on your investment, who wants to loose a $300 drone in the trees. I say this because I flew it over a local lake and got it lost above the trees at about 350'. I pressed the home button and whala it showed up right over me. I received 2 batteries with the purchase and each one has flown +23 minutes each time. They advertise 26 minutes, I tried that once and did get the 26 minutes. It's easy to fly, app is good.
Drone also has follow me and Object of interest feature where it will circle a selected object and take a horizontal 360 degree image. Also has tap and fly, where you pull up the map tap on where you want to fly it and it goes on it's own.

title: Easy to learn; Return to Home feature is a most have and this one has it!
text: I have several 'toy' drones that cost less than $100 dollars and some of them are hard to fly, especially in the wind, the Holy Stone 720 E is easy to fly, and handles itself in wind ( i've flown it in 15 mph winds) very well.  The 4k videos are excellent.  Couldn't be happier!

title: Nice Drone and Holystone stands behind their products
text:
So I would have given the drone 4-5 stars regardless, but I'm giving it 5 due to how Holystone handled an issue with it. Been flying for about 3 weeks with it, not my first drone but I'm not ready to enter any drone races either. I took it out this morning and something crazy happened. After weeks of flying with no issues, the drone began to bank left when I was steering right (and no, it wasn't flying toward me). I let go of the joysticks immediately as that usually stops it, but this time it kept going and BAM, right into a tree. I was pretty bummed when I walked over and saw the broken arm on the drone. Contacted Holystone through chat and after a bunch of questions, they honored their warranty and took care of me. I'm glad to see that Holystone stands behind their products. Still nervous as I'm not sure why it lost control, but happy that Holystone took care of it!
The drone itself has been a blast. Picture quality is very good, stability on the video is also quite good for the price point. The drone is responsive and flies well even in mild breezes. The return to home usually hits within about 3 feet of takeoff which is quite good. GPS acquisition takes a minute or so, but you just have to be patient. Calibration can be a bit of a pain, just ensure you wait until you have GPS before calibrating, I don't think it will calibrate otherwise but will still go into calibration mode making you wonder why it's not calibrating.

Things that could be improved - Battery starts indicating low at 2 out of 4 bars. I still get about 16-20 minutes of flight time on each battery, Just wish it would get down to 1 bar as I never really know where I am with it once it's on 2 bars.
Batteries also take quite a while to charge, but you get a decent flight time which is nice.

title: 720 E fun
text: The 720 E , is eazy to fly , great camera.

title: Quality drone!
text: Feature picked drone. Easy to use great choice.

title: excellent drone for the price
text:
Purchased this drone was totally impressed by the build quality!! It is super easy to operate, I watched a few
u tube vids on it and must admit everything went perfectly, The battery does take 4 to 5 hrs to charge, Also be sure to download the correct Ophelia app, This drone uses the Ophelia go app not the Ophelia gps app. I originally dowloaded the wrong app and couldnt get it to work... thanks to the great customer service they got me on the right app and everything works perfectly. I would purchase this again!!!

title: AWESOME
text:
What an AWESOME Drone, It is amazing, I'm 79 yrs old and never flew a drone before. It has more features than I will ever use but the videos and pictures are beautiful. It's stable and easy to fly.
I love it and would recommend it as your first or tenth.

title: Not to bad.
text: Takes a few times using it to get the hang of it. Would have given a 5 star but almost lost it when I lost the single. The batteries take 5 hours to charge also luckily I have two!

title: Great little bird but....
text: This was my first drone, so it was an experiment with a learning curve.  Once I got the hang of the controls---and that required at least a dozen or more flights---I was enthralled with the machine's performance.  I watched it stand up to some stout breezes (10-15 mph), perform flawlessly most of the tasks it's programmed for (the tap feature for flying to designated points on a map never worked for me at all), and amaze me by returning to base after being out of sight and hearing for some long, anxious minutes.  I registered 30 or more successful flights, half of these over coastal areas where I live before she inexplicably vanished one day roughly 200 yards off the beach.  Never saw her go down and never will know what happened.  But for a starter drone for someone not inclined to fly over water, this drone cannot be beat.  It is sturdy, can take a beating, and is a pure joy to fly.  I'd give it 5 stars if the transmitter had a hood to help see the cell phone screen (that's a major, frustrating challenge) and if it the drone carried some kind of wifi booster to enable extended down-range visuals.  I'm getting another drone soon but this one will be waterproof and floats.

title: Lots of bugs. Out of control after flying 20 feet away
text:
I tested the drone on my first flight today. It is completely garbage.
1. After it starts to hover at 3-4 feet from the ground, it drifts back and forth.
2. After I sent it to about 20 feet away from me, it automatically rotates to have its tail toward me, and the rotation control stops working.

I am an experienced player and I have never seen a drone doing the above before, even including those cheap $50 ones.

title: Nice drone
text: Just opened today and drone was very easy to operate . Quite faster than my other one . Perfect size and no problems . It was a little windy today and still flew straight . Still in beginners mode but will be switching tomorrow . Customer support  is very good answered all my questions before purchasing . The case it comes with is really nice .

title: Excellent drone. Quick delivery. No regrets.
text: Great for beginners and anyone who likes to fly drones AND take video/fpv as well. Would recommend

title: Great product with excellent customer service
text:
I had a bad experience the first time I got this product, the follow-me function wouldn't work and the Drone was erratic in flying. I contacted customer service and they promptly replaced the item.
The second product works great and as advertised, this thing is awesome and can easily rival more expensive drones like the Maverick or Phantom

title: For picture quality this isn’t what you are looking for
text: Terrible picture quality but if you want to learn how to fly a drone this is a good starter for practice. The wind will mess up your drone and it is hard to fly in many weather conditions

title: Great drone, but hard for beginners.
text: I really like this drone. This is an easy drone to fly ounce you know what you are doing. The controls are crisp. The camera is really good, and the app is easy to navigate. Overall I am very impressed with this drone. I do recommend this drone to beginners if they learn off a cheaper drone.

title: The Drone I have Been Waiting For
text: I have been wanting to upgrade my Drone flying experience for a couple years now. But, price and the capability I wanted for the additional cost I could afford eluded me.  Then came Holly Stones HS720E.  Now I have the drone capability I wanted at an affordable price.  I truly wanted increased image stabilization and a minimum of 2 batteries along with 4k, points of interest, return home if signal lost or battery low, tap to fly, and the always favorite follow me.  It was also delivered promptly in a nice compact package.  When I reached out to Holly Stone with a question they respond in a very reasonable timeframe.  I am very please with the purchase and Holly Stones customer service engagement

title: Great deal for your money
text:
This is a great drone for a beginner. At the same time, this drone does a lot of things that kind of make spending a boat load of money on one that really is not that much more superior than this one. It comes with a 4K quality camera that takes exceptional video and picture. I would buy this drone again.
The only thing that I was kind of disappointed about was the fact that it did not work well with my Motorola One Action phone. I had an older Samsung phone that I had to see if it would work better with it and it did. So, I've decided to use that phone just when I use this drone. It comes with a nice case, which has plenty of room for extra stuff!

title: Nice drone for the money
text: Nice drone for the money good for beginners and good for great photo/video.

title: Awesome little drone
text: I think this drone is awesome. We live on forty acres and the drone really comes in handy. We have lots of trees and underbrush. We live deep into the property and can't see the front gate from where we are. There are people jumping the gate to get to the lake to fish and hunt on the property. Because we live so deep into the property our packages are delivered to the gate. The Drone makes it easy to check out suspicious noises on the property, trespassers, what's happening at the lake, packages at the gate, plus inspect house/RV roofs and so on. The pictures and videos are great, very clear. We find the headless feature very useful.

title: Awesome little drone
text: I think this drone is awesome. We live on forty acres and the drone really comes in handy. We have lots of trees and underbrush. We live deep into the property and can't see the front gate from where we are. There are people jumping the gate to get to the lake to fish and hunt on the property. Because we live so deep into the property our packages are delivered to the gate. The Drone makes it easy to check out suspicious noises on the property, trespassers, what's happening at the lake, packages at the gate, plus inspect house/RV roofs and so on. The pictures and videos are great, very clear. We find the headless feature very useful.

title: Awesome
text:
[[VIDEOID:9b11e7e65803be9aec41d80f1793fd46]] I received my drone, and could tell it was quality before even opening it. The case is well-made, and durable. The instructions are clear and precise. The drone is awesome to fly. Acurate, stable, responsive, and well designed. The camera is clear, and the video quality is excellent. The functions are flawless. The range is great. The app is pretty easy to use as well.
The Holy Stone customer support - (I had issues with the first drone I had and had to contact them). Customer service was very quick to respond, courteous, and understanding. They made right my situation, even when they clearly didn't have to (due to user error), and I don't have enough praise for them. Well worth the money A++++

title: Be patient
text: I got this for my husband and it's his first drone. The setup process is very confusing and the instructions aren't helpful. But we stuck with it and figured it out. He's having fun flying high and taking videos. The video quality is pretty good. Pictures are clear. There's definitely a learning curve and this is not a toy for young children.

title: Recommended Purchase
text: Everything it says it is. Great quality in parts and and picture/video is crisp. I recommend this product for anyone looking. A bit of advice fir beginners, buy extra propellers.

title: Great Drone
text: Great Drone so far. Only been having a week. Very easy to operate. Deff a fun toy to have.

title: Flight Time and Camera quality
text: This drone is the best one I've had.  Need to go thru the manual and after a few test flights you will enjoy its ease to handle.  The capabilities of this drone for the price is an outstanding value.  I bought one for both my son and son-in-law.  It is also very rugged as I flew it several times into bushes and trees.  No issues and still using the same rotor blades.  Viewing thru the app can be challenging, so get in the shade.

title: EXCELLENT Customer Service
text:
Holy Stone Customer Service really rocks! I opted to purchase from Holy Stone after reading the many positive customer service reviews. After an unfortunate incident with my drone I contacted Customer Service and they immediately sent out a replacement. Holy Stone has an impressive drone and excellent customer service, you won't go wrong. Thank you Holy Stone for standing solidly behind your product!

Drone buyers should be very concerned about customer service. My prior drone was a DJI that worked fine until I downloaded their firmware update. DJI customer service is deplorable, they will lie to you and ignore facts. They first admitted others had the same problem and later denied it. They wanted $400 to `fix' it. Do your research. My experience with them is detailed in a Better Business Bureau review on DJI as well as on DJI's own website threads.

title: Quality Drone
text: This is my first drone.  As a result it has taken me a bit of time to learn the finer points of setting things up and flying it.  I had a bit of difficulty hooking up the drone to my Android phone but once I got it figured out it is great.  The drone is very stable (even in my hands) and the camera is quality for the price paid.  What was my hesitation to get a drone was I live in a high wind area and I wondered if it could handle the winds.  Well, it can and does well.  I have crashed the drone two times and both were caused by me and the winds.  The crashes were minor and two blades got scratched up but nothing broke.  I would encourage anyone to try this drone out. In my opinion, a well designed drone with a lot of pluses.

title: Very Easy to Fly. Very Stable. Excellent Camera
text:
[[VIDEOID:55197f0aeff6429181c06a4e8f69a47c]] This was my 2nd GPS drone. The last one crashed every time I flew it. I was amazed at how easy it is to pair and calibrate (although I do feel a little silly twirling it like a baton to get the compass set). It is very, very stable, even in a still breeze. Smooth auto take off and landing. The flight time is, so far, about 25 minutes per battery. I like the very bright LED lights on the bottom too, since I fly in the early morning a lot. It cost a little more than the Ruko F11 which I had before this but the extra $$ is worth the money. This is SO much more stable than the Ruko. It's better than a Mavic Mini because you also get all of the stuff that comes with the combo pack with this drone. The way I see it, I got a super good drone kit for almost $200 less than the Mini.

I'd definitely recommend this to someone. If I lost mine, I'd buy another.

title: Great Upgrade for Beginners
text: I started with a very cheap drone that was good for training and getting the feel for flying a drone. I started looking at high end drone costing $$$ and learning the features I wanted. I came across the Holy Stone HS720e and saw good reviews and a ton of features for the low price compared to other more expensive drones. I got the HS720e delivered quickly and the battery was already charged so I was able to quickly get it up and running. It takes just a little time to get acquainted with the setup/startup and after that it is easy. It flies great and has a very good controller. The only feature I wish it had was the obstacle avoidance but it did it would need to have additional sensors which would drive the cost higher. So keep the cost down and reasonable and if you crash it its not so bad of a loss I suppose. Yes I recommend and I would buy again.

title: Awesome beginner drone
text: Holy Stone is an amazing company to work with. The drone is east to use, remote controlled and great for beginners. 👍👍👍👍

title: second try
text: First one took out of focus video. Second one is much better but every video has a really small bouncing object .

title: Great value and very good build quality - charger connection could be better
text: This entry-level unit is an excellent first drone for adults who want to try their hand at remote piloting. Build quality is very good. Picture and video quality are quite good and the follow-me feature works well. While it doesn't have collision avoidance, it is one of the best values at this price point. Setup instructions are easy to follow and there are video tutorials online if needed. Everything worked on the first try. The only reason I did not give this product 5 stars is that the side-by-side battery connector on the charger could have been made to more securely grip the batteries. It's not hard to inadvertently unseat the batteries from the little press-on connector. Remote control works well although the smart phone clip seems a little weak. Time will tell how it holds up. The carrying case is very good quality. Smartphone app is straightforward and easy to use. I would recommend this product.

title: Set up issues.
text:
Received the drone. Nice and sturdy. But a lot Set up issues. Followed the instructions as stated exactly but unable to get to work. The remote and drone are connected. The phone is also connected to Drone wi-fi but the app doesnt show any connection and the drone doesnt start. Maybe it doesn’t work with iphone 12 max pro.

Will see how it goes after a while or else would have to return.

title: Follow Instructions
text:
This is so easy to set up and fly. Even my kids love playing with it.
I was having a hard time getting the camera to show up on my phone and it wasn't until I reread the instructions and able to get the video on my phone screen. Great product and so much fun.

title: Very stable
text: So far so good. Was able to fly in the barn tonight. John seems very stable but was only able to fly outside for a little while due to the Highwind. Flight time was as advertised the only thing I don’t like is that it takes five hours to charge. So far a good experience.

title: NO NO NO!!  "HOUSTON WE HAVE A PROBLEM"
text:
Had 2 HOLY STONE DRONES... Never again!
They fly very well as long as you keep them close to you. Picture quality is fair. Video freezes for a short second every few moments. Videos are worthless because of it.
NOW THE BAD NEWS!!.... After a sudden and unexplainable motors failure it fell from the sky and broke its Right Rear motor arm. This part is UNAVAILABLE FROM ANYONE ON THIS PLANIT! The drone is now JUNK due to a complete lack of support from HS or Amazon. You can get the front replacement arms but not the rear....???
Very disappointed

title: Get what you pay for I suppose...
text: For beginners.

title: This is an awesome drone easy to fly at a great price!
text: This little drone is unbelievable right out of the box! Thumbs up across-the-board. If you’re looking for a drone look no further. This is the one for beginners and everybody! I’m not sure how they do it at such a great price.

title: Good Products Good Customer Service (Pic = bees attacking drone at 2-300 feet)
text: About a year ago I bought the HS160 to dabble with drone flying and help me decide if I wanted to spend the money for something more capable. The HS160 is a great beginner drone with great beginner quality pics/video. After writing a review and receiving a free battery for that review, I could tell Holy Stone was a customer service driven company. When it came time to buy my first fancy drone, there was no question I had to see what Holy Stone had to offer. With the coupon from Amazon + one I dug up from a Youtube review video the price was unbeatable.  When I first received the drone, there were some compatibility issues with my Android phone.  As expected, Holy Stone customer service was all over it. Timely and consistent communication until the problem was fixed via an update to the app only about a week later. In fact, they made me feel as if they updated the app specifically for my problem. (I really don't know either way)  That aside...the drone flies beautifully. Steady, smooth, quiet. The pics and videos are  equally beautiful.  If you want a quality product, and you want feel like you purchased it from a friend, and someone who will support the purchase... buy a Holy Stone product. If they come out with some fancier and more capable than the hs720e, there is no question I will buy it.

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: I had a problem with the drone and it veered off course and crashed into a tree.  Trying to get it down it fell and broke one of the rotor arms.  I explained to customer service what happened and after their verifying the broken arm with a photo, they sent me a replacement.  You can't get better than that!

title: Excellent
text: Great product, easy to fly, excellent features.

title: This a high quality video type drone
text: The drone was bought due to its specifications, and its good price for value. However, the true range was far less than listed and it had a problem with the elevation it was to achieve, it would only rise 80 feet from ground level. The camera was the important feature of very high resolution, but it would not return to home precisely. We have continued to search for another brand, I remain without for this period of time.

title: Easy to set up
text: At 75 years old I found this drone easy to set up and fly. I will get more use out of it when the weather warms up

title: Great
text: I bought this thinking it would be a good starter drone.. the first drone was wonky but Amazon sent me a New replacement and it works just like the manufacturer says! It's a cool little drone. Ty

title: Works well
text: [[VIDEOID:fcc041b61cafd1bf6aa664ed01831d32]] You cannot go wrong for the price. Very satisfied, lots of fun, return home feature is a must and this one hasn’t failed me yet. Great product

title: Easy to use
text: Easy to maneuver, take pics, and video. Crashes well , it takes punishment .

title: Excellent value and quality.
text: Very user friendly and easy to learn and use. Great video quality and many great features. Excellent value for the price.

title: Good drone for $250 price range
text: A good drone for $250 price range. Customer service was excellent.  sturdy.  flies good but did seem to get a bit effected by medium wind more then my DJI 2 mini.  Video quality was good for cost of drone.  Range did seem to be 120 meters.  Might get a bit more in open fielda.  Probably nkt bad for this price drone.

title: Great drone!
text: Bought for my husband. He absolutely loves it. He’s very very pleased with it.

title: Extremely hard to set up and use. Stay away!
text: This thing's biggest problem is the setup process. You need to stand in your living room holding it out in front of you while turning in a circle, then do it again holding the drone in a different orientation. Then if you are successful you must pair it with the remote AND your iPhone. No matter how many times I tried it would not work. They skimp on the software and make YOU do the setup work. In this year of 2021 all of this should be automated. I strongly do NOT recommend this drone at any price. It's too frustrating.

title: Super easy for beginers
text: [[VIDEOID:b5bdb12a3b1a095d5672ccada8be92a0]] The video is the maiden voyage!  Thats how easy this is fly.  The instruction book was junk to me.  Didnt explain a whole lot.  I went to Youtube and got all the info I needed.

title: Giving this a second shot! 😊
text: This drone is the worst we have ever had, had to control and the blades cut my husbands fingers as it lost control and came at him.

title: It was easy for someone that is not tacky at all. I look forward to having a bunch of fun with it.

title: Works great.
text: This drone really works good. I put it up at about 75' in a 10 to 15 mph wind, and it stayed right there. I haven't had a chance to get into an open field, so I didn't try the follow me, or the circle point, but the tap fly worked fine.  The only problem is that if the battery gets low, it doesn't auto return home. I set it about 100 ' from where it took off. When the battery in the drone got to 1 bar, it went down right where it was. I called Holy Stone, and they said that when the battery gets down to 2 bars I should bring it back manually or push the retune button on the controller.

title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT & WARRANTY CLAIM - UPDATED TWICE.

Now i can vouch for both the product quality but also the customer service and how good they are. Cari from Customer Service is just amazing. He is so quick and takes care of you.

title: Stability
text: The best description for the Holy Stone 720E is "Rock Solid". The EIS, Electronic Image Stability", features makes this drone a major competitor in the market place. The Holy Stone 720E will give you very smooth videos much like the more expensive drones having a gimble to control the camera. This drone has most of the features of the much more expensive drones, such as the Mavic Mini, but at about half the cost. It is a great addition to the drone market and a welcome addition to my flying family. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to purchase a drone.

title: Amazing drone for beginners
text: This drone is extremely easy to connect to both your phone and the control. The controls are very easy even for a beginner.  Taking off and landing  is as easy as a button or you are able to it manually if you choose.  The flying is stable and easy to hover making it a breeze to fly.  I would definitely recommend this drone for beginners looking to get into it.  The size makes it easy to pack and bring with you on vacations but doesn’t affect the stability when in higher winds.  Lastly, the camera is insane.... it really is high def!! Both the video and pictures come out clear and beautiful!!

title: Great drone for beginners.  Awesome customer service.
text: I have enjoyed flying this drone.  This was my first drone and it is easy to learn and easy to fly.  It is perfect for my needs, and I love the features.  I did have a couple of problems with a faulty battery charger and after contacting Holy Stone customer service, they sent a replacement battery charger.  I also had a small problem with one of the arms and after contacting Holy Stone customer service, they again sent a replacement arm and propellers.  After I was unable to install the arm myself, Holy Stone sent me a new replacement drone.  Best Customer service I have ever received.  They are prompt about answering emails and very courteous.  I have not been disappointed.

title: Awesome drone

title: Great drone for the price with a fantastic camera!
text: This was the first drone I have ever flown.  It didn't go very well. My grandson showed me how easy it was to fly then handed me the controls.  I flew straight into the side of the garage. No major damage, just a few  scratches.  After a few more mishaps I decided to buy a cheap little drone that I could practice with inside the house.  This went much better and soon I had enough confidence to go back to the HS720E.  I'd say it's a very easy drone to fly if you've flown one before.  It's very stable even in mildly strong wind and takes great pictures.  I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to take quality pictures and video and doesn't want to spend a lot of money.  Just make sure the first time you fly it there's plenty of open space, and no garages close by.

title: I loved it but it did not last
text: I really did enjoy this drone but it did not last. Bought it as a Christmas present to myself and started to fly it in January 2021. The controls felt good and I learned to fly it with confidence. I loved the videos and pictures. That was the most fun. Then the camera stopped working. So much for that fun. Never figured out why. It sat for a few months and then I decided to take it for a flight. I found the batteries had swelled up. There was no way I could get the battery out of the drone - even with vice grips. Finally,  I took my HS720E on a flight as high as it would go, farther than I would have ever felt comfortable. Knowing it was my last flight on the last charge because I would be able to get in the battery out, I flew it high until the battery ran out.  It came crashing down to my driveway. My return to home crash talent was pretty good.. It was not a soft landing though. Goodbye HS720E. I loved it but will not buy another. It just does not seem durable. I treated it carefully until its last flight. I don't have that kind of money to take that chance again.

title: First drone
text:
Packaging... Was not notified that it needed to be registered with the FAA...
A Flyaway into a forest caused by high winds and operator inexperience. Lost, Never recovered.
I should have learned how to fly in an open field AFTER I registered it with the FAA as a recreational drone pilot... always Use B4UFLY to get permission to fly in Controlled airspace.

title: Best drone I have bought at a good price.
text: This is a fabulous drone for a beginner and such fun to play with. Good battery life (about 20 minutes of flying) great resolution from the camera. Easy to operate. Good range and high and always comes back to home when instructed. Don’t attempt when it is windy though! I bought this for my 12 year old son and Now I want one for myself. He absolutely loves it and learned very quickly how to fly safely and responsibly. Robust and well made.

title: Great Second Drone
text:
In the short time that I have had this drone, I am really impressed with the quality feel and flight characteristics of this it. It's fast, the camera works very well, and advanced GPS features also work very well. The return home button lands the drone within a five-foot radius of the drone's take-off location. The follow-me function seems to keep me in the camera's center of the frame.
I did initially have some issues with the drone's first flight. It was not pitching left or right and would only fly backward. I contacted Holy Stone and they very quickly responded and stated that they would make things right. They suggested I try again with fully charged batteries in both the remote and the drone and recalibrate the compass and gyro. After completing these steps, the drone flew perfectly. So far very impressed with both the drone and the customer service. This is my second Holy Stone drone. The first was the entry level HS200. That drone was a great drone to learn basic flight dynamics. I've crashed that thing many times and it still flies perfectly. I am really appreciating the GPS functionality on the new drone, because if I get into trouble or lose slight of the drone, releasing the stick causes the drone to hover in one spot which allows you time to regain your barrings and recontrol the drone.

title: New Drone
text: I'm new at this but it seems easy to learn. I just got it and haven't been able to get it outside.

title: More to the “Saying, Fly By Night”(legal in this case)
text: What a smooth flying experience this Drone is. Holystone really did it with this model. Easy and really smooth controls. Flew at night in my private lot where I live. Very short flight. About 5-8 feet above ground and only about 90 to 100 feet up and back in my parking lot area with no people or vehicles. I am fairly new to Drone Flying but it was easy to see right away what a wonderful experience this was goin to be the minute she lifted off the ground and hovered immediately at about 5 to 6 feet above ground. Simple movement and she took off straight down the lot stopped and returned smoothly. Then landed on its own with return to me setting. Want some Fun? Buy the HS720E. Easy set up, Easy instruction, and the Best Part. Easy Flying! Thank You HolyStone and Amazon!

title: Easy and surprisingly smooth
text: I’ve been flying drones for awhile now and when I stumbled across the Holy Stone HS720E I was amazed at how well it performed against some of the more expensive brands. The EIS does a great job of keeping the image stable despite not being on a 3 axis gimble. I think the upgraded controller is a nice touch with an intuitive display with key flight parameters needed for safe and effective flying. The slow mode also provides a great cinematic video experiences in calm winds. I did have one issue that was quickly resolved by a very friendly and knowledgeable customer service expert. Overall I think you get a great bang for the buck and I will definitely be trying out more models from Holy Stone.

title: very limited flying range less then 0.125 mile or 201 meters.  inacurate return to home feature
text: while flying the Holystone 720e the drone lost connection at approximately less then 0.125 mile. The return to home was set at 275 feet. The drone flew into a tree top that was les then 100 feet as it was retuning to home. I did find the drone with a broken arm. I flew the drone on several occasions and lost connection 90% of the flights. This was my second Holystone 720. The first drone was never flown due to camera gimble not working and was returned. I am very disappointed in the Holystone 720. I have since purchased a DJI Mini 2. awesome range ( 2 miles) great camera.

title: Phone holder. At lest for my phone

title: Amazing drone! But only 300' range
text: Every feature on this drone was absolutelty amazing, but even while flying from an open field within line of sight of the drone, the transmitter would begin to loose connection after about 300 feet distance and 100 feet of altitude. Very far from the claims of the 3277' range in the product description. Aside from that, the drone is absolutely phenomenal in terms of its features and build quality. The camera is amazing as well, with a bit of latency (which was to be expected). All in all, I love this drone and but the false claims of 3277' transmitter range, when the product gets only 300-400' is very frustrating.

title: Suicidal
text: Be extremely careful purchasing this drone. I got to use mine about 5-6 times. The first time I flew it, I had to troubleshoot why it was flying so slowly, there is a "sport" mode that has to be turned on. The last time I flew it, it completed its initial set up and calibration, then after take off, it took off flying at full speed in a random direction and didn't respond to my controller at all. My phone was linked and I got to watch on camera how it flew higher and farther until the connection was lost. I spent hours trying to track down its location with the last GPS signal but it was nowhere to be found. When I called the company to inform them that their drone took a suicide flight into the horizon, I was told there was nothing that could be done other than giving me a small discount on buying another. Buyer beware!!!

title: Very Stable & A Lot of Fun to Fly - Acts Like a Much More Expensive Drone
text:
[[VIDEOID:d5ba8012348a3c1866fd5799b4758ce9]] I bought this drone for my husband and this is his review.

This is the first drone I've tested in the $300+ range and it did not disappoint. I still have to test all the additional functions available via the smart phone app and I'll come back and update this review once I'm done.

PROs:
- Includes a nice carrying case that is compact, protective and carries what's needed for the drone.
- Propeller arms fold up nicely to make the drone compact for travel and storage.
- Clear & concise instructions assist with getting in the air quickly.
- Uses a USB-C charging cable with decent output for faster charging, 2800mAh battery provides extended flight time and comes with 2 batteries (I was able to get 20+ minutes out of a battery).
- Batteries install and uninstall very easily and there are battery gauges on both the drone and the remote.
- Minimal pre-flight requirements (basically calibrate the compass) means getting in the air quickly.
- 2 speeds: Low speed is quite slow and is very good for beginners to learn how this drone responds; High speed is rather quick and makes for covering distances quickly.
- Has good safety features: 1-button start/stop, Return-to-Home, Automatic RTH (low battery or loss of transmitter or GPS Satellite signal), Emergency Motor Stop, Low Battery Warnings.
- GPS mode can be turned on and off.
- 4k Camera on a 90-degree gimbal takes photos and video and uses smart phone or microSD up to 128GB (I still need to test this).
- 2 modes allows joystick functionality to switch between left and right joysticks for personal preference.
- Headless mode (although it appears this is only accessible via the smart phone app as I could not find anyway to engage this via the remote).
- Storable phone holder on remote (it was able to hold my Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra with a bulky case).
- Optical Flow Positioning allows for safe use indoors or when GPS is unavailable.
- Several advanced features via the smart phone app (Headless Mode, Follow Me, Point of Interest Circling, & TapFly (waypoints)). - I still need to fully test these features.

CONs:
- Headless mode only available via smart phone app.
- Charger can only charge 1 battery at a time.
- No trim adjustments that I could find for drift.
- Somewhat advanced drone, suggested age 16+.

Overall I was very impressed with this drone. For around $350 you get a drone that has the features and acts like a much more expensive drone, one easily costing $500+. I feel this drone is a terrific value for someone who is budget conscious but wants an advanced feature-rich drone.

Highly recommend - I would buy this drone again at its current price.

title: A great drone, with a few minor things you might wanna think of....
text:
I bought this drone as a first drone. Originally, I wanted to get something from DJI, but, at 600 dollars for a "beginner" drone from them, that seemed a bit excessive. After some exhaustive comparison, I decided to give this drone a try. I have to say, I'm very happy I went with Holy Stone! But, maybe THIS drone shouldn't have been my first drone. There is a learning curve to this thing, and with un-shielded blades, you have to be VERY careful how you fly it. One nick / bend in a blade and you need to replace the blade(s). Also, this thing is POWERFUL!! If you have never flown a drone in your life, you might want to start with something smaller like the HolyStone 210. I ended up buying this one after a bad crash, and learning to fly it before I tried to fly my 720E again. It helped! A LOT!

Speaking of that crash, let me take a moment to mention that Holy Stone has great customer service. After initially leaving a poor review, Holy stone reached out to me directly and offered me a replacement. Apparently, the first drone i ordered may have been defective. This new one flies much better! But, if I'm being honest, it may have also been me and my limited skills at the time. When I began, I took my time to read the manual / learn the software, etc... But I didn't understand the need for absolutely clean / undamaged blades, and a lot of other little things that you should know before trying to fly a drone like attitude, pitch, control orientation relation to the nose/tail of the aircraft, etc.... The folks at Holy Stone still offered a replacement. With DJI, you have to buy "DJI care" to get this level of service. I can't say enough good about this! Customer service is so rare these days, and these guys take it seriously.

If you are a beginner, and after reading this you still want to give this drone a try, one thing you might want to consider are adding prop guards and landing legs to it. Holy stone sadly does not offer them (hint: they probably should!!), but another vendor on here, HeiyRC, has them available. Add these to your drone!! Trust me! Without them on, one small tap/bump can be catastrophic to your drone. Think of them as your "drone training wheels." They can really save your butt! Esp if you are flying around trees/indoors/etc..

Finally, I wanted to talk about the battery charge time. Optimal charge time with the OEM battery charger are around 6-7 hours, and they can be done in tandem. However, there are other sellers on here which sell the individual battery connectors you need to connect these batteries to a rapid charging system that more professional RC folks use for POV drone, etc.. You tube has a video about it. It can take your charging time safely down to 1-2 hours in tandem. It will be my next upgrade for this aircraft.

title: Works Very Well Solid Build Quality
text:
This is my first drone.
I am an experienced camera operator and photographer and I wanted to learn more about using a drone to get some different types of footage.
Using this drone in the BEGINNER mode helped me get over my fear of crashing. :)
Even so... I did on more than one occasion. No fault of the drone.
The drone took the crash like a champ and went back to work right away.
NOTE: Do not try flying this in your living room until you are an experienced pilot. :)
When I wanted to go faster I contacted tech support and they responded very quickly and walked me through how to turn on the FAST mode.
This little drone can go pretty darn fast.
The fact that this drone is so compact is mostly a good thing. I carry it in my backpack and use it in many different places.
The bad things is that being so compact and light makes it susceptible to wind conditions. So fly on calm or light wind days.
All in all I am very happy with the drone and the excellent customer support.
I am waiting on their VR headset so I can fly better!
Enjoy flying!

title: Catastrophic failures HS720E, Good Customer Service!
text:
I chose the HS720E based on some pretty decent reviews from YouTube. This is a budget drone with some nice features. There is also lots of good reviews on Amazon too. Please read the whole review.

That said, here's what happened with mine.
I could send it out a short distance and it would become unresponsive to input from the sticks.
It wouldn't fly right or forward for instance, but it would do the GPS return to home. Sort of. Once it got to it's landing coordinate it would start flying in a wild oval pattern. I couldn't get it to respond, so I tried the auto land feature. It took off, banked right and eventually landed, tumbling in the grass. That was the nice crash. The initial crash flew into a tree and broke the camera gears loose. Another of this same issue had it skipping across a parking lot and into the side of a building.

Holy Stone customer service replaced it after I turned in some video showing the issue.
The replacement became unresponsive also, so while it was hovering, I hit the auto land. It took off again and hit a tree about a hundred yards away. This time an arm was broken. I sent it back for refund.

It's kind of interesting that the orbit and follow features worked. I never tried the waypoint feature.

Holy Stone customer service was very good to work with and I appreciate that they tried to resolve the problem with a replacement. Maybe there has just been a bad batch of electronics get through to customers. With all the 4-5 star reviews mine must've been an oddity. I gave 3 stars because of the customer service.

title: Extraordinary value for the price!
text: Great value and loaded with features. Easy to fly.

title: Its great...right out of the box!!!!!!
text:
I have used this drone extensively for the last six weeks and love all its features. It operates brilliantly every time I take it off and I love the "follow me" and "orbit" features! Above everything else I have found the Holy Stone customer service to be above and beyond excellent! I was nervous about flying the drone and was super impressed when I realized that it flies superbly with confidence inspiring rock solid performance. I am yet to have to test out the return to home feature but I am sure that is excellent too. The video quality with this non gimbal camera is perfectly adequate for all my needs and I am again impressed with the quality of the footage I am able to get. The app works great and the instruction book is well written and gets you through all your early questions and beyond.....

Bravo! Holy Stone this is a really nice drone and I love mine!!

title: Needs faster kill switch but very durable drone
text: Very good drone and easy to learn as long as you read the book. Wish the remote had a quicker way to kill the motors. I wrecked on first landing and had to watch in horror for 3 very long seconds while holding down the kill switch for the blades to stop self destructing. Should be a simple double tap not hold down button. The drone was fine after I dusted it off though so it is durable. Good price and responsive customer support.

title: Great good quality learning drone for pictures and video.
text: Very important to calibrate per instructions before flying and start in very open field with no trees for first time.  Probably a good idea to get the inexpensive landing gear kit from amazon to protect against hard landings.

title: It went up 50 feet and crashed.
text: Unable to control it!  Could not stop it with emergency button.  I have tried to contact the company to repair it but I get no response.  Even if I made a mistake,  the company should help get repaired.  I am not looking for free.  But to waste $330 on a Christmas present is not right.

title: Yes! This is a great choice :)
text: Bought this for a very picky husband and I am very pleased. Easy to learn how to use. Not a big investment. Excellent quality. He was able to join the conversation about the use of this item. It will be great to have when we hit the water next summer!

title: Holy Stone Drone HS 720E
text: The drone works as advertised. And customer support has been excellent. Would buy again.

title: Got a mind of its own
text:
The good
This is a great looking drone And the video is great. That's about it.

The bad
I went through two, first one just stopped working mid flight and came straight down. Was not too high so did no physical damage but over of the motor died.
Went you the vendor and they sent me a new one after i sent a video. This one,It's got a mind of its own.... As others have stated the drone has a massive navigation problem, you press return to home and it just decided to take off in a random direction at full speed and right into a tree. It was like me watching the thing go into a tree and none of my controls would do anything. I'm not new to flying and fell i have enough experience to control this without any issue but this one is just a weird one.
The software tried to mimic Dji and does a decent job but it's not worth the savings when in reality it will cost you more and have nothing to use as it'll be damaged/lost within first few flights.

title: Easy to learn to fly for beginners
text: Picture quality was great. Only had a week but so far pleased.

title: Excellent Drone!
text: I was impressed with how fast it came. Their customer service is great also. Everyone was friendly and just a phone call away. It is an excellent drone at this price point compared to the compeditors like DJI. I would definetly recommend this drone and would purchase another one in the future as a gift for a friend or relative. The drone is well built and I can tell it is made out of quality materials. It also comes in an awesome carrying case that holds the drone, controller and batteries etc. I highly recommend this drone and hope that you enjoy it!

title: Nice entry+ drone.
text:
This is my first drone. I found it very intimidating at first just because it was. Setup is good and if you follow some YT videos and read the manual it's not too bad. You will need your "smart phone" to fly this, but if you're into bigger/better you could figure out how to use your tablet which would give you a bigger viewing area. :)

Using the app to fly the drone is fairly simple. However, a few things are necessary. It ALWAYS defaults to beginner in the settings for flight, so you have to figure that out on your own. Once I did, it didn't limit me to an area I wanted to test. Not a huge area, but larger than 50'. You'll find you have no control left/right etc. but can return to home and back/forward (until you hit the limit again). I have yet to really get comfortable, but being the first drone and flying around my yard with lots of trees, I was very pleased on what I was able to do.

The camera is not on a gimbal, but the electronic stabilization does a pretty good job. I don't/didn't fly in big winds so my quality of video was fine. I believe for the $$ it's a darn good above entry level drone. You can become comfortable after learning the joysticks and just have to be mindful of which way is left/right, forward/backward when the drone is facing the opposite direction.

It came with an extra set of blades and I was able to get one with an additional set to boot. So far, I haven't needed to replace them, but I'm sure that time will come.

Fly safe and follow protocols. These things are a lot of fun.

title: Great Drone, great customer service.
text: This is a great drone. I am fairly tech savvy but have never flown a drone before. It's intuitive, easy to learn and the app and controller are feature rich. I considered several others before purchasing this drone but the reviews and online video sold me on this one. The video stabilization feature produces exceptional video. The GPS abilities, auto take off and land, and the camera controls are a lot of fun. I may have been burying the lead in this review but I had a major as received problem with my drone that customer service resolved immediately by express shipping a replacement. I felt that level of customer service offered in a curteous and professional manner was better than ordinary and deserved special mention. I have only had it two weeks but so far the drone and the company have outperformed.

title: Great Drone
text: The drone flies perfect! The  batteries charge quickly & last about 12 min.

title: Dissapointed with performance....
text: The drone is very well built.  Camera is top notch.  But the shortfalls were the lack of  accuracy on landings, lack of range for controls, the slow reaction to the controls and the recharge time for the batteries. (5hrs per battery)  As a beginner drone this would be ok.

title: So Far So Phenomenal!
text:
I flew my HS720E for the first time today - Wow!  I did wait a couple of weeks since receiving it for ideal calm and dry conditions for my first flight. That gave me time to familiarize myself with the instructions, controls, and app before flying. I recommend everyone do this because there are a lot of features. Every component of the system from the drone itself to the provided case has a quality feel.

I have purchased and flown dozens of RC heli/quadcopters but this drone is a whole new world.  Even under dead calm conditions the others were just never very stable. The HS720E is rock steady. I took off from and landed on a 6'x6' cardboard pad about 30' from any obstacles. The Return To Home (RTH) function did amazingly well at consistently landing gently within several feet of the takeoff spot. This gave me confidence to take it up to about 150' knowing that if I got in a jam the RTH button worked incredibly well. I took some photos and videos which look awesome previewed on my phone.

One minor complaint has to do with connecting the batteries to the charger, especially doing this with a LIPO safety bag. Small tabs on the charger align the battery and one of them was broken.  Holy Stone did responded quickly with a replacement.

The HS720E is well made, has great customer support, and is a blast to fly! I plan on updating my impressions after more fun flying time.

title: Well built, great for a beginner, easy to fly, Sony camera with electronic stabilization !
text: I did a lot of research and found the HolyStone 720E to be one of the better drones for the price.  I ordered it from Amazon and received it the next day.  It was packaged beautifully like an Apple Product.  It is well built with a great Sony camera.  The controller is comfortable and has all controls at your finger tips.  It even hold your phone where with the HolyStone app you have a birds Eye view of what the camera is seeing and even more functionality.  After watching a few YouTube videos and reading the instruction the drone and camera worked perfectly.  This was a great buy!

title: It's an OK drone not worth the $300 plus Holy Stone has it listed.
text:
Updated 2/20/2021
This review is based on the 2nd HS720E Holy Stone sent me as a replacement due to some issues with the first one. After flying and using the replacement for 2 weeks this is my honest review.

I'm not new to flying drones or radio controlled helicopters, but not an expert by any means. I have to say the Holy Stone HS720E is not bad to fly but not great either. If you've never flown with a first person view it is a game changer. The instructions could have been a little more detailed providing a step-by-step before you launch. Thank goodness for Youtube, I was able to clarify some details not outlined in the manual.

Pros:
Build quality is pretty solid. I don't feel like I'm handling a cheap toy, even the remote feels solid.

Launching and landing is very simple with the press of a button. Hovering is somewhat stable in light winds up to 10mph so far. The highest I took the drone was around 250ft and a distance of 700ft but didn't push it since I don't trust it to not fly away. (More detail below about this comment)

Initially, I felt like the drone wasn't very responsive until I realized I was in Tripod(slow) mode. Once I changed it to "fast", response was much improved. Again, the manual wasn't very clear about that and had to figure it out on my own. I'm very pleased I can order some spare parts (props, arms, batteries) on Amazon in the event I need these items.

Kit comes with 2 batteries, a charging dock, nice case, and spare props.

The LED spot lights under the drone and led lights under the arms are nice for night flights.

Drone operation is fairly smooth and quiet considering the price point.

Now for the Cons:
Very slow charging considering todays charging technology.

Camera quality isn't bad but it's not great either at the advertised 4k.

Battery indicator on the battery, app, or remote doesn't indicate the battery percentage correctly. It'll show you have 2 bars left which means 50%. Wrong I got a low battery warning with 2 bars remaining. When I check the battery with my lipo tester, it had 20% left.

Height and distance on the controller doesn't match what it shows on the app, not even close.

My drone has a vibration when it's hovering. I can see one arm vibrating as if a blade is out of balance. I can try replacing the props to see if this resolves the problem.

My 2nd flight I performed the single button take off which is suppose to go to a 5ft hover. In this instance It literally just kept climbing and wanted to fly away. Even when I tried to make it descend it kept rising. At some point I was finally able to get it to come back towards me and land. I went through the normal calibration procedure and had 16 satellites locked in when this happened.

The same flight I took it out to 700ft in distance and the video started getting choppy at the 450ft mark and completely froze at the 550 to 600ft mark. By the time I realized the video feed had dropped, the drone had reached 700ft. I started walking towards the drone and luckily it was still within visual line of sight so I was able to fly it back. Once I got within 500ft the video was re-established.

My HS720E will not maintain a stable hover regardless of the altitude and no wind. Even with GPS locked into 16 satellites, compass calibration, and gyro calibration it continuously drifted left, right, forward, backward which requires constant input to keep it steady. The constant drifting makes it difficult to really capture video or still pics of a subject your trying to capture.

It's unfortunate because my first hs720e didn't have these issues. I actually felt confident flying the first one passed 700ft. Not so much with the replacement. The only problem I had with the first one was an issue flying passed the 656ft distance.

I reported these issues to Holy Stone CS and their response was as follows:
1. Reinstall OPHELIA GO
2. Turn on airplane mode
3. Turn on the drone and the WIFI
4. Connect to Holy Stone WIFI and go to the application
5. Make sure to turn off the beginner mode
6. Go to parameter settings adjust the maximum distance to 999
7. Same issue, kindly send us a video on how you operated it.
8. Make sure to fly this one to an open field away from obstructions and good weather condition.

I did all these things except send them a video. I don't have anyone I can ask to video me while flying the drone.
- Since then I haven't had the issue of the drone flying away when hitting the takeoff button.
- I still have the hovering and drifting issues with the drone 10 to 20 ft away and less than 50ft up.
I can honestly say I still don't trust flying this drone for any real distance over houses or trees out of fear it will fly away or fall out of the sky. Maybe in time but for now I'm being very cautious.

Until Holy Stone gets their quality assurance together I can't really recommend this drone. Unless you don't plan on flying any higher than 200ft up and 300ft out, and don't really care about video and picture quality that much than go for it. Just be careful how far you fly and go to an open area.
Don't let the marketing features like follow me, point of interest, and tap to fly convince you because at the end of the day reliability is more important. Those features are fun but doesn't mean much if you have quality issues.

If you're serious about getting into entry level arial photography or pics, get a DJI mini 2. Yes the DJI Mini 2 is more expensive but it is an amazing drone with an amazing camera along with very solid flight characteristics. My DJI Mini 2 will sit at a very solid hover in 20mph winds with 30mph wind gusts. I know because I've taken video in these conditions from 250ft up and 2600ft out. No question about losing my DJI, no dropping the video feed, no drifting, no vibrating, intelligent batteries, much faster charging. Just smooth crisp video and pics.

title: Don't waste your time with other drones. This is the first drone you should buy!
text: [[VIDEOID:7bc221223486b5b42154cdd7b9d33641]] Cheaper drones are just a waste time and money. Drones less than 200 dollars are unstable and have a hard time flying even in light winds. The Holy Stone is a strong and dependable drone that does what it says it will do. When flying I feel in control ,because it always responds very well. One of the nicest thing about the drone is that I never lose video feed when I'm in range of the drone. The return to home works extremely well and this gives me confidence to push the limits when I want. The camera is fair, but for the money I'm very happy with the electronic stability. See the video. Overall this drone can give you a real quality experience and prepare you for the much more expensive drones that are double the price. Well done Holy Stone!

title: The Best Customer Support
text:
I have been wanting a good, more professional drone since I owned a "Cheapy" in 2019. I kept crashing it because I couldn't keep pressing the throttle all the time. I thought I wasn't smart enough for this hobby. But, I have been checking out drones at different price ranges and options ever since. I am retired and on a budget, so I need the best one I can get for the money I have to spend. Also, being an old guy, I thought this would be the perfect way to keep my brain challenged. Playing Solitaire can get boring.
I chose the Holy Stone HS720E because of all the reviews I have read and videos I have watched on YouTube. It made it the Logical choice for a drone under $300.
After receiving it and reading the instruction manual thoroughly, I flew it using up both batteries, and noticed a couple of issues. So I emailed Holy Stone on a Sunday explaining the problems, hoping to get an answer back someday. And nowadays... wondering if I would get an answer at all. To my surprise and amazement, I received an answer that day with a checklist to solve my problems. Which it did. Thank you Holy Stone for restoring my faith in the human spirit.
I am sure I will enjoy many hours of flying, taking pictures and videos with my HS720E. The camera takes great pictures and with the video stabilization feature, I am very happy with how steady the video is. Yes, I could have spent a bunch more money for a two or three axis gimble camera, But this has a lot of bang for the buck.
Thank You Holy Stone

title: Holy stone 720e
text: Awesome drone.  Great product. You will not be disappointed.

title: Well made and easy to operate
text:
I have about 4 hours of flying time. I am a complete novice. The first thing I liked about Holy Stone's 720Eis was the quality of the drone and associated materials. Really appears solidly made. The transmitter operates with two 1.5 AA batteries ! I like the fact you can recharge the flight battery via USB BUT it does take 5 hours per. I am in a near suburb of Chicago so my range is limited to about 300 yards distance but at that range I cant see the drone anyway which brings me to a REAL good reason to own it, auto return to home. I thought I had lost it, no visual, no sound and the picture dropped out BUT, a minute or two later it showed up over my head. Whew ! was I relieved !

It is extremely stable. I was in 30 MPH gusts today and you would never know it as it hovered about 100 feet up. I decided not to tempt fate however and landed soon after. The FPV picture is also very very stable with the EIS feature, no rocking at all. One minor issue is I lose the video at about 300 yards which is not a show stopper as long as RTH is properly engaged. Battery life is more than adequate, I'm getting about 30 minutes per flight. I suggest Holy Stone work on the FPV software as it would add to the flight experience to be totally immersed in the flying process instead of watching on your phone. Other than that its a great product and I highly recommend it !

All in all a great first drone for the enthusiast.
