title: Customer service is unmatched
text:
I've had this drone for a few months now - it's a very nice drone and has all the features I was looking for.

This review is to describe the incredible customer service at Holy Stone. As a beginner, I've had some "issues" more related to my inexperience than due to anything wrong with the drone. They have been very, very helpful! I've been communicating with them via email, and they always get back to me in 24 hours.

I had issues with the range, likely due to too much interference in my area, but they sent me a new controller anyway to see if that would help. When I went to try out the new controller, I crashed the drone and broke one of the legs, and they sent me a replacement part at no charge.

I've been very impressed with Holy Stone. I'm now a lifetime customer.

title: Unbelievable for the price! Very very very happy.
text:
I researched for weeks and finally decided on the HS 720e. Boy I'm glad I did
This drone is unbelievable for the price. The camera is extremely stable and the receiver is good to a mile away. I'm still just blown away. You will not find a better Drone for under 800 bucks. And it's only 3. I love it.. 10 thousand stars...

title: Nice for the price!
text:
This is my son's second drone, which is a significant upgrade from the starter drone that wore out years ago.

The start up took about 30 minutes but he was in the air in no time. The controls are crisp and response time is good. We had some issues with it glitching out which lead to him having an unfortunate crash and causing quite a bit of damage, I'm not sure what the connection issue is or if was simply an isolated event.

At any rate, I spoke with an individual from HS and they were helpful and courteous on the phone.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND purchasing the warranty with the product (which I thought I did, but did not 🤔🥴) because you cannot purchase a warranty after the initial product purchase.
They do offer a 30d warranty, which is nice.

Once again, great product for the price and it's great to learn on. Just make sure you establish that you have a good connection prior to attempting to navigate around a structure where you depend on your screen to find your way.

title: Please do not buy- Does not respond to remote
text:
*UPDATE*

After posting my initial review (noted below by the "---",) I received an email from the company thanking me for my purchase, and asking how they could make the situation right, as they wanted me to have a good experience with their company. I thanked them for reaching out, and informed them that I had already purchased another drone from a different seller. They replied and stated that they would still like to make the situation right, and offered to send me "their best drone" at no charge. I stated that that would not be necessary and re-iterated that I had already purchased another drone, however they asked again if they could send me another drone at no charge. I figured I would be happy to try the Holy Stone brand again, and would either have two drones, or could give one of them away to my brother who has been thinking about purchasing a drone.

After a bit of back and forth with Holy Stone, I sent them my address to ship "their best drone" to me at no charge. After I sent them my address, they replied, stating that before they could send me the drone, they would need me to either edit or delete my initial review on Amazon of their product. This was red flag number one.

I told them that I would not and could not change my review, until the replacement drone arrived and I had a chance to fly it to give honest feedback. They replied stating that "they weren't sure if they'd be able to get managerial approval to issue me a replacement device at no charge with the negative review on Amazon." I stated that that was fine, a replacement drone wasn't necessary- if they wanted to send me one, great, if not, no big deal, but I would not be changing my review until I had a chance to try their product again.

Again, after more back and forth, they confirmed that they would be sending me "their best drone" at no charge, despite my negative review remaining on Amazon for the time being.

The "new" drone arrived a few days later. I noticed when it arrived that the box was open, but didn't think much of it, I figured they probably send returned items out if they're sending free drones out. When I opened the box, I discovered that it was either the same exact drone that I had previously returned to them, or it was another drone that had the same exact issues as mine- snapped prop arm, scratched up propellers, etc.

A whole lot of wasted time and energy. After I notified them that they sent me a broken drone, they told me there was nothing else they could do as they had already sent a replacement drone at no charge. Extremely disappointing. I would have been less upset if they had just refunded me my money and left it at that, but to then tie me up in back-and-forth communications for weeks regarding a free replacement drone, wasted my time, and only set me up for further disappointment by their company. PLEASE save your money and buy a DJI drone. Much better quality, and certainly much better customer service if and when you need it.

---After doing a little bit of research and watching some comparison videos, I decided to purchase this drone, despite being advised against it by other reviews, and some friends (who insisted a DJI drone was the way to go....) Boy were they right!

Admittedly, I have never flown a drone before in my life. When the drone was delivered, I took it out of the box, read the owners manual, and watched a few youtube videos to see if there was anything I needed to know, and took it outside to try it for the first time. Once I got the drone set up, and the controller/drone connected to my phone's wifi, it was time to go. I fired everything up, raised the drone off the ground, and without touching anything on the remote, the drone looped around and smashed in to the side of my house (cracking the siding) as if it had got caught up in a big gust of wind.... the only thing was, there was no wind whatsoever. I thought "that's very strange" and figured I'd try it again. The second time I got it off the ground, I had a little more success, but not much. The drone just didn't seem to want to react to what I was doing on the controller.

I took the drone back inside and decided to watch a few more youtube videos about this particular model. The following weekend, I took the drone to my parents' house, who live on 7 acres of completely open land with minimal obstructions. Once there, I had a little more luck as there weren't many obstructions, but during the third flight of the day, I once again lost complete control of the drone (which I was standing almost directly under.) The drone took off full speed and slammed into a pine tree. It bounced off the trunk of the tree several times before it swooped around and went straight towards the house, crashing in to the deck, completely snapping off one of the prop arms.

Luckily, Amazon stood behind the purchase and issued me a full refund, but I was extremely disappointed as I was looking forward to using the drone. I got to use it a total of 5 times, all of which were not stellar experience.

I found a DJI Phantom 3 standard on facebook marketplace and it is like night and day. The DJI is SO easy to fly, the photo and video quality are a thousand times better, it has more features.... I'm so happy with my new purchase. Please, do yourself a favor and spend the little extra money and buy a DJI drone, even if it's used. You truly do get what you pay for.

I forgot to mention, while I was trying to gain control of the drone at one point, it did hit me in the leg, slicing my leg open by one of the props. I didn't even realize it had cut me until later when I noticed blood on my leg. If you do by this drone, please be careful if you lose control of it!

title: Enjoy but few issues
text: The unit is very easy to control, and has great features. Holy stone customer service is top notch and will help u any way they can to help u learn to fly and if any issues. The drone is so easy to fly. My some got a different drone made by another company and it was so hard to fly and was crashed and damaged in first flight. Holy stone was the easiest and best drone out there in my opinion

title: Service after the sale
text: The drone was great and the extra battery reward was a plus..AND any questions I had were answered quickly…OCB

title: Very pleased
text: Drone is very easy to get started with, was up and flying with no trouble. Picture and video quality is amazing. I'm looking forward to using for my intended purpose, which is aerial survey of property I own.

title: Great Customer Service
text:
I recently had a problem with my HG720e. I email Holy Stone support and they took care of the issue by replacing my drone in 3 days. I felt that they went over and beyond of what my expectations were.
Thank you for standing behind your product and you have a very happy customer.

title: The Holy Stone HS720E is THE BEST DRONE for the money in its price range and more fun than I can say
text: I love this drone.  I had previously purchased a smaller cheaper brand-x drone and was instantly in love with the concept of small unmanned aircraft flight.  I immediately started researching drones in general and found that the Holy Stone HS720E was the absolute best buy on the market for drones in its price range.  After taking it out for the first time, I realized that this is true.  You would have to spend a lot more money to get even one more major feature than what this drone has.  It's easy to fly and helps to keep a new pilot out of trouble.  I can't even begin to say how much fun the Holy Stone HS720E is to fly and how exciting it was to do so.  I had trouble going to sleep the first night because I kept playing over and over in my mind the different things the drone was able to do in flight.  You can't go wrong with the Holy Stone HS720E.  I will fly it for years.  More fun than anything I've done in years.

title: A great Drone from a great company
text: The 720E is a great drone: easy to learn and easy to operate. The best part is how great HolyStone treats its customers. They remind how companies treating their customer years ago. They are the best company that I have dealt with in thirty years. The drone performs at a level of much more expensive drones. I highly recommend the 720E.

title: A high end drone at at GREAT price!
text:
After spending hours researching drones, I finally decided on the Holy Stone HS720E. Holy Stone did a wonderful job on this one. With the features and price point, this thing is hard to beat.

The ease of setup and flying is wonderful. As a beginner, it is easy to fly and the phone app is user friendly. The auto landing and return to home feature will undoubtedly safe me from time to time. The camera records in multiple settings. It records on the micro SD card at 4K at 30 FPS or 1080 at 60 FPS. The app also directly records to your phone. The WiFi connection remains strong at far distances and video remains clear throughout each use, making the 4K video on the SD Card a delight to review. The only real complaint I have is the battery charging time, but that is to be expected with all drones. With both batteries charged, you have plenty of time to get the footage you need.

Overall, this is a great drone - good picture, easy to use, great price!

title: Great drone, simple to use and nice camera.
text:
My first drone. Its quit easy to use and pretty failsafe if you use it properly. The vid and pictures are pretty decent. Pics are awesome and vids are really good. Image stability works very good.
I gave a S10 phone and it holds well on the controller. I did have to take off the gorilla case in order for it to fit. I wish the camera had more settings to make WB or color adjustments but that can be done in video editing software. The vids look slightly washed out.
Its less then half the price of the mav2 so its great for starting out before moving up. The vids on Amazon and YouTube are compressed so they really don't show the beautiful pics and vids it takes. Use the proper sd card, a lot of YouTube review channels offer discount codes so look around.

title: The price point of this drone is fantastic.
text: This is my first drone and i found it very easy to setup. On my first flight I flew it into a tree and had to change my propellers then it would not fly. I called the support number and they told me I have A and B propellers and they have to be on the correct motor shafts.  The support people are fantastic they are very knowledgeable and had me flying in minutes.

title: Fun to fly
text: Easy to learn and fly. Good for beginners. Takes great pictures.

title: Bad cheep product over priced much better options
text: Camera broke after first flight , called support they asked for video and other things ; cheep product not worth the money

title: Super Solid Drone For the Money
text: I love this drone! It's amazing how far drones have come in the past few years. This drone has auto-hover, good photo and video quality, is very smooth & stable and has great battery life; the only other thing I could wish for is obstacle avoidance (maybe next year).

title: Wind,signal
text: It’s not as strong as it says in the wind, you can’t control it very well with mild wind speed and you lose connection when drone goes not that far

title: Horrible X 3!!!
text: Kind of works ONLY when it wants to! Lifts off SOMETIMES at sea level but NOT at higher elevations due to weak motors or prop design due to less air density in the mountains. Other drones do fine up there! It wont respond to joystick controls 90% of time! Camera color is way off! And no way it's 4k! China frauds! Not getting any response when I click on return policy. Holystone offered me a FREE battery so I accepted and it showed AA batteries! Not NiCad!? Then I said I would rather have the $50 as the other offer but NO response. I want to return for full refund, so if you're listening Holystone! Contact me!

title: Nice hardware not so good camera
text: Very far from what I was expecting but I guess ot comes with the price.

title: Very nice drone!
text: MY husband did a lot of research and picked this drone for me as a gift. I love it! It was very easy to learn how to fly and it takes great pictures. I also recommended it to a friend and she loves it as well!

title: Excellent drone, even for beginners
text:
Wanted to try a drone, just for recreation. The HS720 is very user friendly, even for someone just starting out.
The controls are easy to learn, the hovering is extremely stable, and the ability to take pictures/video very easy. It's been a very good experience. When I ran into a couple of questions along the way, the Holy Stone reps are wonderful to work with. They work very hard to understand the issue, and then provide possible solutions, following up until you're satisfied. Holy Stone gets 5 stars for customer service alone!

title: Disappointing....
text: After reading reviews and wathing "unboxing" and other videos, I decided to go with this drone for my 13 year old's birthday gift.  Nice looking product and case but directions (Chinese to English) pretty weak....IMAGINE that!! And the app to control the drone  HA!! .....it's trash too.  Wifi connection from phone to drone is not great, app freezes.  Drone flight is okay....."follow me" function sucked, When in "orbit mode" the drone cannot be controlled (except altitude) OR LANDED!!!  Drone seems to drift alot when in "hover" (no wind) and the "return home function" is not exactly accurate (misses the mark by 8'-10' consistently.  At times, after the "power off" function used on the remote, three of the props would turn off but one would continue to spin and at other times two would turn off and then other times NONE turned off which meant the drone could not be picked up .  Ultimately the drone's lack of response to controls (only about 100 feet away) led to it being flown into a tree and breaking. Overall, I am not satisfied clearly and will be researching other drones.

title: small but fast and well equipped
text: [[VIDEOID:c586243d1b8e87f7dc215889444513a5]] It is fascinating to observe the landscape from above, it makes your mind fly, this DRONE is very light and versatile, easy to maneuver, its 4k camera allows to obtain a high resolution of photo and video, its movements programmed to orbit your environment, the  "Follow me" give you the option of taking aerial and panoramic shots.  its case makes it easy to transport taking up little space and going unnoticed ... it's great

title: Awesome drone for beginners
text:
So I have nothing but praise for this drone. It is easy to learn but you need to master your surroundings.

I'm glad I've bought this particular drone, because it is for beginners. But also it doesn't hold your hand either.

You still have to learn how to properly navigate around your surroundings tho it seems more challenging at first but it's not at all.

As far the remote control I think it leaves more to be desire to be fare. I don't like the antennas cuz it's only one really, while other is space holder for something else
I get it, but still why put that for...... outside
my issue.

Overall I'm very happy about my purchase Once I master this drone I will be buying future drones. As I close this small review I just want to say thanks.

title: Great for beginners
text: I purchased this drone for my son. Neither one of us have any experience flying a drone. It was very simple to fly. The user manual was very helpful and descriptive.  The only downside is the length of time it takes to charge the battery. But after looking at several other drones it seems to be common with most. I would recommend this drone for a beginner at a good price.

title: Very easy to pick up a new hobby with this drone
text: This is my very first drone. Did some research and found several recommendations for this particular model based on the the quality of the camera and EIS technology, the battery life, and most importantly its suitability for beginners. The speed settings are great because they allow for more precise control if, like me, you're not confident with the controls on the first few flights and helps keep the drone in your line of sight. I would recommend checking out some YouTube videos to see the controls in action and learn the necessary routine to prepare the drone for take off (connecting the remote, phone app, calibrating drone etc). Highly recommend this model and the Holy Stone brand specifically. The company supports its products well and offers incredible customer service!

title: Impressive video stability
text: [[VIDEOID:249fb517d68865e633e1b4de2913f28a]] Very impressive video stability. I flew it smoothly and roughly (twitchy) on purpose for comparison. Video looks rough but nowhere near as rough as I was flying. Details remained very good. Heaviness and software keeps it stable in wind too. My only complaint is that it consistently lands about 1 meter off when using Return Home function. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

title: REVIEW UPDATE NUMBER TWO
text:
Tried to fly my replacement drone after it's first initial flight. Much to my dismay, it acted like my initial drone and took off on its own. First time, it took off laterally and on its second flight, it did its ever expanding circles again. I appreciate the company sending out a replacement which at least shows good faith, but when the second drone acts like the first it tells me that there are quality control issues that they are not addressing.
After getting in contact with Holy Stone they sent out a replacement drone. I still haven't had a chance to try all of the functions, but at least the GPS return to home, distance, and height functions work on this one. The only problem I had was getting it to keep the WiFi connection on the app at first. Once I was able to connect, it seemed to work fine. (Previous review) I purchased the HS720e and haven't of been able to fly it successfully. I have followed the directions and have even went online to make sure that I have set up the drone properly. I have the correct system lights to indicate proper operation as well as the GPS indicating 16 satellites locked. On my first flight I had it take off automatically and once I raised it in the air 50 feet it took off to the right by itself. Fortunately I was able to gain control and bring it back to my area. I tried the return to home button and it wouldn't work. The second time I flew the drone I had it locked on to GPS and again wouldn't operate properly. It had it take off automatically and just let it hover 5 feet off of the ground. It then started elliptical circles with each one being bigger than the other. I tried the return to home but the indicator on my phone said that it was. I made sure that I was 1000 feet away from any WiFi or power lines just to make sure that there was no interference. I contacted Holy Stone support (not easy to do since their hours are 6:30pm to midnight PST. The agent told me that tech support would contact me, and to this date they haven't. I also tried contacting them through Amazon support and they still haven't responded.

title: Wouldn't recommend for beginners.
text: I purchased this drone and the HS 120D at the same time.  Love the 120D. This drone was returned.  Too heavy and too long of a charge time and not that much better for a beginner compared to 120D.  Seemed not to fly as reliably as the 120 and 3x the price.  This amount of weight crashing would not have good results for a beginner. The camera is nice!

title: Great drone for the price
text: Great flying drone, very easy to use, and made with strong durable products. This is definitely designed to shoot video more than air acrobatics, so keep that in mind when making your purchase.

title: Drone has Rogue takeoff
text: I liked this drone for a while easy to fly and learn. But after about my fith or sixth flight I could fly it for about 5 to 10 minutes and then it would just take off on its own. And it would almost if not crash. I changed the props and it still did it. I called holy stone and reported the problem and they said to take a video of of it doing this. But its a little hard to take a video of it while I'm flying it and impossible when I'm trying to get control of it when it takes off on me. When I hover it it drifts around a lot and thats with 10+  Satellite. I guess it will be my last holy stone.

title: Slight learning curve but exciting when you "figure it out"!
text: [[VIDEOID:d38b35fce540c1961f0a7fc1b5e8e5a5]] This is my first drone.  My wife bought it for my birthday and because we are going on vacation to Utah (Moab, etc.) this summer.  We think this will be very cool to bring along and get some pics/vids from a new perspective (aerial)!  This review should be taken in the frame of thought that I am a beginner.  This review is meant to help other beginners who may face the same "issues" I had when first operating the drone.  Read the manual first but don't expect to memorize it.  There is quite a lot of information like max altitude, what happens when you press the "return to home" buttons, surfaces not to fly over, etc.  Don't be overwhelmed, but be as informed about what to expect before you fire it up for the first time.  I cranked it up in my living room on it's "maiden voyage" and immediately crashed into my couch.  Guess what...I didn't think it was that important to calibrate the drone like the manual instructed me to do!  Obviously, I was wrong!  The good news is, so far, the drone seems to be very well built.  The couch wasn't my first crash.  I crashed it relatively hard several times (maybe 3 or 4).  The blades have some scuffs and even some nicks after the crashes and the drone still flies great!  The drone comes with replacement blades should you need them.  Thankfully, I haven't crashed badly enough to need to replace them yet.  ;-)  Ok, to get to the meat of my limited knowledge so far.  The most important point, imho, is to realize that the drone is defaulted to "beginner mode".  I don't know if it states that in the manual (probably does), but that made me think that the drone was defective.  The first time I took it outside to test it out, it would go only so far away and just hover not responding to controls.  Apparently, when it reached the beginner limit (49 ft.) it won't let you do anything else.  I found this out when I got back from vacation (I took it to Colorado with me to test it the first time).  I thought that it was the snow and cold that may have been causing it to behave irradicably.  At my home, about 65 degrees outside, it still wouldn't let me control it when it went a certain distance.  After perusing the Ophelia Go app, I found the "beginner setting", switched it off, and, hooray, I was flying like a champ.  The video I posted with this review is the very first test flight not knowing about the "beginner mode" so don't judge me!  ;-)  Another issue I experienced that is nowhere in the manual is how difficult separating the antennas on the remote would be.  Be advised, you have to pull pretty hard to get those suckers apart but they will come apart!  The phone holder on the remote holds my LG V60 very sturdily.  I had to take mine out of the case in order for it to fit, though.  Oh, the flight time is severely limited in extreme cold.  The instructions tell you not to operate below 32 degrees fahrenheit.  My first flight was at about 10 degrees fahrenheit.  It probably flew for approximately 5 minutes before the battery notified me that it was low!  This lets you know that you can fly in colder, but you probably shouldn't nor would want to.  I just wanted to get a decent shot of our cabin and was excited to play with it!  In the end, take my advice or not, don't test it indoors first.  Go outside with as few trees or other obstacles as possible.  This drone does not have "obstacle avoidance".  Drones with that feature cost substantially more.  Overall, I'm having fun with this little drone and look forward to taking some great pics/vids on our next vacation in Utah.  Hopefully, I'll remember to come back to this review and upload some of them.  Hope you have great fun with your drone!

title: Great first drone
text: I decided to pull the trigger on a drone and I'm glad I chose this Holy Stone drone. Being a beginner, I was nervous spending a lot of money and crashing it the first day. The instructions were very clear and made the learning process very easy. I had an issue with the controller, contracted customer service and received a replacement in 2 days. They were extremely quick and remedied the situation perfectly. My only con so far is it takes a long time to charge the batteries but luckily, this drone comes with 2. I am very happy with this purchase, I recommend Holy Stone!

title: Easy to fly
text: this thing is awesome!  First drone, and I was flying like a pro in 10 min. Easy to set up and any one can use. Great buy.

title: Solid product. Well packaged
text: Best drone for the price!

title: Returned and went with a better drone.
text: The first one I had worked great, but it got away from me and crashed into a lake.  The second one the bottons on the remote were reversed, the third one the GPS did not work properaly.  At that point I went with a DJI.

title: Great First Drone
text: easy to learn, easy to find parts, get spares, and a great price

title: Extremely happy!
text:
[[VIDEOID:50e493579cc034138497d0672985c30f]] I recently retired at 75 and have been flying cheap drones to see if I liked flying!
After settling on the Holy Stone 720E’s positive reviews I Baught one. So easy to fly without having to jump through many hoops to get airborne! I love it and thoroughly recommend the product 👍

title: Great Drones..great company.
text: This is an awesome drone. Video and picture quality is great. Easy to fly and very stable. Good for beginners. I crashed a drone that didnt have altitude hold and gps alot until I bought this one and no more crashes. I did have a problem with a glitch in the EIS sensor. You will have that every once in a whole if you produce thousands of drones this advanced. Customer service was excellent! I sent them pictures after I started having the problem. They immediately put another drone in the mail. Top notch company.

title: We were sent two batteries and one did not work
text: If you’re looking for an incredible drone, I would suggest you get this one. It’s well worth the money and you won’t regret your purchase. The customer service department is amazing. I had a minor issue, sent an email and a wonderful man name Bill helped me immediately. I couldn’t be more happy. If I could give the customer service department 10 stars I would.

title: Must Calibrate Before Seeing Action
text: I'll start with the only thing that was a little bit of a head scratcher... the "compass calibration". You must complete this to even get the drones motors to rotate (after unlocking the motors as well). After this step it's fun and easy. I was surprised with all the extra accessories it didn't come with a USB 5v charging block (not that I didn't have many of these from cell phones laying around). It did come with two batteries, extra propellers and a nice storage case. Overall I'm very happy so far.

title: Fantastic drone for beginner flyers!
text: My girlfriend gave me an HS720E 4k EIS for my birthday and I couldn't be happier. Aside from it being a complete surprise, I've really enjoyed flying it in the short time I've had it. The instructions are pretty clear, for the most part (a little translation barrier here and there) and I was up in the air and flying after only an hour or so.  I'm still learning what this drone can do, and I'm pretty impressed.  I'm still more comfortable keeping eyes on it when it's in the air, but am gradually learning to rely on the remote control picture.  Practice, practice! Overall, this is a really great, full featured drone that's terrific for first timers and more experienced flyers, alike!

title: Very Happy with this UAV
text:
Adult beginner here. I originally purchased a toy drone that supposedly had video picture capabilities. Many claims of the toy were just not true. Only had 5 min flight times camera didn't work because of poor app etc...
Yes, I got what I paid for and was disappointed enough to get serious about a real drone that wouldn't break my
wallet. I read a lot of reviews on the top 5 or top 10 drones under five hundred bucks and this one was given high
marks every time. This one came with extra battery and that was a plus because the original toy had taught me
extra batteries will be needed if you don't want to wait in between flights. When this UAV came I sat down and
read the manual. 45 minutes later I was outside for maiden flight. It has been my only flight so far due to
weather and had no problems first time out. I'm very impressed and very happy with it. It may be considered a toy to some but to me it feels like professional quality and flies perfectly. So far so good. I think anyone who purchases this
will be as happy with it as I am. The picture is from its only flight so far. It is only 720p captured from video.

title: Great First Drone
text: This is my first drone ever.  The ease of use is its highest compliment.  I really have enjoyed bringing this out to open air fields and to the nearby lake by my house.  Great for beginners.

title: As good as a drone twice the price
text: Wow, what a drone.  For the price/value this is one of the best purchases of a drone I have made.  I previously bought the Parrot Bebop.  This drone blows that out of the water.  The quality is fantastic comparable to a drone twice the price.  The ease of use is awesome.  My 9 year old son was flying it like a pro in minutes.  Easy enough to use for a beginner, functional enough for a seasoned flyer

title: Awesome drone for the money!  Great quality and well built.
text: I love the size and feel of this drone.  It is well-built and handles very well, even in breezy wind conditions.  It takes awesome photos and videos and is very easy to start flying right out of the box.  I'm very pleased with my purchase and the customer service is very good too.  Great drone for your buck if you don't want to spend a fortune on a DJI Mavic.

title: Updated. Cs did good
text: Updated: (4-3-2023) Seller did good on a replace. I was just going to fix mine. The replacement one works good. A little touchy in wind but did fine. This is not a $1200-5000 drone but does the job. Holy stone seems to be good people and treated me well. I left the original post for honesty but as you can read i updated it. I believe this is a good first drone. Was so exited to get the drone. Lasted 4 min. One the book says charging is 5 hrs for 20 min runtime. Fine. 7 hrs later still charging. Finally flew it and did fine for the first few mins then wouldnt respond. Lucky it was only about 2 ft from the ground when crash. No damage, but had to reach between the blades to pull battery to shut off. Ok after that and reset tried again. Flew fine for a few mins got alittle height and didnt respond. It was 50 ft from me. It crashed in a tree and well damage. 1 arm snapped and the other snapped when folding back into place. Very very thin plastic. And also noticed the body was getting hot. Not impressed. You get what you pay for i guess.

title: First Time Drone Owner
text:
This is the first drone I have ever owned. I was surprised at how simple this product was to use. The only thing I didnt really care for is the phone holder on the remote control.

Other than that I can say it is very simple to fly and has a lot of really cool features. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking to start flying drones.

title: 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Entry level drone.
text: 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ALL THE WAY!!!!! I cant say enough on how I am impressed with the HolyStone HS720E. I would compare this drone to the more expensive brands made by DJI without a doubt, that is how impressed I am with this drone. For a beginner and entry price you cannot go wrong with this drone. Especially for a RTF. Everything is ready to go with a simple 5 min read of the instructions, your in the air in no time!

title: Holy stone drone
text: When I originally bought my drone it had a manufactures defect I reached out to customer service they were quick fast and efficient to get me another one free of charge the drone works great 5 out of 5  stars all day

title: Easy for beginner and good quanlity
text: I bought this as a gift for my husband, He likes it very much. Very easy to use and the instruction is easy to follow. For whatever reason, the drone was hit by a tree and the camera is broken. Since it's in the warranty, we contact Holy Stone and quickly get a response and they will replace a new one for us.

title: This is one of the best and easiest drones I have ever flown
text: This is the greatest drone I've ever had.  It takes video's that are 99.9% Hollywood looking except for the occasional jitter from a high gust of wind.  Not only does it come back to you and lands in front of you if the signal is lost, it will follow you around, you can tell it where to go on the map and one of the greatest things I've ever seen on a drone is the ability to recover if you have an accidental run in with a tree.  Ooopsy.  I am amazed they don't advertise that point since it has saved the drone from crashing several times.  If you simply release all controls this drone will stop mid air and hold it's position and altitude, even when it's windy.  I absolutely love this thing, and now after a run in with a huge rock in my back yard, I will be ordering another.  It didn't recover from the full speed impact into a big rock.  But I do have spare parts now. :)

title: Great drone at a great price.
text: This drone came straight out of the box almost ready to fly, I downloaded a very nice app on my smart phone and put in the batter and followed a very simple calibration and was in the air within a couple of mins. Flying the drone was easy to learn and I had it under control in just a couple more mins. While flying I took some very nice pictures and video. Gotta say this is a great drone, better than the what the low cost should be.

title: Fast & smooth drone with great video quality and features
text: [[VIDEOID:1bb7fb98095253b7196c2772ebf91e8f]] Fast & smooth drone with great video quality and features. Really good battery life and nice that it comes with 2 batteries, which last 20+ minutes each depending on usage, and a carrying case. The remote works well and is responsive but the phone mount could be improved though it works fine. Overall awesome drone and much better than my first drone (DBPOWER UDI U818A WiFi FPV Quadcopter) and I plan to use it a lot on hikes with the follow me feature and take some cool pics & videos outdoors and at the beach.

title: Flying my HS720E
text: Enjoying flying the HS 720E. It follows commands without any surprises steady in the wind it will hover in one place and not move. I would buy this again.

title: Affordable quality drone!
text: Drone was delivered on time and looks great. Has everything you need to get started and with spare props too! Can't wait to get it in the air....need to register it for the hobby flying!

title: Solid performance
text:
Have had this for a week or so and impressed with controls so far. Am disappointed there's no propeller guards available but that would complicate the folding process.

For the price point it seems to be a pretty good choice, Ophelia Go is much better than Ophelia GPS I had to use for my prior drone.

title: Better than expected
text: The "E" in this HS720E model means the images captured by the camera are substantially smoother than the previous model.  Putting this ~$300 drone by Holystone on par with the ~$500 drone from DJI (Mini 2).  But hey, you just saved $200! I believe this drone is, as of Christmas 2020, the best valued drone currently available.

title: Fun and Easy
text: This drone is a lot of fun and doesn't have a long learning curve. I took a day looking over the user manual while the batteries charged and had a good understanding of what was possible straight out of the block. I also watched a couple of YouTube videos. When I took it out for the first time I was able to maneuver the drone very easily after doing the calibration. The only thing that surprised me was the drone doing a sharp upward thrust when you ask it to RTH...almost hit a power line. I highly recommend this little drone!

title: Just buy one from Costco.
text:
I’ll just say. But a different drone. I’m literally on the phone with customer service now with issues rotating the drone mid flight. They asked me to “call back” after I’ve tried disconnecting the app. They finally admitted to having issues with the app. They want me to call back after I’ve tried flying it without the app. Just save yourself the struggle. Also. 46 minutes of flight?! Scam. 23 mins per battery. It comes with two. And 4K is not 4K. More like 720. I have an iPhone 12 and a 4K QLED tv and the quality from this camera is absolute trash.
I want my money back.

title: Love it so far
text: I’m a newbie so I’m amazed

title: My mistake on my review
text: I found the manual. So I apologize for my negative feedback. My mistake

title: Holy stone 720 E
text: As a beginner drone, its a good start. I like flying the drone, I haven't had a problem with it yet, just need to make sure that you calibrate your gyro and compass, flying should be easy from then on.

title: Great Drone!
text: I purchased this drone in hopes of learning on an inexpensive model. This has been a wonderful purchase. It was super easy to learn. I even let my 15 year old son take it for a spin. Both the pictures and video are great. I have had it in high wind situations and the video was not shaky at all and the stability was much better than I could have hoped for. The only down side to the product was that I have to take my iPhone plus out of the case to get it to fit on the controller. A larger holder for the controller would be ideal but has been manageable either way.

title: Great first drone for a beginners.
text:
Shopped around for months before deciding to buy the HS720e. The specs on the 720e were the best in my price range. once the drone was received i was immediately impressed with the way it was presented in the carrying case. during my set-up i had a few questions so i sent an email to Holy Stone support. I was really impressed with how hast their response was. So far due to weather conditions I have only flown a flew a few times, but I was very happy with how easy it was to control. Cant wait till the weather improves so I can get more air time in.
All the reviews I read mentioned how good the Holy Stone support was, and I must say that I fully agree. If you are a first time drone buyer this is the unit for you. You will love the Return to home feature.

title: Great drone for novice and experienced
text: This is the first drone I ever had. The instruction manual at first seemed a little intimidating but after watching videos on YouTube and some hands on, I took it to a wide open space to get some flight time. Had it hovering and flying in no time. The pictures and videos are awesome. For the price you won't find a better drone.

title: Great Little Learner Drone
text: This is my first drone, got it while on sale, and I think it's perfect for learning drone basics before moving on to higher end production drones or building your own. I did have some issues with my first drone, wasn't able to fully test it until after the 30 day exchange window, but after a few emails Holy Stone agreed to replace it for me. Excellent customer service. I love the basic features of this drone, the Return To Home feature works great, as does the Follow Me including "tripod mode." The remote is simple to understand and operate, but will not hold larger phones in their cases, including Samsung Ultras or the Note 10+, they fit fine with the case removed though. The app is intuitive and I love that there are multiple camera settings on a budget drone. I plan on operating this drone for a couple years while buying parts to build my own long range drone, by then I should be pretty good with it. I do wish I had bought the 720G with the gimbal, but I wanted the extra battery in this package for the same price. As long as the wind isn't too bad it takes great, stable videos, especially after post-editing.

title: Great Drone for the price
text: [[VIDEOID:955ce5a0f561fee87201ab9140b5cc1c]] I first saw this drone on youtube decided to purchase one and I'm loving it .what a relaxing feeling drone flies great, the only bad part is waiting for your batteries to recharge so you can fly again

title: Very stable, no risk for beginners.
text:
I have never owned a drone before, but I recently saw one and decided it could be useful to take pictures from the air. I did a good bit of internet research, and decided that the HS720 E 4K EIS was a lot of drone for the money. I received it, read the very clear manual, got the phone, controller, and drone communicating, and up we go.

Being new at this, I was just amazed at the stability of the drone. Move it somewhere, take your hand off the joystick, and there it stays, even in moderately windy conditions. The image stabilization provides clear crisp delineation, as seen from my "test pattern", the battery life is as advertised, and the auto land was certainly useful for a beginner. This product is a great example of truth in advertising.

This is such an enjoyable way to get pictures, that I think I might go for the professional license. Should be a piece of cake, since I have a private pilot's license.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: My son received this drone for his birthday. He loves it. It is easy to use and takes great video. We commend Holy Stone as they stand behind this product 100%. We had an issue with our first drone, and customer service helped us by shipping a replacement part immediately. Their customer service was top of the line!  We are extremely happy with our purchase.

title: Happy!
text: Great customer service and a fun drone!

title: Best inexpensive drone
text: Took a bit to go through all the calibration and setup to fly.  After that it is easy to fly and pretty stable.  I bought it for my wife and she was able to fly right off with 5 min of instruction.  I got this to avoid all the air restriction lock downs I get with dji.  I only fly up to 20ft and don’t need all the nanny systems blocking out flight.  This is stable and has over 20min fly time with an easy quick swap battery.  So far I think it is a great deal for the price point.

title: Great Drone For the Price
text:
I did a lot of research before purchasing this drone, and for the money I think it's a great drone. After reading instructions and watching a few Youtube videos I was able to get the drone up and running. This thing takes great pictures and smooth video. All the buttons on the controller are easy access even for my big hands. This thing has great range and is very stable, I love how you press a button and it hovers in front of you about 5 feet .
The Pros:
Great Price
Very Smooth Video and Pics
Very Portable
The only thing that I think are the Cons would be :
5 hour battery charge time compared to other drones at 90 minutes
the cell phone holder is kind of wonky for my Oneplus 7T
Ophelia Go can take a while to connect.

title: 10 out of 10.
text: I’m new to drones, this is my first so I don’t really have anything to compare it to but my first experience was a good one. I found it fairly easy to get a feel for the controls, I practiced just flying and didn’t bother with the camera for a while. I maneuvered it around a fence post, backwards, forwards, sideways, flew low and slow but I really got the hang of it quite quickly. I attached my phone and started using the camera, it was a little strange at first watching the video as opposed to watching the drone and remembering that the controls reverse when it is flying towards you. I then disconnected my phone and linked it to my tablet to get a bigger picture, worked very well. I really like the fact that it comes in a nice case, has two batteries which gives me close to an hour of flying time and it seems fairly easy to fly. My only complaint is that the batteries seem to take an inordinately long time to fully charge. Overall though I think this is a terrific drone at the price  point it is at, I may upgrade in the future but I can see me using the HS 720 e for a long time.

title: First drone

title: Waiting for batteries to charge so I can try out my replacement
text:
First, very short usb charging cord and also it doesn't come with a wall plug so you have to rob one from your phone or ???? or run out to by one to get charging.
Unboxed it, looks and feels good. Phone holder a little small and barely holds my motorola with my protective case on it.
First flight, synced up good with 16 satelites. Pushed the auto take off and it jumped up and hovered for about 30 seconds before starting to circle. bigger and bigger the circle got until it ran into the front of my truck. 2nd flight, same thing. Up to 5ft hold and then automatically took off circling. Tried to save but along with my movements on the controls it still had a mind of its own. Hit kill button on the controller and let that sucker drop to the ground. 3rd flight, again it had a mind of its own as starting circling. Tried to control again but it was happier flying by itself until that skipping off the ground like a rock you threw skipping across the lake. Yup, gravel chipped up that set of blades.
Changed location to different park (in case there was too much interference although my phantom has never had a problem there) 4th flight, up to 5 ft hold and then the dreaded mind of its own. Boom, trash dumpster.
Returned that unit and will give my replacement a shot here after batteries charge. Thanks Amazon for the quick replacement.

title: Easy to use for begginers

title: Great drone for beginners!

title: Decent drone but didn’t have the range I need.

Wish the remote was chargeable instead of taking batteries, cuts down on extra or added costs. Decent drone but for the little bit of extra money I’d go with DJI’s Mini 2, it’s 100x better.

text:

It comes with 2 batteries and each one lasts about 15 minutes. The videos are sharp and in a convenient .MP4 format so they are easy to edit and upload to your favorite platform.

title: HolyStone hit a home run with this one.
text:
[[VIDEOID:f63930f114183936bf73fefb8614d603]] This drone was the first thing in the year 2020 to make me smile (even though it doesn't look like it in the video). It was super easy to learn. I've never flown an RC plane, car, or boat. So I was a bit worried taking the leap for a $300.00+ drone without starting with a less expensive one first. But the worry went way quickly after reading the instructions getting the FAA registration done and watching some people fly drones on Youtube. I spent 3 days making sure I was legal and knew the rules and on the 4th day I flew. Total air time was almost 40 minutes on a cold mostly overcast day with very little wind. I've been out twice since the first day The low quality video here is because the Micro SD card I had failed so I used my phone's video and I'm pretty sure that I had it in low res.
Like I said before, I'm a happy camper and look forward to honing my skills and photography. Good luck and happy droning

title: Major design flaw/defect/s.  As much as I wanted to love this I sadly would not recommend.
text: I must say that I’m rather dissatisfied on many levels with this product. I purchased this drone against my better judgement (I was going to get a Mavic Mini but this seemed like it would offer me much of the same for a SLIGHTLY lower cost.) I have a small amount of drone flying experience. I have a friend who has a mavic pro and I’ve flown it many times while hanging out with him. K cool. This drone constantly lost signal. I tried many different locations many different times of day I tried it all. I’d start with between 12 to 16 satellites and about 500 feet later out it goes. Never could I get it to fly further than 500 feet DISTANCE away before it would lose all signal and return to home. One of the reasons I wanted a drone was for the follow me feature. Ininline skate and want to make videos and take photos and this feature seemed perfect. IT NEVER WORKED! I tried watching videos. I downloaded manuals I read the paperwork it came with. I did everything as per instructed and never did that work. Tried different starting distances from myself different heights. Times of day. Weather. Geographical location you name it. Nothing. That initially infuriated me but I got over it and figured I’d make the best of it. Now going back to the go home feature when you lose signal (at 500 feet away every time). This drone doesn’t prevent itself from crashing!  You have no signal so you can’t control it. I tried to lower it with the joystick nothing. Tried making it go left right, nothing. Why would it though? It had no signal. So flying about 7-10 feet high in my backyard. Everything is great. It loses signal and so it takes off upward and sideways to return to home. Into a tree it went at a height of about 50-60 feet. (Pine trees in Florida). There was nothing I could do it toppled, I stupidly tried to catch it (don’t try that kids it sliced my arm on the way down) and then the snapped the leg on the ground. This is clearly a design flaw as trees DO tend to happen on this planet and lots of them. If it’s losing signal and just taking off not on the path it came but in a most straight line direct route to home. It’s going to hit a tree. Period. Mine did within the first week of my having it. Needless to say I now need a new drone as this was also going to be used in my business. Now I’ll be getting the DJI Mavic brand as those DO have a way of not wrecking themselves in trees and rendering themselves 350 dollar paper weights. Again I’m not pleased. If I wrecked it then I wouldn’t be writing this review. This needs to be fixed so until then I’d save yourself a nice chunk of change buy spending a little more and just buy a mavic.

title: Very Good Value for this Drone
text:
Wow....I was impressed. Didn't think it would be the quality in this price range.
Feels very well built and not cheap light plastic like other drones in this category.
Camera quality is impressive for this price range. Directions are very intuitive.
Comes with a very nice quality case and 2 batteries that do actually get about 20-25 minutes flight time.
Smooth, quiet, and stable flight and responds well to transmitter commands.
The app is easy to use and has some great flight and camera options.
This is a excellent value for the cost.

title: Great drone for beginners
text: Great drone for beginners, easy to learn. Even at windy day my first fly was great.

title: My first drone...and I'm impressed!
text:
I have no experience flying drones. Never flown one, and don't really know anyone who has one. But I've always thought they were cool. Well, on a whim, this was a Christmas present this year. And, I've been very happy with this purchase. I've not had too much flight time yet (still waiting for better weather), but here are my first impressions.

Packaging is quality. The provided case fits all the pieces well (drone, controller, batteries, miscellaneous) plus room for my phone. (FYI: I am using a Samsung Galaxy A50 with no SIM card exclusively for this drone. We had an extra one in the house and this then won't tie up my personal phone while I'm flying). The included set of props is a nice inclusion, and the battery charger is small and doesn't take up a lot of room

The build on everything seems solid and well put together. Extending the arms on the drone is smooth, and there is a firm "click" when fully extended. Collapsing the drone after flight is just as smooth. The controller is plastic, but moving pieces (antennae, phone holder, grips) have firm movements and feel tight and don't move around when using.

This drone is very easy to use. Instructions are simple and generally intuitive. I did watch some online reviews of this drone prior to purchasing so I did have some general understanding of the set up and controls prior to my first use. I definitely recommend talking the time to familiarize yourself in this way before your first flight.

Flight Prep is straight forward, including connecting you phone to the drove via WiFi, as well calibrating the drone's magnetic compass. Automated take off and landing makes getting into the air and back on the ground simple. In slow/tripod mode, the drone is very stable and easy to control. Speed is limited and provides an easy flight. Video is very stable, even with mild winds. The "image stabilization" is very effective, and I notice no wind or rotor vibration in the small number of videos I've shot to date.

I have not tested the limits of altitude or range at this point, and I've not drained the batteries to the point where the drone has automatically returned home. I have charged both batteries 3 times with no issues, and I've flown 20+ minutes on a charge and still show 50% charge. I'm not sure what the system has for buffers for a return flight, but I assume it's conservative to insure enough charge to get back to the origin and safely land.

I only have a few negatives at this point:

1) The phone mount on the controller is positioned in a way that it impedes easily using the buttons and switches on the shoulders of the controller. It may be less of an issue if you have a smaller phone, but I think the A50 I use is relatively standard from a size perspective.

2) The documentation / user manual could be better. It gives you enough to get you in the air and using the drone, but leave gaps. For example, you have the ability to turn the "beginner" mode off, so that you have full access to all limit controls, such as altitude, distance, orbit distance, etc. But it doesn't do a good job of explaining what the settings do when you change them. It takes a bit of practice figuring out the optimal setting for what you are trying to do, and this can be frustrating when your drone is 200 ft in the air and it won't do what you want it to do.

3) This may be overly picky, but the batteries do no charge simultaneously. So while the charger has two charging ports (one for each battery) they charge sequentially, and the second won't charge until the first is complete. With each battery taking as much as 5 hours to charge from a depleted state, plan on this being an "overnight" task. This could be a limitation associated with these batteries and a way to improve safety, but...

So, I would definitely support purchasing this if you've never had a drone before and are interested in getting into the hobby without too much of an initial expense. Granted, I've nothing to compare this one to, but I am having fun with it (and I didn't crash it on my first flight), and for me, right now, that's all I was looking for!

title: Excellent Auto-Stable, GPS Drone with High-Quality Camera
text:
[[VIDEOID:737d74f0c7587633ae806d0034f7bcf4]] As a previous drone owner, I felt more confident in my drone flying abilities and felt it was time to step-up and take my droning hobby to the next level. I decided to purchase the Holy Stone HS720E. There is such a remarkable difference from my previous drones. The notable key features include GPS, auto-stabilization, and the digital display on the remote. Instead of having to rely on the Ophelia Go phone app for signal strength, the controller helped me keep an eye on drone battery level, controller battery level, and most importantly GPS numbers. Although the drone has a failsafe feature for the drone to return to its takeoff location when the battery is low or signal is lost, the GPS count helped me realize when I might lose signal to go ahead and land. The drones 2 speeds allowed me to take it off of sport mode and let one of my kids try it out with slower movements without me having to worry about them veering hard in one direction hitting a wall or something and not having enough time to correct them.

The camera is absolutely wonderful! The new Electric Image Stabilization (EIS) feature made my photos and videos extremely clear. Previously, I’d have to stop the drone to take pictures or features but this feature allowed me to continue my flight having fun without sacrificing picture quality. The camera field of view adjusts 90° and allowed me to easily look straight down for overhead photos and look out on the horizon. The phone app to drone response time was superb as well allowing me to look at the phone for drone placement/pictures.

The only thing to make this even better was a nice carrying case, an extra battery, spare parts, and a charging station that can charge both batteries. While the charging station only charges one battery at a time, it auto-swaps once one battery is fully charged. So after a long day of flying, I plug both of them in and don’t have to worry about checking the battery and swapping them around to charge the other battery. I wake up to both batteries fully charged. Absolutely in love with this drone!

title: Friendlier  and Helpful Staff at Holy Stone
text: I was very appreciative of the quick response from Zoey at Holy Stone. She made sure I received my order by follow up contacts. Thanks for all the help and guiding me to the right place to show me how to replace part.

title: Huge quality and performance and a miniscule price
text:
Quality - the build quality, fit and finish and materials are top notch. Right up there with the name brands.

Flight characteristics - Super stable. Long flight times. I measured and get 22 minutes on average.

GPS and Go to home - awesome features to have and they do function as you would expect. Great to have at this price point.

Charging - takes about 5 hours per battery. Great charger with USB C included.

Presentation - nice carry case and good looking little drone

Video image quality - great! 4k 30 or 1080p both buttery smooth and high bitrate. Lots of detail. I only wish you could record audio from your phone... But that's nitpicking. There are apps for that.

Tldr; Great drone for anyone even a beginner. Won't break the bank either at half the cost of others that have the same features. I don't know how they can do it at this price point but my buddy has a mavic and is jelly since he spent so much more.

title: Good drone, easy to learn, video's could be smoother, lacking in flight time for the price.
text:
I bought this because I got tired of the smaller less expensive drones losing connection to the remote and flying off or crashing and breaking. I was looking for an fairly inexpensive model that also had a return to home feature.

The purpose of the drone was to teach my grandson how to fly them as he really has enjoyed the cheaper variants from other vendors but always gets upset when they fun ends because of the aforementioned issues.

I am very happy with the quality and capabilities for the price of it. It was easy to learn how to fly and handled well even in a decent breeze. Just make sure you are in a very open area if it's breezy to make sure that you have room to handle any drift issues because of the wind. Be smart when flying, It's not a fighter jet and if things start getting out of control stay calm and take your hands off the controls and let the GPS take over to let the drone correct itself. If you aren't trying to fly as fast and crazy as you "can" then you won't have to much trouble.

The camera was good, definitely use an SD card. I would have liked a smoother stabilizer as the video tends to be a bit jerky making the videos a little startling and difficult to watch. The video/photos that you capture and get sent to the phone aren't great but the SD card images/video are better.

Flight time isn't bad, only comes with one battery and extra batteries are a bit pricey but will likely buy some overtime so that I can fly it for more then 20 minutes every 5 hours. I feel like you need at least 4 batteries to really feel like you can use the drone a suitable amount of time for the price and at $75 a pop that's quite an investment.

title: Great entry level drone
text: This is my first drone and I've been very impressed.  The 2 batteries included are enough to keep me flying for over 30 minutes.  Strong winds can be a struggle for the small drone.  The ability to see the drone camera from my phone remotely is excellent.  The only negative I have is that the camera shots are a bit low quality, but that should be expected from an entry level drone.

title: Decent for the money

title: Amazing Drone!
text: This drone is so user friendly!

title: Great value for money  -- feature packed GPS drone with 4K camera
text: I researched for a reasonably priced GPS drone for a long time before deciding on the HS720E.  For the money it is a great value with the "nice to have" features.  Video stabilization, 4K, GPS, Return to home, orbit, follow me, automated flight - and other features.  Recommended!

title: Its great, but broken (my fault)
text:
Listen the product is great but here's a couple tips.

Do not fly near power lines, it'll spin out and crash.
Its easily swept away by wind so don't fly anywhere where you wont be able to find it after a crash.
And worst of all, do not fly on the beach because of it crashes and you get sand in there its over.

There are products that wouldn't have these problems but they're 5x the price so I'll take the L and buy another one. Easy decision.

More tips:
manual navigation is a bit jerky, its much smoother with orbit or gps mode
The video preview will stop if you get out of range but the local recording will continue
As stated above, there are certain places where you just shouldn't try to fly
the ophelio go app takes a while to get used to but it works

title: Great drone and excellent value; good company in terms of customer support
text:
I've had this drone for about 2 weeks and have some experience with them. In terms of value, this is a great buy and I'm very happy with it.

The EIS function works great and the 4K images are beautiful. There is no gimbal like the higher end drones. That doesn't matter to me but you will notice it slightly when the drone turns or shifts position. My main function is flying for fun and not commercial photography or movie making so consider your purpose. Of course, you will pay a lot more for a 4K gimbal and they will be much more sensitive when bumped.

Flying is great. One feature that drove me to this drone was the controller. It has a built in display with battery levels, GPS and signal strength. It can take a photo or video just using controller buttons and that means if you want to just do a quick flight, you are good to go without the phone. It means you can launch quick. I like the unlock/lock button and the one button takeoff. The auto land works but I think it may actually follow the phone. I haven't tested this yet but I noticed on return if I've backed up on the deck, the drone backs up when coming in and I have to adjust as it lands. If it did follow the phone GPS signal on auto return, that would be pretty cool. Or it could just be a minor variance in return location. Getting within a few feet is pretty typical for a return to home feature.

This unit uses the Ophelia Go app. There are a few critical reviews of the app and it rates a +-3 in the store. Most of these are related to having issues connecting to the drone. What I've determined is that it's dependent on the phone settings. *MAKE SURE* you have the 'Wifi Preferences' > 'auto-switch to mobile data' setting turned OFF! I tested and that seems to be the setting that is causing the issues. It makes sense if you think about it as the drone will not be providing an internet connection so the phone will cut it off. That would not be the fault of the app.

Overall, I like the app. It's pretty simple and easy to use without the 10 pages of disclaimers like in the DJY Fly app. 3 clicks and you are in and the rest is completely intuitive. One feature I was delighted to find was a digital zoom. It's a little small to use but really handy to be able to get a little closer to your subject. It's not always possible to fly closer safely so that's really valuable.

One app feature that did scare me a bit was the tapfly. This is where you tap and click on a map for where you want the drone to go and it then follows that flight plan. I 'believe' it actually downloads it into the drone after you hit submit. I had one experience with this where I had the wrong directions in and the drone did indeed do what I told it to do. The problem was I couldn't get the controller to cancel it. Perhaps the app was needed to do cancel or it's not possible but I will be staying away from that until I understand it more.

The drone itself is build solid and very strong. I did have one minor issue with my camera continuing to move after I let up the button. After a bit of troubleshooting it appears to have been in the controller and all I can say is that Holystone support was incredible. They worked with me over email to troubleshoot and resolve the issue. Every time I sent an email, I got a response within hours. I always got follow up emails signed with a persons name (no form emails) and in the end they took care of the issue for me. I'm really impressed with that level of personalized service in this age. It's made me a believer in the brand as well as this specific product.

title: Mind of its own.
text:
*Update* *Beware*

First off, as soon as you open the app, there's an offer for a free battery in return for a positive review. That's why there's so many 5 Star reviews! (I did it too)
NOW, for my REAL review....
I did all the usual stuff; watched some YouTube, read the manual, got the app, did the calibration, then put it in the middle of a playfield, and hit the 'GO' button. It went up about 6 feet, then promptly went vertical and flew into a bush 50 feet away. Shut it down, swapped batteries and did the calibration again. It flew fine after that.
Next flight, days later.... It got off the ground and to altitude fine, but a few minutes in, it started doing "Figure 8's" with no controller input. Figured I must've done something wrong, like turned orbit mode on or something, so shut my phone and the controller both off hoping it would find its way back. It eventually did, after a few more minutes of screwing around up there....
Third- fourth- fifth- flights, it was fine. But number six, it went up, started drifting twords the edge of the park on its own, didn't respond to inputs, and then gone. Zoomed away, went inverted, face planted into a pond, and that's all she wrote.

title: Batteries are junk
text: Wife bought it for me for my bday. I charged the batteries to full charge. Calibrated the drone. It went up 8 to 10 feet and came back down and display said " Low battery " So I put the other fully charged battery in and it did the same thing. My bday is in late Nov. I live in the high rockies so I didn't even unbox the drone until late may. I then charged the batteries the night before I tried to operate it. We contacted Amazon and they said they couldn't do anything because it was 30 days past the purchase date. The manufacturer said the same. So almost $300 spent on a drone that might work if the company can make a battery that works. I threw it in the trash.

title: HS 720E Great Beginner Drone
text: The HS 720E is a great drone for beginners. I bought it as a fun flier that isn't geo-fencing restricted. It handles well in flight. The low and high speed settings makes it enjoyable for both beginners and advance users. The app is extremely easy to use. I even used it on an android tablet with ease (great for FPV). The 720E is easy to fly with an equally easy app. It's highly recommended to get a high speed memory card for the 4K videos. I gave it 4 stars, because of the lack of rechargeable batteries in the remote. It would have been a nice option if included.

title: Unreliable

title: Very nice drone for $300 range!
text: Taking this drone out of the box was a pleasure all the way through first flight. It has some weight to it, which is good for stabilization. Its powerful and quiet. Camera transmission leaves just a little more to be desired. Feed begins dropping frames with a few obstructions between you and the drone. Signal between the drone and the controller have never had any loss of signal within expected range. Customer service was the absolute best  when helping me with an odd unfortunate event. The drone took a sudden and deliberate nosedive full throttle into the ground from around 150 feet and destroyed itself. In less than 24 hours enough communication with their customer service was made and the decision to replace my damaged drone had one being shipped before the end of the day. After 2 business days I was back at it. This time with the added benefit of having extra batteries in the end.

title: Rec. to a friend and fellow beginners
text: Great product for the money. Great setup with carrying case.  Mine drifts towards the back and doesn’t hover in place makes it slightly hard Still being a beginner and trying to get used to controlling drone with close flights before venturing off too much.  Went out of control a few times on me and the emergency power down on the remote would not stop the propellers even after the crash landing each time... had to yank battery. From all the reviews and videos watched on product seems here and there people have same issues with theirs. Could be where I live with mountains around. Went out of range for video feed and the return home features brought the drone back and it almost landed perfectly back on take off pad as seen in photos but as the propellers slowed to touch down the wind was enough to make it miss the mat. Over all satisfied. Photo at 300 feet is right off the app so quality is no where as good as when you take it off the sd. Using to photo cars as well so the feature that goes around a set point is nice and you can get a good angle that you can’t do by hand. Image is very stable when videotaping. The heads up feature is nice to be able to turn on/off when you fly the drone in site and not with looking at video feed in the screen, especially as a beginner getting use to flying a drone for its easy to loose track of the nose.

Would be helpful to have some tutorials on UTube (and/or a flight simulator that we could play along with), prior to trying the "real thing). I very much do enjoy this great drone. Perfect, but a bit intimidating at first if you've never flown one.

title: Great drone! Amazing quality! Great photo/video !!
text:
So much fun! I had this flying in my backyard as soon as I charged the batteries up. Really simple process to learn, and their support team is phenomenal if you have questions.

It handles really well, I suggest operating in the lower speed mode at first to learn how to handle it smoothly. Take it out to a park with tons of open space and just get used to the sensitivity of the controller. My 4 year old loves it.

Once you have handling down you can shoot. The camera is really good for the price that you are paying. The video is crisp and when I had it up hovering at about 100 feet shooting video there was no vibration at all.

Highly recommend this drone.

title: Great value and ease of use, awesome camera
text: This is my first drone and was a pleasure to learn to fly. The ease of setup and controls made this so fun to fly. I recently took it on a trip. To Minnesota and couldn’t wait to fly it, the winds were light and the temp was about 27 degrees and the drone performed just as expected. I was able to use the take off feature, the return to home , the circle and follow feature. I was able to use the stabilized camera to take video and still photos with ease using the app. I would recommend this drone. To any beginner that is trying to learn to fly.

text: Quality in each aspect of the products and case are impressive.  Like all other good technology-based things, it will take time to thoroughly understand everything but it sure seems easier than I thought.

title: I'm glad I made the purchase
text:
Ok, so at first I was having the same issues as some other users of the HS720e. I couldn't connect to the wifi of the drone, no GPS satellite linkage, Opheila Go was a no go and the drone wouldn't fly unless I had turned off the GPS on the control. HOWEVER, after doing some obvious things on my end. The drone works perfect and I am glad I bought through Holy Stone. So to fix the problem of the Ophelia Go app not connecting I had to turn off my cell phone's VPN. I have Google Fi and their phones automatically connect to a google vpn. One problem solved. I also had to have my phone "forget" the usual wifi i connect to because my phone would keep disconnecting from the drone wifi because there was not internet from it. Now I can connect easily. Second problem solved. I live in an area where there is a lot of airplane and helicopter traffic, so not sure if that had anything to do with the drone not connecting to the GPS satellites, but I went to the next park over (5 or so miles) just to be safe and found an open area and voila, GPS a go. Third problem solved.

I'm still trying out the 4k quality and camera use so I'll save that for another time.

text:
