title: Easy to fly
text: This drone is very easy to fly and learn on. The Ophelia app makes this drone a dream to fly. I fly it everyday and it just gets better and better. Would definately recommend for beginner and advanced pilots.

title: Great Drone for everyone, easy to use.  Great pictures!
text:
This was my first drone. Absolutely loved it!
I'm a avid photographer, been walking around with my DSLR and iPhone for many years. The only thing I was missing are the aerial shots and believe it or not - pictures on myself :-) I got the HS H720E after extensive research for ease of use, capabilities and price. after all I don't want to crash and burn something more expensive and what happens if I don't like flying drones.

The HS720E was a great buy! It matched all of my criteria's after I finally learned how to properly fly and use the feature from the app. there was a slight learning curve for a total beginner. But with the combination of the instructions manual (yes- I actually read the instructions) and online tutorials on YouTube, you'll be flying pretty quickly. One note, you need to use a phone with a cellular, GPS and WIFI turned on to use the features (Follow me, set waypoints, etc.) on the app. The detailed map will not show unless your phone have an active cellular plan. How did I know this? I tried flying using the app with a old cell phone (no cell or data plan), the detail map does not show and the (follow me and set waypoints) features will not work.

With that said, the HS720E and all the features worked well! It was a great drone for the price. Love the 'fly home' and 'low battery' features so you can get the drone to come back and land 'close' to where you took off.

Where they can make some improvements? Need a better phone holder - my iPhone 11 occasionally popped off.
Also need a cover for the SD card so you don't accidentally push on the card and it pops out. I put a piece of tape there to prevent this from happening.

Overall, this was a great buy! Will absolutely recommend this to a new drone pilot.

title: Excellent customer service
text:
It flu away and never returned. Second one of this, first one was perfect.

Update
Customer Service looks 5 stars right now.
They answer very quickly and will send me a replacement.
Will update review after receiving the drone get it calibrated and some air time.
Thanks again.

Update
Got the new unit, set it up and works like a charm!
Love this drone. Quality, technology and great great great customer service.
Go for it!!!

title: Great Quality Drone
text: Recently I purchased this drone after using the 4 HS-160 Pro drones I’ve had. The HS160 Pro drones were a great drone to learn flying on so I could move up to this drone. This drone is faster but just as easy to fly as the HS-160 Pro and flying time is much longer so I have more fun. It is very easy to get it set up and fly and the ability move the camera up and down is a big plus for taking pictures and videos. It moves smoothly so there’s no jerky video. It is a strong flying drone which makes possible to fly in windy weather and still get fast response and smooth hovering. I had an issue when I first bought it and contacted support. A day later I had the information I needed, my mistake for not reading the manual completely. They are a real pleasure to work with and they answered all my questions in a well informed and very professional way. I have many Holystone products and the quality of each is great. I have grandkids who I fly with, the youngest is 7 and the oldest is 12 and each one was flying within 5 minutes of learning the controls. Within a hour they were out flying me which made them very happy and they rubbed it in my face when we got home and told they parents! I would unhesitatingly recommend these drones for beginners and above.

title: Fun Drone But Failed After 5 Hours of Fly Time
text: This drone was fun to fly. It has a Tripod mode which offers a fairly stable platform in mild wind conditions. When selected into Fast mode, the drone will take off, fly forward, to what I was able to speed test to 10MPH. The Drone did start to get shaky in video quality at 10 feet and 30 meters in the air. It's a decent drone to learn how to fly. Now for the horror story. I was waiting for an amazon prime delivery, and I thought it would be fun to send the drone up and watch the van as I tracked it with my laptop. As you may know, some Prime vans offer GPS locations of their trucks. I sent it up to 30 meters (like I have done several times) and after about 5 seconds of reaching the desired altitude I lost connection for roughly 2-3 seconds. I regained video connection only to watch the drone in a diagonal nose dive straight into my neighbors roof. The impact was so loud I was sure the drone was destroyed. My neighbor heard the impact, came out and recovered the drone from his roof. Luckily there was no damage to his property, which was my biggest concern. None the less, I will not be buying another drone from this company. It was supposed to maintain altitude and return to its take-off location, NOT turn into a Japanese Zero from WWII. $400 dollars down the drain.

title: Performed as advertised!
text: This drone has some higher price point features for a low great price.  It is proving to be the best drone in its class.  The 4k camera is awesome and my initial video and still images at 30 fps and 60 fps are beautiful!  The battery even outlasted the advertised flight time by about 3 minutes!

title: - Incredible Drone - Amazing Customer Service
text: - While this is my first drone, I've flown several others owned by friends. By far, the Holy Stone 720E is the most stable to fly. Its features and incredible camera make it comparable to drones with much higher price tags. It is a joy to fly from the first takeoff and even more so with each subsequent flight. The return to landing feature is especially nice for beginning drone fliers. A great drone at a terrific price point. -- Early on, I had some questions regarding the set-up. Called Holy Stone customer service and got a real person almost immediately. The customer service representative was perfectly knowledgeable....I didn't feel like they were reading off a script...they knew what to do personally. She actually stayed on the phone with me until I accomplished her instructions to ensure they worked perfectly. You don't get that kind of customer service often. A couple of weeks later, I had another problem and again, they handled it perfectly and 100% to my amazed satisfaction. --- So, with the Holy Stone HS720E, you'll get a fantastic drone and outstanding customer service!

title: Not worth it. Buy DJI.
text: I really wanted to like this drone but between the setup taking hours and then the remote control not working correctly, I'm just gonna purchase the DJI drones. They're dependable and worth it.

title: Great little drone
text: Very easy to setup and fly. Video quality is very acceptable.

title: good
text: I like it but I did not get my delivery on time it want missing after all but I like the Drone it to good to begin with 46mins Flight Time love the it look in video

title: Great First Drone
text: [[VIDEOID:b0d22e35f50dfbee07e940ea351db5f8]] Great first drone. Super easy to fly, even my 10 year old son figured out a few features before I did! Flys well in heavy wind and a little rain, I wouldn’t recommend doing that but we really wanted to test it.

title: Glitches and went full speed into a vehicle

title: Great drone with lots of features, easy to fly!
text: This is a great product for the price. I’ve used other drones in the past and in the price range this drone offers great construction quality, an excellent camera. The drone is very easy to you learn to use and offers some great features such as orbit mode and in the return to home feature. Very impressed with this product

title: SHEENA - Heavenly customer service ( 5 stars for her )
text:
And it came to pass that my HolyStone 720e drone Christmas present remained within its’ case due to abominable weather conditions here in the North East of America.
Eventually, the weather broke twice in the next few months, allowing me to try out my drone.
Unfortunately, this particular drone appeared to be somewhat unresponsive.
Later as the weather became better, I was able to take my drone for what I considered to be its’ ‘maiden voyage’.

The wide open spaces of Vermont directly in front of the home we rented for the weekend provided what I thought was the perfect flying arena.
No trees, no wires, no buildings to interfere with my flight plan. Just a clear slightly sloping area as far as the eye could see.
During the time between receiving my gift and taking it for its’ maiden voyage, I had read the manual front to back many, many times.
YouTube provided lots more specific information for this HolyStone720e.

Despite calibrating, receiving the recommended GPS signals and showing the correct combination of lights on the arms, my drone failed to elevate.
Then, finally without much warning, the drone was aloft but ‘magnetically attracted’ to the only house for miles, ( ours ), crashing and mangling one of its’ rear arms!

My drone was out of warranty but I was encouraged to contact HolyStone anyway.
So many Christmas gifts end up being out of warranty when they’re eventually opened and used.

I garnered and amassed as much ‘Karma’ as I thought I had offered during my lifetime.
Here goes…
My first call was answered quickly and I spent much time explaining my situation to the lady on the other end.

Just then my ear accidentally touched an icon on my cell phone and just like that my ‘lifeline’ was lost! My phone dropped signal almost as fast as my confidence and enthusiasm.
I almost broke a bone in my arm attempting to grab the phone, hoping that somehow my contact would still be there.
But no!

I called again and this time I spoke to a gentleman to whom some of my details were readily available, since he was able to recognize my phone number.
Nevertheless, I had to repeat my whole story once again!
Then, horror of horrors, my cellphone ran out of juice. It was quite apparent that the ‘Drone Gods’ had abandoned me and I was no longer in their favor.
My store of ‘Karma’ was running out quite speedily.

A hunt around my home produced the old landline. This will not go well.
The number will not be recognized by the next HolyStone contact!
And so it was that I dialed the now familiar HS number once again. The young lady who answered listened quite diligently as my story was repeated for the third time. I must say that my enthusiasm had now dwindled a lot.

I was informed that a new arm could be purchased quite easily. But then she confided that because of my inconvenience she would see if she could send one free of charge!
Further dialogue ensued as the ‘Drone Gods’ started to re-evaluate my situation and through this latest HolyStone representative, ensured that my happiness would be intact.

Yes, indeed!
I had managed to come in contact with one of the rarest of customer liaisons!
An ‘Angel’ in the employ of not only HolyStone but also the ‘Drone Gods’!
Her name was, and still is, ‘SHEENA’.
Sheena - the angel who flies higher than any drone!

After we had spoken, she confided that someone owed her a personal favor and although it was remote, it was also quite possible that this could in some way be ‘parlayed’ into the epitome of customer service - a new HolyStone 720e drone!

Sure enough, within a few days it appeared at my door!
My main question is…”Why can’t other companies employ representatives like Sheena?”
Companies need people like her who will LISTEN to customers, EMPATHIZE with customers and show that the company CARES!
To me SHEENA is the ultimate HolyStone Angel.

title: False advertising for follow me to iPhone users
text: So I bought this drone specifically for the follow me function... well it’s non existent... doesn’t work for iPhone... apparently they know this but it works with Android apparently. Other then that it works like a cheap drone should

title: Became uncomfortable
text: I loved this drone for 9 months of owning it. I took amazing videos with it and it was easy to fly and I felt secure in knowing that I can control this drone sufficiently, and it never crashed or hit anything. Then today I took it out to for a flight and after 5 minutes, it started going sideways very fast and was completely uncontrollable. The recording was on, but it went far and crash landed on top of an industrial building where it could not be retrieved. I don't understand why this happened, perhaps a propeller malfunction, but it is certainly disappointing.

title: Great value
text: Fast shipping, quick to set up and fly, easy to control.  Images look great .  Great value at this price point

title: Great product for the price
text: This a great drone for all users new or advanced. The first thing you will notice is the quality of the case that comes with the drone. It is semi rigid and has plenty of room for the drone, extra batteries and spare parts. Once opened you are introduced a zippered netted pouch in the lid that houses a great user manual. You will remove a small piece of foam covering the drone and controller. The drone build feels of quality, unlike some of the other slightly cheaper drones that I own. The controller is very comfortable and easy to use. This kit came with an extra battery for even longer flight time (just wish it charged faster, lol). You will also be greeted with extra props and the charger. The drone flies absolutely wonderful. It has the feel of a more expensive drone that we all know. The camera quality is great both video and stills. I added a 128 GB micro SD for longer recordings and more pictures in a session. I have not had to deal with any support from the company yet but from people I know and what I have read, their support is great! I really like this little guy and think it is an awesome buy especially for the price. I will be doing more business with this company for sure!

title: AMAZING!
text: This is by far the best drone i have bought so far! great camera ,easy to fly and is a great Price!

title: UPDATE: Dropping from four stars to one
text:
UPDATE (3-26-2023): As much as I hate to do it, I'm updating my review with a lowered rating. I was flying it today and had it in a hover at around 70' AGL when it suddenly went into an orbiting pattern at *very* high speed (I had it on the lower photography speed setting). It wouldn't respond to any inputs from the controller, including the RTH function. It transitioned to a descending turn, and crashed in my neighbor's yard, breaking an arm. Fine, I thought, I'd seen that you could order replacement arms here on Amazon, but they're now listed as "currently unavailable" with no estimated availability date. Same on another site I searched, which leads me to believe I've got a $300 paperweight in my garage. I guess there's a reason these are priced as they are. Original review follows below.

I've always thought drones were pretty cool and I thought it'd be fun to shoot some aerial stills and video. But when I first started looking at them the entry level models ran at least $500-$600, and that just seemed a lot to put at risk on something I was very likely to crash while I learned how to use it. So when I saw the Holy Stone HS720e at under $300, I took a closer look at the specs, read a few reviews here on Amazon and elsewhere, and decided I couldn't pass it up. And, so far at least, I'm VERY glad I bought one.

Let me get the negatives out of the way right up front. While the drone itself feels very well put together, the controller has a somewhat cheap feel to it. The part of the controller that holds the cell phone feels a bit like it's going to break every time I extend it. On top of that, it's barely large enough to hold my phone (Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra), and even then only after I remove the phone's protective case. I fly my drone in constant fear that my rather expensive phone will fall out and splatter itself all over the ground. So that's out of the way, let's get to the good stuff.

As I said, the drone itself feels very sturdy, and has already survived one minor mishap in which I managed to get it stuck in a tree and had to knock it out with a pole saw. It fell about 25 feet to the ground and I went right back to flying it. Flying is easy - it takes only a few minutes of familiarizing oneself with the instructions and the controls to get flying right away. If you get disoriented and lose track of where the drone is facing, just take your hands off the control sticks and it'll hover in position until you can re-orient yourself. Position holding is rock solid, which I tested by having it hover about five feet off the ground and then carefully moving it a few feet away by hand. The drone went right back to where it was hovering. The other features - return to home, follow me, and point of interest circling - all work as advertised and are features I'd have expected to find in much more expensive drones.

I'll close here with just a couple of notes. Not negatives, just words of caution. First, this drone does NOT have obstacle avoidance, as evidenced by my unfortunate early encounter with a tree. I'll make sure my next drone does have that. Second, the drone's color is a slate gray, which on a few occasions has caused me to lose sight of it against a background of similar color, like early spring woods with no foliage. What I did each time was stop and let the drone hover, then execute a few vertical movements until I spotted it again. Maybe my next drone will be white. Or bright pink or something.

Anyway, I highly recommend the HS720e. At its price, it over-delivers on expectations, and the only reason I'm giving four stars and not five is because of the controller.

title: Nice drone easy to use
text: Won’t go to far

title: Incredible and easy to use drone!
text:
[[VIDEOID:903be5626663807086135c3acca00711]] I’m so happy with this drone. It’s incredibly easy to fly and very intuitive. The controller shows the GPS level (which is super helpful after losing a previous drone) and the distance/height which makes it easy to bring down and land near you.

It’s super easy to fly and the GPS mode is very good. If it gets out of range, you’ll likely lose the WiFi feed to your phone but the controller continues to work. If it gets out of the controller range, the controller will beep and the drone will retreat to get back in range to ensure you don’t lose the drone. The return to home can be a LIFE SAVER and makes landing very, very easy. The drone comes in beginner mode, but you can easily change this once comfortable and the distance range is quite impressive. It’s also nice to see the location on the map.

The drone records amazing 4K photos and videos and the image stabilization is a really great addition. Another nice feature is that you can’t see the propellers in the camera, like you can on other drones. This really allows for quality images.

Can’t recommend this drone enough! Easily 5 stars. You won’t regret this purchase.

title: The holystone Hs720e is a great beginner drone. You will not be disappointed.
text:
Watched many videos of the hs720e before buying. I have to say, I wasn't disappointed!
For me as a beginner, had no problems setting it up or flying it.

title: A lot of extra work to research how to get it started
text: No instructions. You will need to watch a bunch of YouTube videos to figure it out. Also the pairing thing takes forever due to multiple tries. Not easy to get it started and flying but once you do it is great. Records video and pics on my phone. Still not sure why I need to go spend money on an SD card. No instructions of course….

title: Very easy for a beginner
text: It takes great pictures and videos. You have to make sure you study up on how to calibrate the drone but once you do it works great.

title: Good beginner drone but hard to find right app
text: The drone works fine but we had to try several different apps before the drone would pair - instructions not very good. The HS720 required the Ophelia GO app, which we only determined through a few YouTube video reviews, Googling, and trial and error. Otherwise great first drone. Landing accuracy +\- 2 meters so don’t expect it to land exactly where it took off.

title: Great purchase! Easy to fly and really well made
text: Amazing!! Received as a gift for my birthday. I’m about 6 flights in already. Read up on the manual before flight and it was a breeze getting it going. Did really well in these west Texas winds as well. Came with extra blades which thankfully I have not needed. Battery life for me was around 20 minute flight, but it was fighting winds the whole time which I believe caused a bit more battery drain. Overall I am super happy and excited with this drone!

title: My toy grade drone gets better range than this thing.
text: Only reason why I give it 2 stars is because the range is ridiculous I can't get 100 meters without losing signal

title: Easy to use, easy to fly, great video
text:
Great beginner drone. This is my first drone. After charging, I had the drone in the air, and taking great videos. The waypoint mode, follow me, and orbit modes in the Ophelia Go app worked perfectly on my Note9, and my Samsung A01. Both phones fit on the controller, but the Note9 needs to be removed from the case.

The one button take off, and the return to home also worked great.

The drone is very intuitive, and easy to learn.

title: Don't rush into flight
text:
This is my first drone as I'm new to the drone world. Based on the suggestion of a friend, I ended up looking into and going with the Holy Stone HS720e. The price point on this drone was manageable and didn't hurt the wallet.

After a fast one-day delivery and a little dabbling, I'm impressed and glad that I went with the Holy Stone family.

As I get some more flight time under my belt, I'll be coming back to update this review. For now, though, a few key take-aways.

The pros:

- This is a solid drone. My first flight ended in crashing into a tree and an inverted landing. This was solely based on picking the wrong day for my first flight (wind picked up as fast as initial takeoff). I was impressed with the fact that as soon as the drone made contact with the very forgiving tree, the motors instantly shut off before it dropped into the snow. The soft impact with the tree and equally soft inverted landing resulted in no damage to the drone.

The cons:

- I was a little disappointed on a phone/drone/transmitter connection issue. My current daily phone is a Google Pixel 5 running Android 11. Ophelia Go app installation was a snap. Connecting via wifi however was where things changed. I have yet to determine why the phone would not stay connected via wifi or sometimes even not connect at all. When I was able to connect, the camera wouldn't load in the app. Fortunately, I had access to a couple older phones and once they were connected (for testing purposes), the camera imagery showed instantly. This was after I learned that for whatever reason, not all android phones are the same when it comes to connecting to wifi devices. In finding this information, I learned from other HS720e owners that iPhones seemed to present fewer connection issues than Android phones. It seems that it's "hit or miss" with Android phones.

***For any future buyers reading this review, be sure you have an extra (and older phone) handy in case you run into the same problem I did. ***

- One other issue I have with the app is what I see on screen once my phone is connected to the drone. Across the top, there are Chinese characters and numbers showing (picture to be updated later). The best that I can determine, this is video quality info. It would be nice to be able to change a setting that removes that info as it overlays on other information. As I wasn't able to see the information underneath, I can't determine if the underlying information was pertinent. (look for additional input on that in my update)

title: Great drone for the price
text: This is a good drone for the price.  Still working on the camera settings but no issues so far.  Only know toy levels but controls are responsive.

title: Updated review.  Drone pairing but not responding to transmitter.
text: On 1st use it seemed to require complicated set up and initialization.  But after a few times it is getting easier.  The drone doesn't seem to be extremely responsive to the joystick controls.  Takes a while after joysticks are moved for the drone to respond.  Also, as the drone battery gets low, I had an incredibly difficult time to get the drone to respond to the joysticks.  With the left joystick (throttle) held all the way down, the motor kept increasing in RPM and the drone continued to gain altitude.  Only when the battery indicator changed to one mark and the controller began to beep did the drone lower itself in altitude on its own.  But it did not return to home.  The battery technology doesn't seem to meet the needs of this drone.  Really short flight times.  Not quite what is advertised.  And an incredibly long recharge time.  Takes all the fun out.  The drone seems to be affected very easily by extremely light winds.  Update 2/4/21:  Drone no longer controllable with transmitter.  Can pair drone with transmitter, and WiFi with cellphone.  Go through set up operation without any problems, turned off "beginner" mode and set safety distance and height to max.  Drone takes off and once it is 10 feet in the air it will no longer respond to joy stick controls; rotate left or right, forward, or backward.  It flies around on its own, flying in circles, moving left and right, up and down, lowering to the ground and bouncing several times.  It will not shut off, even holding the shut off button more than 5 seconds.  Pressing and holding the power button will not shut the motors off.  I have to carefully grab it and remove the battery to stop it from spinning the motors.  Once it took off, and on its own sped extremely fast in a 90 degree left flight, and flew into the limbs of a tree.  The return time has expired.  I called Holy Stone and they want me to just send them video of the erratic behavior.  But my phone is connected to the transmitter and I have no other video device.  Just too bad.  Holy Stone doesn't seem to want to take this unit back for replacement.  I thought they were better than that.

title: Solid Customer Support
text:
Was having a bug where I was losing partial control once the drone flew 30-feet or so away. During one of these it drifted uncontrollably into a tree branch and left a tiny mark on the body of the drone. At that point I reached out to Holy Stone support to figure out what was going wrong with it. Lily with their customer support promptly responded and went through some Q&A and troubleshooting with me over a few emails and shared some video of the issue. Nothing was working. So They offered up a full replacement and to keep the faulty drone for spare parts. Wow! Now that’s customer service! Seriously impressed.

The only tiny issue I have is with the remote. The antenna snap in the closed position and took me a few to find in the manual how to release them. It should be more up front in the manual. Then the iPhone holder that slides out tilts up/forward when the phone is locked in. The weight of my iPhone is heavy enough that it won’t stay tilted forward sometimes. Both very minor issues.

Let’s see how the replacement works but figure with support like this I’m sure I’ll be flying again soon!

title: Won't connect to many Adroid phones
text: This drone will not connect to Wifi on many Android phones regardless of software versions, new or old.

title: Good in begining fell short
text:
Im RE Broker and like this drone. I had a small glitch but Holy Stone support helped and resolved the issue.
Thank you Summer especially.

title: Great drone for beginners
text: Bought this for my husband. He loves it, great picture quality, easy to fly, battery life is good. We are very happy with the drone!

title: Make sure your phone supports 802.11 AC
text:
The product description nowhere states that you need AC, just that the drone is optimized for it. If you don't have a phone with AC support, your phone won't even see the drone. Seller needs to update the product decription.

Otherwise, it seems like a good product, but I need to decide if I need to get a new phone to run the thing.

Update: Holy Stone customer support has been nothing short of fantastic. They answer their phones and are actually helpful. You can get an affordable phone to run the product and once you have that, it's a truly fun and useful little drone. Worked very well for my informal surveying project first try. Easy to learn and use. Powerful camera. Great stability. More than decent battery life. And, again, motivated, friendly, and knowledgeable customer support. Good on Holy Stone! Upgraded from 2 to 5 stars. Buy with confidence.

title: Best drone at this price level!
text: Great starter drone. Accurate GPS and button placement on control works great. Fits my iphone 12 pro max. Very user friendly and my son was able to fly it by himself within a few minutes. Camera is great for this price level.

title: Best drone at this price level!
text: Great starter drone. Accurate GPS and button placement on control works great. Fits my iphone 12 pro max. Very user friendly and my son was able to fly it by himself within a few minutes. Camera is great for this price level.

title: Novelty "Pro" Drone.
text:
This was recommended as a low-cost entry pro model for images and video. I wanted to see what a $300 drone had to offer these days, particularly after hearing about all these rave reviews on the utubes and amazon reseller review pages. The unit seems put together well enough, but when you understand the difference between this drone .vs a drone made by a more established drone technology manufacture with actual innovative pro-level features, the novelty wears off real quick and you are left wanting more. The HS720 does a good job of mimicking what other low-tier pro-sumer drones are doing on a budget, but it performs slightly better than a $100 basic entry fpv model. I have seen Holy Stone and others toss the tag "Professional images and video" around this drone and it is, very far from being that level of drone. Boasting a few numbers for marketing sake and a 4k sensor does not = to a Pro user experience.

I was so disappointed with overall build quality (particularly the camera motor gearing -Ew!). The app Ophelia Go is a very basic app for your FPV control /review and it works just fine, but no wows to be found here. The 4k video is okay as long as you don't move the camera axis, otherwise the aspect ratio fish-eyes and distorts the image rendering your video-capture work useless unless you fix it via software. (this issue has long been vacant on other models and this is not a good look anywhere). 2 flight speeds + all these "tracking/follow" features, you do the math. For the love of drones, get something that can adjust/vary speed.

Look, let's be real here. Digital Image Stabilization (which = to area loss and sometimes loss of quality to stabilize the image) is no match for a 3 point gimbal and a 300-400 range drone is not going to perform as well as 600-1500 drones. There is a 500 range hump that you need to cross. This $300 drone reminded me/convinced me to spend another 800.00 to get a more realistically functional one that will be used for commercial use.

I cannot say I can recommend the HS720 for any reason, not at 300 dollars, no way. This unit feels like it is loaded with low-grade consumable tech and should be priced 150-180 range.
If you are looking for a FPV drone with some basic automated flight settings go the $100 route, otherwise research the heck out the model/s you think fits your needs and then dig deep into your pockets.

*Update after a couple months 4 new drones of various types, sizes and manufactures. The HS720 by far was the most dangerous, unstable and worst drone experience to date.

I would hope to see this unit pulled for safety reasons.

title: Great starter drone!
text: This is my first drone, super easy to get started and very easy to learn how to fly! Definitely recommended!

title: Excellent Drone for the Price
text: Excellent Produce for the price! The Drone is well build, quiet, and the picture quality is great. The carrying case is durable, and it is a nice feature.

title: Excellent Drone for the Price
text: Excellent Produce for the price! The Drone is well build, quiet, and the picture quality is great. The carrying case is durable, and it is a nice feature.

title: The best new drone of 2020 - incredible camera!
text: [[VIDEOID:269d603849a5a186ca0f9fb6e6a4ce6b]] This is the crown jewel of the Holy Stone fleet of drones. The upgraded EIS (electronic stabilization) system is incredible. The video is smooth and fluid and even looks that way in FPV. I flew it 2-300M and had beautiful streaming footage at maybe 50M in altitude. It goes much further too, control available to 3000ft. The video and photo below are compressed and were pulled from my phone not the micro SD card which has even better resolution photo and video. It is stunning! I flew my first flight today and was up in the air for 25 minutes before I landed out of caution. There was battery left. I did lose sight behind some trees but hit return to home and it immediately came flying back. The extra battery and carrying case make it that much better of a deal. I’ve flow similarly priced drones and this is by far the most stable drone and video I’ve seen. Optical flow sensors add further stability and the camera can be moved 90 degrees while flying. By far the best drone I own and well worth the money!

title: Good for beginner.
text: I had never had a drone before.  The Holy Stone 720e was easy to set up and use.  Worth every penny.  The extra battery that came with it was a real plus.

title: Lots of fun
text: This is my first drone, definitely manageable for beginners.. i definitely recommend

title: Best buy for a Drone
text: You cant beat this this drone.. It is awesome

title: The higher you fly the easier it is
text: Jus very happy with my purchase

title: Great drone for the price
text: Easy to set up, flies well and the bonus battery is a plus!

title: Unbelievable videos and loads of fun!
text: The Holy Stone 720e drone takes unbelievable video (4k)/pictures , it was easy to learn, and is full of fantastic features!

title: Buyer Beware
text:
This drone is known for going rouge. It’s a great practice drone for new hobbyists but I’ve been through 2 of them and ended up buying a better brand. It needs a perfectly clear field to fly or you run the risk of it taking off on its own and hitting something. We live on 12 acres and my drone was flying fine and decided to start spiraling and then went straight into a tree. If you buy it, you’ll be upgrading shortly after.

What I will add is the customer service is stellar, if this does happen they replace the entire drone without any hesitation.

title: Easy to use.
text: My second drone.  Great features, easy take off, and easy to return home. Great video.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS DRONE
text:
When we bought this drone I was so excited to use it. The reviews seemed great. We bought it to document our new construction home. I've flown it 5 times and it worked great to begin with then It began to have navigation issues and would not follow remote commands. It takes off on its own and I have no control over what it does. After looking into the issue, I've found that multiple people have had the same issues.

Very disappointed.

title: Great quality
text: [[VIDEOID:5f8ce3963ce75856095d4a8136193da6]] This drone is probably the best one so far I have purchased. The glide, and the contrail is very compatible to the operator.  I have to admit even when I ran into tree branches this drone did not give it. It overpowered and keep on flying. When other would have not been so tough !!! 10-stars for this one.

title: Absolutely amazing
text:
This is my first time buying and flying a drone and the experience has been pretty fulfilling. When I first got the delivery of the drone in the Amazon box I immediately thought that the actual drone must have been smaller than I anticipated looking at the size of the box. But to my surprise when I open the drone box and the carrying case the wings/legs were foldable.(I love that feature). Being that it was my first drone I was a bit apprehensive about how the setup experience and how my maiden flight would be. But the instructions were pretty straightforward. I downloaded the app and everything was set for my maiden flight.

I must say that operating this drone was a lot easier than I expected. The ophelia Go app has a preset restricted mode for beginners which allowed me to get a good feel of operating the drone correctly. The remote control was easy to learn and gave signal to the drone as i intended. For a beginner I was very satisfied with the flying experience that I had on my first flight. The flight was steady and the powerful 3d camera captured the video very wonderfully. I definitely would recommend this product to anyone looking to buy a drone.

There was a problem with my drone because the camera would not move down. It was always horizontal. I called Amazon support but they were not able to help (probably because I had a bad unit) but they gave me the manufacture Info. I contact them and they where able to provide a replacement in just a few days. The new unit I receive work perfectly, I just need to practice more to be able to get better videos. The 4K quality of the videos is great. Very happy with purchase. Price was great too.

title: Crash and burn **updated**
text:
I ordered this on August 25th and when it arrived, it looked great.
I read all the instructions, charged up both batteries, set up the remote, and took my new drone for a short trial run around my house.
At first, it worked great; I took it for a spin down the street and brought it back.
I had it in sight within 20 meters according to the remote when it just went bonkers, spinning in circles on its own, then it went around my house and disappeared.
I tried to follow it but there are a fair number of trees in the area and I couldn't see where it went. I asked neighbors on the street if they say anything and someone mentioned hearing it zoom off in the direction of nearby woods and a crashing sound.
The trees are dense with foliage right now with tons of underbrush and hanging vines. I was never able to find it.

It's shocking to spend over $350 on something that would fail so spectacularly on its first small run.
I had read some mixed reviews of this drone and thought that maybe this one would work out, so I decided to take a risk on it. Now I can't even find it after it just took off on its own.
It seems clear to me that there is some kind of bug in the firmware that runs this drone and they pushed it out without properly testing it and fixing the issues that would cause this.

Right now, all I know is that I want my money back!

**UPDATE**
After my review, the company reached out to me directly and offered a free replacement.
I'm upgrading my review based on the quick response and offer to replace.

title: Holy Stone's Best Yet
text:
[[VIDEOID:ba23a56a9455a29aa5b0c400bb8b1694]] This has been the best-performing drone from Holy Stone that I've had a chance to play with so far. Mind you, we are still in the Sub-$400 price point, so this is no DJI Mavic, but for the money this has some excellent qualities.

Opening the box, you have everything packed compactly into a carrying case, which is great for travel. The drone feels well-built and not cheap plastic. The drone arms unfold and snap into place very easily, as long as you unfold the front arms first. There is a microSD slot for a memory card (up to 128GB). The battery packs slide and snap firmly. The charging apparatus (see photo) is a bit odd. It does sport a high-amp USB C cord, and has a fold-out clip for two batteries, however it will only charge one at a time. A fast-blink Indicator light tell you which one is charging. Meanwhile, the controller takes 2 AA batteries.

Pairing is about the same as other Holy Stone drones, requiring gyroscope calibration and GPS lock-in, but the lights are easier to see. On the back of the drone are 4 LED lights to visually show battery level (also shown on the controller screen or the Ophelia GO app. Take-off and landing is pretty simple with one-touch buttons for both. This drone only goes to about 50ft for its return to home function, unlike others that shot way up to 100 ft.

The marquee feature of this drone is enhanced image stabilization. Mind you, this is no replacement for a gimbal, but initial tests show that it does smooth out some of the jitter and jerking when you are moving the drone. See the attached unretouched video for an example. I moved the drone side-to-side and the picture will shift a bit to adjust, but you don't see the smaller wiggles usually common with these gimbal-less drones. In the video, you see the drone descending as it maintains GPS position, you see a nice and smooth descent. Also, shooting direct into the sunset, you can see some pretty decent dynamic range with the view, and the 4K video quality is a great improvement too.

The Ophelia GO software seemed to work OK on my 8" Samsung tablet (better viewing than on my tiny phone), but the software does have some glitches. Every now and then the first-person view freezes and it will say "disconnected", even though I can still see flight status and control movement from the app. Lesson here is to use the controller for movement, use the app for picture taking.

I didn't try the follow-me or orbiting mode, but I imagine they work pretty much the same as previous drones, with the added bonus of image stabilization.

This is going to be my go-to drone for the time being!

title: Budget friendly drone that performs very well
text:
I bought this drone to capture some footage of our overlanding adventures. It was very easy to learn how to use and there are some great YouTube videos that show the ins and outs. The manual is useful and easy to read and follow. The batteries last about 20 minutes each and it comes with two. The drone flys pretty stable, unless it's windy. It takes good video with the correct settings. The companion app is pretty easy to use and has quite a few features that work okay. Calibration is simple. The return to home function and one touch take off and land is great.
The controller works well. The only thing that needs improvement is the cameras's up and down controller. It's hard to move it at a steady and slow speed. However, I would still recommend this drone.

title: Easy to use, great for video. A+ Customer Service.
text: [[VIDEOID:55e9e9e00e290b32d6a2dd91bd974bcf]] This is a very robust drone, easy to set up and fly after watching a couple of YouTube tutorials. It shoots 4k video and does a great job at it but for me where it falls down is the still camera. Still images are fine for social media or other low res applications but not for any sort of commercial or print work where they'll come under scrutiny. I've attached a little video footage and a still to illustrate. For the price point, if you're looking to shoot only video it's a great little drone. Where Holy Stone really shines is customer service though. I bought mine for a trip to East Africa, I had shot more or less all I needed to when it got a little squirly and ended up crashing into the beach, snapping off an arm. I wrote to Holy Stone and sent them the video from the flight and 5 days later I received a brand new drone in the mail and was told I could keep the wrecked one for parts. That's a level of service rarely seen these days and I was blown away.

title: Tough Bird

Although after a few times of doing this and a few nicks in the props, it still flys like a champ.  I am still learning.  I did have some loss of video connection when getting into the higher altitudes.  That may be operator error as well.  Excellent video and stills.  Already incorporating some of them in work for the district.

title: Great Drone!!! Get one!!!

Follow the instructions and safety guides that are provided and you won't be disappointed.  Be sure to purchase a good SD card and an extra battery to really enjoy what this drone has to offer. I've compared many folding drones and this one by far has me very excited for warm weather and flying opportunities. If you're having any trouble at all, the customer service is awesome, and there is a lot of help on YouTube. I love the feeling of the drone controller and the response of the drone, I was flying fast laps in just a couple of quick flights.

title: Great features and quality the price range
text: I have only flown 4 batteries so far but have found this drone to perform exactly as advertised. It has flown perfectly and all functions worked. The return to home function is great.

title: EXCELLENT DRONE FOR THE PRICE!!!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:b4907a7a95f7c6070375b22beb6cb7c5]] Retired from the military after 24 years. Earned my degrees in Electronic Engineering, Professional Aeronautics, and a Masters in Business Administration. Starting a new career in people and real-estate photography.
The drone so far has been an excellent purchase for a newbie in flying them. In the past, I've found drone flying overly frustrating. It's the control during flight being my biggest issue. I absolutely love that this drone will hover and wait for the next command. The ones in my past only hovered going in a particular direction and ended up crashing into something constantly.
The drone seems sturdy, yet light enough for flight. I've crashed it once, but it was low and indoors. There were no visible signs of flight problems after the crash.
The best feature is the "return to home" although I think the increase in altitude once it loses radio signal should be an option to control as to how high it will go. Either put it in the app or make it a stand-alone button.
Additionally, for the next build, I would make a way to reset the "RETURN TO HOME" on the fly.
*** More about the "WHY" of this option at the bottom.***

*The clarity of the photos, as well as the video are amazing!!!!
*Loved the HI and LO speed selections!!!
The simplicity of automatic controls such as FOLLOW ME and POINT OF INTEREST was a genius move on the part of Holystone. As you can see from the video, the one-button selection allowed the drone to follow me all the way home. Additionally, I still enjoyed the ability to control the camera and I think YAW, as it followed me, my daughter, and my dog.
The "follow path" option I haven't experimented with yet, but my hope is that it's as good as everything else.

In the next build, I suggest Holystone should add sensors to allow the drown "when in low speed" to detect and avoid things such as walls or trees. Moving up, down, left, right, or just stop when it comes to a preset distance from an object.
This may be something available in this drone and I've just not run across it yet, but it's an idea for a future build.

******, REMEMBER to LAND the drone to RESET the RETURN TO HOME. If you don't you will have to do what I did when it lost contact with the controller for just a second, and FLEW BACK TO THE PARK WHICH WAS A MILE AWAY. It landed beautifully, but WOW WHAT A CHASE!!!!**********

GREAT PURCHASE.

title: Amazing drone, especially for the price
text: We have flown this over 500meters high.  It's incredibly fun and easy to fly.  Handles relatively high winds and has so many cool features like; return to home, 1-touch landing, follow-me, and the ability to draw a route on a map and then just have it follow that route.  Had built in camera and you can record video and photos while you fly to either/both your phone or an SD card.  Very cool that you have a controller with info but also can connect up a phone to see the drone's camera view in real-time.  I really can't say enough about how nice this is.  Plus the fact that it comes with 2 batteries and each lasts at least 20 minutes.

title: Certainly a good drone for beginners.
text:
This drone is a good drone for beginners as well as those who are on a budget.

Pros -
* The setup was easy (just follow a couple of youtube videos) and the instructions are straightforward.
* The app (ophelia go) also easy to use and user friendly.
* The drone has got good features like Follow me, Circle me (orbit), RTH, headless mode, tripod mode, VR mode etc.
* The price of the drone is certainly a plus.

Cons -
* I felt the drone sometimes acted wobbly in a few places with wind speed ~ 10 mph.
* The quality of the video is reasonably good (but not to the point where you can automatically expect it to be cinematographic, there is some work required there.)
* This point was not a major issue for me, however for some people the weight of the done can be a downside (because you have to register it with the FAA).

Overall, if you don't want to burn a hole in your pocket by paying for a costly drone, or if you are a beginner who wants to get started with a good drone with great features, this is a very good choice.

title: Othelia Go software would not work for me.
text:
The drone exceeded my expectations. I have 18 acres that go far past what I can see from the house. The drone went all of the way to the back of my property, well out of my view, and came right back.

I was able to take pictures and video and it was saved to the micro SD card and to the app (Ophelia Go) that you have to download. From there I could do nothing with it. From the Ophelia Go app I could watch the videos on my phone, (Motorola Edge), but could not share it to Facebook, Snapchat, Messenger, or anything else. I could not even save it to my gallery. I kept getting an error.

I called tech support and they said they would send me a software update. I never received it. I checked, and I'm not the only one. Lots of people are having the same issue. Either they can't share the pics. and video, or they do a software update and the drone no longer works properly.

I returned the drone for a refund. It should not be that hard to get it to work properly. I wanted to spend time using it, not trying to get it to work properly. The two stars is because, except for the app, the drone is awesome.

title: Easy to use for the Beginner like me!!
text:
This is the first Drone that I've ever had. It packs in a lot of features for the price!!!! This is for sure a very easy and fun drone to fly. One key take-off and land, return to home, follow me and orbit just to name a few. The 4K camera takes very good pictures and videos. The EIS (Electric Image Stabilization) makes both the pictures and video much more stable!!! The controller is so easy to use and fit in your hand very well. Did I forget to mention that this drone comes with two batteries and a case! What more can you ask for? I would for sure recommend that Holy Stone HS720E to anyone looking for a feature-packed drone at a great price.

The only problem I had was they said to install the app Ophelia GPS and I couldn't get my camera to sync to my phone...... Then I downloaded the Ophelia GO app and it worked perfectly.

Highly recommend for the the beginner!!!!

title: A great drone for beginners
text: This is my first drone after watching countless of drone videos on YouTube to get acquainted at this before flying and I must say it was difficult at first for to get around with it especially the calibration and controls but later I got the hang of it but not the experience to do the crazy cool stuff with it yet. From my experience it is a very stable and a great drone for beginners and for those who wants some advancement is drone video and photography. I like the features that comes with it especially the follow me which allows you to fly hands-free. My major concern initially was I was having difficulty hovering it and I dont know whether it was the gps calibration or the wind outside. So far it has been a good experience and look forward to updating my review in future should I encounter anything more. I may get another one for my son when we get familiar with this one. I am happy with it and the price is good for a low budget drone. My simple advice is be careful when flying for thr first time

title: Critical failures
text: This is our second holy stone drone.  Both of them had critical errors where the drone does not respond to the remote control and crashes into an object permanently damaging the unit.  The issues seem to become more pronounced after you try to use the app to view and control the drone.  I would look elsewhere to find a more reliable drone that does not crash and break routinely.

title: Returned it. Won't buy another.
text:
Update. They have contacted me and have said they would send me a free one if I change my review. I'm not doing any such thing. And now I no longer trust any of the good reviews for this product and neither should you. Others have spoken about this in their reviews as well. So I have dropped my review from 2 to 1 star.

I tend to hyperfocus on hobbies so when I got this drone I had already downloaded the PDF manual. So when it showed up I was ready. I calibrated before each of the 5 times I flew it using both batteries easy time. It started off good and went south.

First it developed a shimmy in midair while hovering. Like one prop would slow down and that corner would dip. I reset everything and calibrated it again and charged the batteries. The next time it just wondered off to the side. GPS count of 15 and all batteries full. I had to keep it steady, it would never settle down and hover.

The last time I tried to fly it days later, full batteries and I did both calibration steps.... This time the front props spun up and the rear props didn't and it flipped backwards off my picnic table and broke the gimbal.

I gave it two stars due to Holy Stones fast response to emails. But in the end it was easier to return it and move on.

title: The HS720E offers a compelling blend of features and performance
text:
This is my first drone purchase and something I’ve wanted for a long time for the ability to take aerial photographs of my property and gardens, and to gain a different perspective of the world through photography. A few years ago I had reserved a Lily but they went under before coming to market and I only just now picked-up the interest again. I was originally looking at the DJI Mavic Mini, but paused because I wasn’t fully comfortable with the cost, so I ended-up looking at Holy Stone instead because the price barrier was lessened for me, and the reviews were positive. I’m very pleased with my purchase.

I have not nearly begun to fully explore the features and am especially interested in the GPS waypointing, the Follow Me feature, and some other neat tricks, but I will share a few first impressions about initial ownership.
The Holy Stone comes in a very nice case and the overall process from opening the box to first flight is straight-forward and intuitive. The quality of the materials, fit and finish are all very high; even the plastic parts wrappings have a high-quality feel to them. I spent about a half hour reading the manual (which was clearly written) and downloading the Ophelia GO app needed (?) to control flight and imagery. It was an easy path to first flight.

The camera and flight controls were easy and intuitive, and I found the drone to be responsive of every command and action (with the exception of that RTH mode – more on this below – where is ignores any inputs and just rushes home… it would be nice to have “override” flight control even when this mode is invoked.)
Since this tiny machine is entirely dependent on its battery for safe, functional use, let me start with a few observations about battery life: first it must be said that the efficiency of the motors and flight controls even allowing operation for 20-30 minutes is impressive. I will also note that the charge time on the batteries is frustratingly elongated: it takes 5-6 hours per battery, so if you want to really be able to enjoy the drone for any period of time (and especially if you’re traveling to location somewhere), you definitely want lots of spares charged and ready.

My opening flight experience demonstrated that the battery usage meter is woefully inaccurate: on a brand new freshly-charged battery (maiden flight), at two bars remaining (out of four) the drone went into Return To Home (RTH) mode and darted off. Unfortunately, “home” was in the front yard and I was presently in the back yard – all heavily treed – and I had not yet learned to set the RTH altitude higher than the default of 49 ft. so I observed helplessly as the machine zoomed away only to hear the sickening sound of pfft...pfft…pfft as it dove into leafy branches and tumbled down to the ground shortly thereafter. I walked to the front yard on a recovery mission whilst browbeating myself into acceptance of a short-lived and expensive period of initial drone ownership, and lamented my $300 mistake…

Thankfully – gratefully – once I retrieved the drone and rubbed the dirt off the body, I found no lasting damage. I suspect the “impact” against the leafy branches softened the blow, as did the similarly buffered journey from treetop to ground. I figure it merely tumbled between branches and ultimately had a dead gravity fall of perhaps “only” ten feet onto soil. Still, the fact that the drone survived such “operator error” mishap greatly – though not recklessly – increased my confidence in the sturdiness of the drone. Still, this event taught me to change the RTH altitude, and to not trust the battery levels for anything two-bars or less. This means any “brave” maneuvers such as, for example, over-water flight will only be done with a four-bar fully-charged battery – and very briefly at that. This drone is not waterproof, so this bears keeping in mind as well, especially if any water overflights are contemplated.

During my first flight session, I tested the altitude capabilities and paused when the drone was little more than a tiny dot in the sky above my head. To me, it was crazy-high in the air and I imagined I was at the upper limit; I later found out from the flight log that the highest initial altitude of that flight was 190 ft. In other words, less than HALF of the full altitude capability of this little drone, which is mighty impressive. And even at that low altitude, the images taken from the camera aimed at horizon level had a curve to them, lending the feeling that this thing was miles into the air and showing the curvature of the Earth (unless you’re a Flat Earth Society person and don’t believe that nonsense ;)

The camera quality is good, but I would not say I was astounded by the clarity. When zoomed in detail, it is clear – no pun intended – to see the limitations in resolution. I’m not sure if this is a factor of the image stability, limitations on the camera itself, or perhaps unreasonable expectations from me. I would not say I was disappointed – after all, the ability to take these aerial shots is itself amazing – but I think the clarity of the camera on my iPhone SE (2020) is better. Then again, I cannot reliably toss my iPhone 200 feet into the air and snap a picture!

All in all, the build quality is impressive, the packaging and documentation feels high-quality, and the features and capability are quite superb for this modest price point. I would highly recommend this drone given the quality and capabilities, not to mention the “gee-whiz” fun factor, all of which make it entirely worth the investment!

title: Beginner friendly with many nice features and video.
text:
[[VIDEOID:eb95993f9180848c8e97c2e303fe4a07]] I'm a novice to this level of drone and this is the most advanced drone I currently own. I have not used all the features yet and I will edit this review when I do.
Thus far I have used it to see the river and also to look for a lost RC plane.
I base this review from a BEGINNER/NOVICE viewpoint. Overall I am very pleased with this drone at the current price point. It has a nice small carry case.

Pros:
The controller is very user friendly and fit my Samsung S10+ Just fine.
Taking off is straight forward with speed selection available. I use the fastest speed for two reasons: to provide more powerful and immediate control when flying in minimal to moderate wind and to allow faster maneuverability.
I tried a video with moderate wind and the drone held position very well. It was not rock solid but the drift was very minimal and IMPRESSIVE.
Battery life was fine with indications on your phone through the app and on the controller as well.

Cons:
Just one issue: the battery charge time seems long and I do not like the connection method between battery and charger. Its usable but a bit annoying.

Overall I'm very impressed and pleased.

title: Good drone for beginners.

title: Excellent drone for beginner photography and video.
text:
This drone is fun to use and fly. It's easy to control, stable and takes very nice photos and video. The GPS features are awesome, it holds is location easily and the come home feature works flawlessly. It landed within a foot of where it took off every time. This is a very excellent drone for the features it has! My 10 year old son loved flying it and using the FPV feature, I didn't have to worry about him losing it or the wind taking it away. The Ophelia Go application worked flawlessly and was fun to use. I really liked the ability to move the camera up and down to get varying angles while flying.

I highly recommend this drone as a beginner GPS drone that takes awesome video and photos and it's price cannot be beat for the features it has.

title: Best Budget Camera Drone
text: The HS720E is a great drone! I have very little experience with drones and yet I have no trouble flying this one. Though I have only flown a few times so far I have run it to limits and am very pleased. The pictures and videos are outstanding.

title: Very good learning experience.
text: Make sure you calibrate both compass and gps. Remote is hard to see led in direct sunlight. Holy Stone was very helpful and service solution was excellent.

title: Easy operation for beginners
text:
After spending less than an hour yesterday afternoon playing with the Holystone 720E I realized how easy and amazing this drone was. This is my first experience using a remote controlled device of any kind... ever, let alone a drone. I'm heading for a beautiful waterfall next week and I can't wait to take the drone on a video/photo shoot. With a few more hours honing my flying skills I am confident I will return with some amazing and memorable shots
Cheers, Steve H

title: Does everything I want except for obstacle avoidance
text:
This Holy Stone drone comes well packed, in a nice hard shelled yet compact carrying case. The instructions are clear and I was able to quickly set up my first flights without crashing as I have done on other drones. The return home feature is among my favorites. The connection to my phone has worked well every time. The iOS application will take some getting used to as the icons aren't clearly identified, but once I know what hey are I will probably be better equipped to use the app, as opposed to the remote control.

I would recommend for beginner enthusiasts, and for the price even experienced drone flyers will enjoy this product. The only wish list I have is for obstacle avoidance. I looked and did not see a Holy Stone drone with that feature, so if anyone knows of one, let me know.

title: Easy to learn and great pictures
text: The drone has been fun to use. In windy condtion it does struggle some but overall, it works as expected.

title: Easy to learn and great pictures
text: The drone has been fun to use. In windy condtion it does struggle some but overall, it works as expected.

title: Well worth it, would buy again
text:
Takes great video and photos. Hover is smooth as silk. This is my second drone.
note: it comes set to beginner mode. Seems like its crippled, turn it off, tooooooonnnnns of fun. Remote camera aiming is awesome. I love it

title: Holystone HS 720e is a great value priced drone.
text: Holystone hs 720e is a great buy. Very easy to set up and easy to fly. The picture quality was great and I didn’t notice and props is the videos I shot. This must have been fixed in this model. I have only had it for a short while but so far I am very impressed.

title: Spend your money elsewhere
text: I purchased this drone a wile back and just got around to pulling it out and seeing how it works. After figuring out that I needed to remove it from beginners mode (this was not mentioned in my owners manual) I was finally able to get it to take off. Figured I fly it about 8 feet off the ground to get familiar with it at first. After about  1 minute in the air it decided to no response and kamikazed itself into the side of my brick house. 1 motor is now dead and even after crashing I couldn’t get it to turn off and I had to pull the battery with 3 motors going at full blast. Most expensive 1 minute flight I’ve ever had. I’ll stick to my other drone that hasn’t given me any issues.

title: Drone broken right out of the box - flys on its own!
text: This drone we only flew twice as both times it took off flying on it own!  Yes, on it's own!  We started it up and it took off hit the fence and the second time we took it a large field.  It hovered for a moment and then took off to the left and went up 15 feet took off a a fast pace slamming into an apartment building and crashed to the ground yes still running!  We pressed the emergency shut off and it was still running.  I do not recommend this product it not safe

title: HolyStone fixed the issue!
text:
I bought this drone after reviews of it being the best drone for the money. It came and it was great. It was pretty easy to fly for a beginner like me. The pics and videos were good quality and it was fun to fly.

One day I went to fly the drone with my 3 yo near our local high school's football field. Despite having GPS coverage, the drone randomly lost connection and literally flew away. I could not find it. It was gone. I was devastated.

I called HolyStone to tell them what happened. First off, it was easy to get a hold of customer service, so kudos there. After explaining it to them, HolyStone MADE IT RIGHT! I am still flying HolyStone drones and give them an A+ rating.

title: Great Entry Level Drone
text:
5/5 Value, great for getting hands on experience without spending a ton.
4/5 Control, have had a few times on landing the drone not detect it's on the ground and still spin the blades causing it to flip over or glide across the ground and hit something. Otherwise no issues flying.
5/5 Quality, even with the couple wrecked landing everything is still intact, only a few small dings in a couple blades. Great quality picture and video, the stabilization of the camera is very nice.

title: Looked great, then it vanished.
text:
Arrived and worked great, took it for a spin after charging battery over night. Flying over wooded area to get long distance pictures of a neighborhood and had sudden and complete loss of signal. Best guess was that the battery became disconnected because the motor sound died instantly and it did not return to launch point.. Have not been able to recover it as of yet. Looks like a total loss on the first day of full operation.

Holy Stone followed up quickly and sent a replacement drone free of charge. Have completed about 20 hours on the new drone with no similar issues. I have been double checking battery seating every flight though, to be safe.
Seems to be an excellent entry into the drone market or for light use. My 6 year old son loves to fly it (poorly and above tree level so he doesnt hit anything, but hey he's 6)

title: Works as advertised

text: Being new to the drone market, I purchased this drone from a review on youtube. This drone is easy to learn and fly. I have had it for a few months and still enjoy flying it.

text: This drone has been a blast. Little on the lighter side so wind will move it around but super easy to flay and great to learn on. Tough as well. I have crashed it a couple of times and not a scratch. Very happy with my purchase.

title: Best drone for this price.
text: I think, with this price, there's no better Drone on the market.

title: Best drone for Beginners, so easy to use. Outstanding Customer service from Holy Stone, Good Fun!!!
text: I do not write many reviews, but this experience need to be shared. I have never owned a drone before and I am very happy with this one. Not only is the HS 720E a really nice drone, but the Holy Stone customer service department is outstanding which has made buying this drone a really great experience. The HS 720 E is a great choice for beginners as it has multiple features which really aid the novice flier. Among them it has a great "return to home" function so if you panic, can't see the drone, feel like you lost it, or otherwise , with one push of the button it will automatically return to it's launch position. It has a forward facing mode to ease with directional control as well as dual speed modes, essentially slow and normal(fast). When in slow, or beginner mode, the 720E allows you to set certain limiting parameters, such as distance and height, while you learn to better control this really fun drone. Also, the remote control is very easy to use, even for an older guy like me! There are two east to operate toggle sticks which do most of the work, up and down, forward and reverse, that's basically it, real easy. I attach my iPhone 8+ to the remote which serves as video monitor and it operates flawlessly. The 4k camera takes really great Still and video footage.  I simply could not be happier with flying this drone and capturing these amazing images. Unfortunately I had a rare and unusually thing happen with my drone, very likely caused by me and I ended up crashing the drone. In the process of crashing and falling >50 ft., one rotor arm broke. I immediately contacted Holy Stone CS and received a reply email from a gentleman named Sunny. Sunny was so very helpful and understanding. He asked many questions and tried to get a full understanding of my circumstances, and with quick replies we exchanged a few different emails. In the end, after offering numerous solutions, Holy Stone and Sunny totally took care of my situation and I am happy to report I am flying my drone again (insert big smile here). Thank you again Sunny and Holy Stones, I love this drone!!!

title: Great beginner drone for flying and cinematography
text: Great camera and range! Doesn’t have obstacle sensors so still need to watch it but it is very hard to crash. Definitely a great beginner drone!

title: Great drone & Great Company
text: I’ve had two of these drones the first one did great the entire time that I had it they’re easy to learn how to use their easy to set up.  The second one didn’t work correctly from the start and after reaching out to the manufacturer they’ve agreed to replace it so I definitely have to change my original review and give this company a five star rating.

title: Unreliable product / Pending review
text:
I received this product and was very excited to film some aerial shots in 4K. The problem with the product that I received was that the batteries would not hold any charge, after 30 seconds of flying the battery would drop from 4 bars to 1 after charging for 3 hours. After the battery dropped to 1 bar, instead of the drone coming back to the GPS pinned location, the drone would spaz out and fly randomly. The drone would not respond to input from the controller and the land key would cause the drone to fly erratically in the air.

I am disappointed in the battery quality and quality of the drone. Would not recommend.

Customer service reached out after I got a full refund for returning the product. They are sending a replacement for the drone. I will update this review with my experience with the replacement drone when I get it. For now, customer service has made my experience worth 4 stars.

title: This is a good product for the money.
text: The product is well built. It was easy to learn how to fly. It handled very well and the camera is very stable. The only problem I had was that it would loose connection with my phone once and a while. It could have been where I was flying or possibly because my phone battery was low.

title: UNEXPECTED CUSTOMER SERVICE I RECEIVED!!!!
text:
After reading some unfavorable reviews I was not expecting to get the customer service I received. I contacted Holystone and explained my situation. They had no obligation in helping me out and I knew that. What Holystone kindly did for me was above and beyond any expectations' I could've ever imagined. I spoke to Ysa over the phone and she jumped right on it, producing results in less than a day. Four days later I received a new drone and couldn't be more happy with Holystone and what they did for me. This is only my 2nd written review I've ever done in my life and that is because you just don't receive favorable service in this day and age. I was pleasantly surprise with my experience in dealing with customer service and would like to say "THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH" for not treating me like a number!!!

Dennis L

title: Fell out of air for no reason and broke!
text: Have had this drone just over 30 days and it randomly just took a dive and broke while flying it. Didn’t run into anything, the battery had plenty of life, and it was well within range. We enjoyed it while it lasted but it is busted now. Contacting Holy Stone to see if they can help at all. Otherwise $300 down the drain

title: Defective on 2nd flight
text:
As a former RC helicopter owner, I was looking forward to getting back into flying. Unfortunately even though I checked reviews on the Holy Stone HS720E 4K EIS Drone, I am so far extremely disappointed in the drone. After fully reading the owner's manual through twice, I took the drone for it's first flight. I meticulously went through the pre-flight checks and calibration process, and the drone drone performed well throughout a short range familiarization flight and return to home landing (one battery) although it missed home by around 5 feet.
The next day I took the drone to a local RC flying area.
I set up in the drone area and meticulously went through the pre-flight checks and calibration process again, it was showing 15 GPS satellites and perfect connection to the controller.
I pressed the take off button, the drone rose to about 5ft, a few seconds later, the drone shot off to the left at a high rate of speed (I was not even touching the control joysticks yet) and would not respond to controls. This is a giant RC flying area with runway, but the drone area is off to the side, the drone flew about 80 feet to the left, and hit a border pine tree at a height of about 6 feet, and a estimated speed of 15 mph. The drone flipped upside down on impact with the tree, and landed in grass.
There was no major damage to the drone... skuff on the top, and a few small nicks on the propellers, But had this not been in a sparsely populated side of the area, or had the drone gone the other direction, someone could have been hurt.
After the fact, I found at least a dozen negative reviews that described very similar, and potentially dangerous problems.
