title: Great company and customer service
text: [[VIDEOID:fb010b05f35f164f6954598599bd5034]] I purchased the HS720E. It was a great drone. I had an issue during one of its flights and it resulted in a crash and a broken propeller arm. I reached out to Holy Stone customer service and explained the issue. After answering a couple of questions they promptly replaced my broken drone and actually upgraded it to the 720G. I just received it so once I fly it I will post a review but this review is to let you all know that if you ever have an issue just reach out to Holy Stone and they will take care of it. I always support companies that stand behind their products! And Holy Stone definitely does that. Awesome customer service and a great company!

title: Out of control flight update 06/27/21
text:
Flew fine for about 20 minutes, changed the battery flew for about 5 more minutes with no problems and then, while hovering, it accelerated violently while making a wide sweeping turn before crashing into the side of a building. Fortunately nobody was hurst. What was concerning was is that I tried the emergency shutdown and it did not respond. Once I got to the crash site one propeller was still running and I tried to shut it down on the drone itself and that did not work either, had to remove the battery to stop it. Quite disappointed since it seems to have a ‘bug’ of some sort. Unfortunately, cannot recommend.
Update 06/19/21… Vivian in Customer support has been absolutely fantastic. After reading my review they offered a full refund or a replacement drone, I chose the replacement drone and it will arrive next week. Once I unbox I will update again. The Company has gone above and beyond and I can definitely recommend buying from them since Customer Satisfaction is their top concern!
Update 06/27/21… I received the new drone on 06/21/21 and it works flawlessly so far. The company was very prompt and responsive and I upped the stars to 4 and recommended since they will make things right! Thank you

title: Very nice drone
text: Easy and fast setup. Flying in no time. Doesn't have a long range but to have some fun and take pictures/video is perfect. Came with two batteries, charger, remote and case. 👍👍👍

title: Great first drone
text: Great first drone takes very good photos and is durable only issue I’ve had is the more flights I take it on the shorter the WiFi signal has been getting which in turn means linear distance before dropping signal has decreased significantly, still a good fun drone.

title: Great entry level device.  Exactly as described.
text:
The product was exactly as described by the seller. I found the training mode incredibly helpful to learn how to use (keeps the product safe from over-zealous beginners). Came complete with almost everything I needed (2 AA batteries req'd). Had a great first flight. Camera is not quite what I was hoping for, but I am very picky when it comes to that . Image is stable, but the exposure and clarity is not there. My phone keeps disconnecting when I use the left top video button...not sure what that is about, but am guessing it has to do more with my phone than anything (Galaxy 10E).
But, and again...this is I very good entry level drone. I look forward to using it often.

title: Really good value
text: Purchased this product after buying another Holy Stone product.  Was looking for moderately priced drone which had GPS.  After considerable research on-line, I concluded this was the drone to buy.  I have been very pleased with the drone -- it has lived up to all my expectations.  The controls are intuitive and the app works like a charm.  Have used it several times and it holds a position very well even in windy conditions which was a must as my prior less capable drone was unable to hold a position in a moderate wind.  The GPS home works great -- it does in fact return to its launch position within less than a foot -- which is pretty good given that GPS is not accurate to less than a number of feet.  Lots of videos on-line as well that help get a beginner going on the various features of the drone and the app.

title: Read the instructions and follow them for a successful flight
text: It’s a very good drone for the price it has modes that expensive drones have.

title: Easy to use.
text: I am not tech savvy by no stretch of the imagination. So when I bought the holy Stone drone I was worried that I wasn’t able to get it set up or even get it off the ground. I was wrong, it took a little time to understand the instructions but once I was able to understand the steps it became pretty easy to operate. I downloaded the app so we can sync to my phone and once I did that it was smooth sailing. I live in a very wooded area that I would like to see what wildlife we have i.e. bears, Deer, wild boar, wild turkey and so on so this definitely will come in handy. Heavy duty design drone that comes with two batteries. The camera Video is in color I am very clear that I can see everything from my phone. No regrets in buying this drone.

title: Great first drone!
text:
My first drone and I'm glad I chose the Holystone HS 720E. Easy to control and the camera quality is excellent! I brought the 2battery package and I suggest you do. Battery life is almost half an hour and it takes 5 hours to recharge it.

I had a slight camera issue and I contacted Holystone. Great customer service even with the timezone difference. They took care of my problem and I'm back in business. Thanks Holystone!

I would highly recommend Holy Stone. Just order two extra batteries if you need an hour or more of video.

Rotors were still running and to retrieve it, it got stuck between a rock and a hard place, I got cut up by the rotors.  Don't know if it will work.  Waiting for hand to heal.

title: You get a awesome drone at this incredible price
text: [[VIDEOID:5611e35c353ba26ddadc9a301c8390a5]] This Drone was sent fast and in great condition! The drone flys and responds incredibly handles winds and the fly apps has some good auto fly presets like follow me , orbital and etc! Awesome Drone .

title: Great for Beginners, Very easy to fly right out of the box!
text:
Being my first drone purchase, I was nervous about the drone just flying away and there goes my new expensive "toy". But with the safety features, Auto Return Home, Return to Home Button & the GPS, I feel more confident.
The drone is very easy to fly and after just the first flight I felt proficient. I've only started playing around with the camera, but was amazed at how good the photos and videos were. The Anti-Shake Camera tech really made a difference. I originally bought just to fly around and have fun, but now I think that I'll be taking a lot more pictures and videos.
The advanced modes like "Follow Me" I find useful. Lastly I'm getting a little more time on the batteries then the 23 minutes stated in the specs. The carrying case was also a nice touch.

title: Very impressed
text: I have other Holy Stone drones that are great This, but this drone is a definite step up!! It is simple to fly and the camera is amazing!! EIS and footage quality at the price point can't be beat!!

title: First time Drone owner
text: I just received my Holy Stone HS720E after reading many articles and reviews on various drones.  I chose the HS720E  and have been very pleased with its performance. I was out flying quickly, but slowly.  What a blast, videos were clear and sharp and the drone was very stable and predictable.  Highly recommended.

title: Good for beginners
text: Reasonably easy to set up and fly

title: Awesome quality. Decent range
text:
[[VIDEOID:c41e3046b7b1e4d8e2f7f572a94a3e74]] The quality of the camera is the most amazing part of this camera. With the image stabilization, the videos look professional. You can't see any bobbing from the wind. Few trees make a big impact on the range. I went anywhere from 165m to about 300m. The farthest I've flow it is 500m. It doesnt seem to push past that. If the drone goes out of range, as long as you have gps on, the drone will return to home. That's wherever you launched from. The follow me and orbit mode work really well. The batteries take a long time to charge and I've never gotten them under 50%. The 1 time I did hit that, it enabled a geofence so it wouldn't be too far. Speaking of, with the app, you can set a personal geofence to make sure you dont fly too high or far.

Overall, I recommend this to everyone. Oh, also this upgraded e version comes with 2 batteries in case anyone was wondering.

title: UPDATE Has a poor camera and a lot of fun BUT NOT WORTH the price if wanting pictures or video
text: The beginner mode I thought was helpful in that it operates at a much slower speed which gives time to learn the controls. the pictures looked quite shark on the cellphone but when viewed on the computer they are very soft. For video it could really use a gimble as any change in speed or direction changes the attitude of the drone, ie. head pitches down when going forward, up when stopping  or backing up. The battery charger is really slooow, 5-6hr each battery and hooking up the batteries to the charger the connection isn't very secure. Every time you shut down like when changing batteries you have to go back into your phone settings to reset the wifi which is a little confusing at first. I am lovin' it in spite of the limitations, a good buy for the money.

title: Love this Drone
text:
Love this Drone.
Great drone for beginners. It can be very intimidating for a beginner, because of the investment. You don’t want to screw up and crash it. However, I read the instruction booklet a few times and watched numerous YouTube videos specifically on the HS720E and got enough courage to give it a try.
It was easier than I thought. This drone is extremely user friendly. After a few more times, I will definitely test out the limits of this little guy.
The build quality is excellent. You don’t feel like it’s a budget drone. The pictures and videos you take are amazing, specially because of the EIS. I do wish that the up and down gimbal was smoother. It also needs a left and right gimbal.
I can’t wait to take this drone on my many adventures on vacation. It’s definitely going to enhance my videos and pictures.
You can’t go wrong with this drone. It’s definitely one of the best in this price range.

title: Beginner mode
text:
This is a good drone, but it has some issues. First when you start it up it's in beginner mode.
It has too many limits in this mode, height, distance from you, limited control when it gets to its outer limit of distance. Over all Still worth the price. I crashed twice and it's still working.

title: Holystone 720E easy to fly & high quality
text:
I received my HS720E yesterday, on time well packaged and it sure seems to be a quality product. This is my first drone, and I gave it a maiden flight yesterday, and did not crash it, over about 35 mins of flight time. That says a lot about the controllability for a first time pilot. As long as you go slow, keep it in low speed mode, you won’t have a problem. If you start to get in trouble, just let go of the sticks, and it will stop and hover. Then you can take your time to think about how to correct the problem.
The drone seems to be very well engineered, and the case and controller are high quality.
This drone sits in a sweet spot for pricing between the more expensive drones ( you know the name) and the cheapies, with I think all of the same quality. The entry level DJI doesn’t even have “follow me mode”, this does. On my first flight I exhausted 2 batteries, and got about 35 mins of flight time. However it was extremely cold, and I think this lessened the battery longevity. Also there was sustained winds of 13 mph and gusts to 16 mph and the drone and EIS camera handled it great. No jumpy video even at those winds, which is outside its flight parameters for safe flying. If I had a complaint, it would be the phone holder on the remote controller could be a little better, and the charger is just a little of a pain to keep the batteries connected. Also I wish the batteries charged faster. But these issues are minor. When compared to the quality/price point of the drone package. I would certainly recommend to a family member. I can’t speak to the longevity of the drone . I hope it holds up well. I think it will. Plus I have heard all great things about Holystone customer service. If your on the fence, buy it, you will love it. If I need to update this review for any reason I will. Btw, this review is totally voluntary and I was not coerced in any way, and I paid for my drone.

title: Has features of pricier drones
text:
This is my second drone, the other being a Parrot. I am well pleased with the quality, workmanship, customer support and extra features of my Holystone 720E. I will update as my experience lengthens, but overall impressions are that this company is producing a quality drone at a price point well below that of others - a sure path to success.
I have noticed a bit of drone 'drift' after the controller is centered. However, rather than a criticism, I take it as a flight characteristic; if you wish pin-point accuracy, simply give a quick controller jab to the opposite zone to counter it. Camera and gimbel are fantastic. Now, don't make my batteries unavailable as my drone gets older the way Parrot did!!

title: very good flight experience and camera quality
text: I was happy with the drone initially, then it decided to take a sudden dive by itself and crashed into a tree. Unfortunately the drone can no longer calibrate itself after I retrieve it.

title: Not worth the price.
text: Drone goes rogue and crashes without warning. Controls lock out at times. Controls are unresponsive at times. GPS connection can get lost on a clear sky day. The drone is easily taken away with lighter winds. Do not recommend for casual drone flying.

title: Good drone.
text: It is a nice drone for the price. If I upgrade I know some of the features I would like to have. Still getting the hang of flying it. My 1st drone so I really don't know much yet. I like it though.

title: Great purchase
text: Bought this drone because of the features for the money. My first drone so not much for comparison but I am overall happy. My first drone experienced problems but customer service promptly resolved it. I would buy again

title: Great Drone
text: When I crashed my drone when a motor quit mid flight my wife suggested I buy a new one.  It was pretty busted up.  Maybe because it was a cheap drone.  I'm an amazon buyer, so of course, started looking at reviews.  I honed in on the Holy Stone line because of the reviews.  The 720 and 720E models fit my budget.  I even did some YouTube videos.  Nothing bad there.  I decided on the "E" model as it has an upgraded camera system.  After receiving the drone I was, and still am, impressed with the quality and fit.  A nice feature is the ability to adjust the angle of the camera in flight.  Of course this is a GPS drone.  Don't buy a drone without this feature unless you want to buy another one when you lose it or crash it beyond repair.  Did I mention it comes with two batteries. Nice.  The controller has a nice LCD screen that has all the necessary info for flight.  It also has the handy folding handles to stabilize use.  It connects to the GPS satellites very quickly and lets you know how many are connected.  I had a slight issue and contacted customer service.  That was on a Saturday and they responded the next day-Sunday.  Can't go wrong there.  All in all, you can't go wrong with this drone.

title: Impressive little drone.
text: I was pleasantly impressed with this drone. As with most new toys, I took this out of the box and immediately started playing with it. Even with the partial charge on the new batteries, I got over 10 minutes of flight time, each (batteries were about 1/3ish charged). Controller and drone paired quickly and easily. Calibrations were a breeze and the app connected very fast. Performance and handling the first time was a bit slow, then I realized it defaulted to the slower "beginner" mode. Changed that over to normal (high) mode and this drone was an absolute dream to fly. My ONLY gripe (and this isn't the manufactures fault) is the software controlled 397ft altitude limit, but technically thats more of an FAA issue, not a Holy Stone issue. Definitely plan on buying a couple more of the HS720e drones for my kids. Great kit, easy to learn on for beginners, and a dream to fly.

title: A Great Choice For This Serious Newbie
text:
[[VIDEOID:8a0d4bd9a8b329537e27a7db38de8edd]] The Video: Launch, camera movement, sideways movement, yaw, descent, and triggering Return To Home.
The video is from the first and second flights after getting the HS720E. I'm a total newbie to drones. Because we were excited to give it a try, we went out as soon as the batteries were charged - on the same day it arrived. The video shows the take-off from the case itself. That was a make-shift launch bad, as ours hadn't arrived yet. A launch pad is essential with this mini drone, because it sits extremely low to the ground. (Not a problem generally, but an issue on grass.) I have a photography background, and plan to manually adjust the camera settings. For this video, the camera settings are on automatic, which is how it comes out of the box.

We were looking for a beginner's drone to see if we clicked with drones as a hobby—our 'gateway drone'. We wanted 4K and features similar to those in more advanced drones without breaking the bank. the 720E seemed too good to be true. While we've only had it for a few days, I thought I'd leave a first impressions review.

The drone is incredibly compact. It has weight, and is much more substantially built that I expected. This is not a toy. I still can't get over the tech in the drone and what is possible through the controller and the app. Admittedly, the very first flight I flew around a lot more than I should have in the wind. Things were going great, but then I got nervous and because I had no skills I started hitting all of the buttons. It was like I was playing Tekken and just crunching down on the controller. I sent it farther than I had expected it to fly, and crashed it onto the top of a flat-roofed building. It bounced off, landed in a tree, and tumbled to the ground. I thought "that is the most expensive first flight ever." Incredibly, it survived with very minor battle wounds and we were in the air again within a minute. The take-off in the video is the flight right after the crash.

Lesson learned: I'm now adopting a training regime based on the fundamentals of flying, working every day in short bits to build up muscle and brain memory.

Recording on an SD card is simple, and the way to go. Footage downloaded to the phone is likely to have skipped frames.

I'm looking forward to working more with this drone, taking it on trips, and experimenting with it as a creative tool. As a newbie, I am embracing drone flying as I would learning an instrument: It is a *process* - not an *event*.

I hope this has been helpful!

PS: Indeed, I have registered the drone, and have taken the TRUST certification. Even so, I was close enough to a building for the drone to fly over ... not a smart move on my first flight, and not recommended. :-)

title: Great product! Loads of fun!

text: [[VIDEOID:f7f4ec24e5b10a28d408e49d843b216b]] I must say this drone exceeded my expectations with its quality and ease of use. The video quality is really good (4k @ 30 fps videos are saved to the SD card) and it hovers gently for steady photos. It’s just an all around great drone for beginners and average drone enthusiasts alike. Just remember to register with the FAA because it weighs more than 250g.

title: THE HOLY STONE HS720E IS WOW
text: My girlfriend told me I'm too demented to fly a drone. I researched on-line and You-Tube. The Holy Stone HS720E came up as a great drone.  I can't agreed more. title: Great Drone, but batteries take forever to recharge
text:
I ordered this drone as a hobby item for myself and cannot even express how awesome it is! Super easy to learn and get set up, and this pack comes with everything you'd need to get started. The camera is phenomenal and the EIS works wonders for great shots. With a little practice in your maneuvering skills, you can really create some excellent shots.
PROs: Super easy to learn and use, Comes with everything you need and a great case, Tons of fun!

CONs: Even though it comes with 2 batteries (which is great!) and it's competitive against all other drone flight times I've seen in this market per battery, the recharging time is terrible. The batteries take 5-7 hours to recharge each, and they provide a duel charger BUT the duel charger only charges the batteries one at a time. So it will really take 10-14 hours to recharge both of your batteries. Something to also note... These are the type of battery you do not want to leave charging after they've fully charged, so you don't really want to just leave them overnight either. You will absolutely want to stock up on batteries and maybe additional chargers as well.

title: Worth it! "The Real Deal"
text: Works precisely as advertised. Great flight time (20-23) minutes while recording the whole time. Easy to use app, customizable presets, camera filters and settings in app. Responsive and can handle moderate wind. Safety features actually work. This is a fantastic drone that is half as much $$$ as it's competition and the difference is negligible. Buy it yesterday!

title: Great starter drone, great quality.
text: This is one of the best drones that Holystone has made. It is great for beginners and is a great price for its value. The drone has amazing features and the camera resolution is great. It is capable of taking smooth footage and is stable under rather windy conditions. It hovers in place perfectly and never has drifted off to one direction so far in every flight it has gone through. Holystone always has a great customer support and is always very helpful. Every feature works up to my standards or surpasses it. The only downside I have noticed is the following:  The battery charge time. It charges the batteries one at a time and each one takes 5 hours. There are MANY drones that have the same if not better battery life and take WAY less amount of time to charge it. The technology is definitely out there for charging batteries faster. However, it does not bother me since I will just charge it overnight. Overall, this drone gets 5 stars since everything else advertised works perfectly and suits and exceeds beginner needs. It really is a great drone to help newcomers gain experience and learn the art of aerial photography. It's very portable and is definitely worth the price... Other reviews that are bad are probably are from people that don't bother reading the instructions or just got a faulty product. And like I said, customer support is very good and they will always be willing to help you just in case your drone is faulty. I mean come on, even their app has a button that gives you a free battery, saves you 50 bucks. Holystone has always shown great quality and continues to do so.

title: Phones interfere w/controls, goes berzerk
text:
Drone flies perfectly without a phone connected to it. However, once a phone is connected you enter the casino where bets are taken to see where it goes and how it acts. Sometimes it flies and sometimes it goes crazy. Not anything I'm willing to risk injury or damage for.

If you're lucky, you may just lose control and the drone will just hover. On a bad roll of the dice not only does it lose control but it actively goes crazy and flies in any direction, fast.

The remedy is to disconnect the wifi immediately... however this is not practical if you want to use this for photos. So it's basically unuseable.

Tried with 4 different phones: Google, Samsung, and two different Apple phones. Different pilots. All the proper calibration... It is definitely the phone interfering with the controls, likely at the controller end but could be the drone accepting interference too.

title: High quality feel to components.
text: Everything had a "solid" feel to it. Fit and finish is excellent with the exception of the propellers. One came apart while I was setting up the drone. They supply a complete set of four extras with the unit so I simply changed it out and proceeded.  The manual is better than most but still has a few issues.

title: Fantastic Holy Stone!
text:
The HS720E is the most bang for your money! I used to fly RC 20 years ago and was a little apprehensive on flying a drone. Let me tell you, flying this Holy Stone is soooo much easier than a RC airplane. Just like they say on YouTube, take it slow, fly in Slow Speed for a while, and dont play with other features at first. The Auto Launch & RTH features are lifesavers!
Build quality is fantastic! The controler isnt busy with buttons, but you add features with useing a cell phone for a monitor. Just keep the drone in sight while learning.
I added yellow reflective tape on the rear and silver tape on front to aid me in seeing the orientation up in the air. With sun at your back the reflective tape glows just enough to help.
You'll see the tape in my photos.

You won't go wrong with the Holy Stone HS720E.

title: Not what you think
text: This is a company that offers free gifts if you give a good review. It does NOT do good in wind, and the range is horrible. It isn’t quiet, and camera quality is ok, but not as advertised. Not a travel drone by any means due to the weight and size. The battery charger is very sketchy. Batteries barely stay on the charger and although you can plug both in at the same time, only 1 charges at a time. Each FIVE HOURS TO FULL CHARGE. So you’ll get your “maybe” 20 mins of flight time each battery, but you’ll have to charge for 10 hours. Don’t buy.

title: Great drone for the money!
text:
[[VIDEOID:1ae6f980be1bc655001377313728b2fd]] Great drone for the money! Easy to fly. Takes great videos and photos. Flight time averages 20 minutes per battery. Only downside on the batteries is the time it takes to recharge (about 5 hours each). I bought 2 with my drone and an extra pair and charger.
The only feature missing is auto avoidance, but I haven't found any with that feature close to this price point. This is an easy to learn drone that performs well, even on the coast with a decent wind.
I did crash mine (could have used the auto avoidance) but was able to obtain a replacement arm on ebay for $38.00. Flies as well as new.

title: Do not buy
text:
The drone remote isn’t big and is very hard to fly also you can’t fly it very far and not that high. Not for moving fast around objects. Once you press a bottom on the remote the drone will respond 5 seconds later. The camera is blurry.
DO NOT BUY. The more expensive drone that have range are worth it.

title: Wow,  decided to get one with GPS  and ordered Holy Stone Holy Stone 720.
text:
What happened?The first drone I purchased was a Holy Stone HS110D FPV RC Drone with 1080P HD Camera for less than $50. Wow, I liked it. Then decided to get one with GPS and I bought the Holy Stone Holy Stone 720.

On my second day of the drone, I was fooling around and hard crashed the drone and broke an arm.

Flying with GPS was double the fun.

I foolishly crashed and broke one of the drone arms. I was getting ready to order a replacement arm for my newly purchased HS 720. I was easily able to get a Holy Stone customer service chat started at 1030pm. I wanted to make sure I was ordering the correct part. It ended up HS is providing the replacement part at no cost under warranty!!! Warranty is for 90 days.

title: Awesome drone. Customer service A++++!!!
text: Loved everything about the drone and customer service A++++!!!!

title: Great drone for adult beginners or pro's
text: Did much research and decided to buy this drone for my first drone, wanted something that had many features and was made by a company that was around for a while and would back my purchase. Also was looking for something in this price range. I know there are bigger companies with more popular brand drones but they cost much more and I wanted a reliable drone I can learn on. I love all the features, have not yet tried them all, still just practicing flying for now, but so far this is very easy and stable drone to fly.

title: Great Intro to Camera Drones
text:
Pretty new to drones; have flown cheap toy drones in the past. I decided I wanted to get back into drones with a decent, affordable camera drone and the HS720E fits the bill perfectly. It's very easy to fly with two modes: beginner and normal, and two speed settings. Beginner settings basically cap the height and distance you can fly, and the lower speed setting is definitely slow enough to give you confidence when learning to fly.
I was initially hesitant about using an app and my phone to control the drone as I am kind of useless when it comes to phones and computer things, but the Ophelia Go app was easy to install, easy to use, and really makes the drone fun to fly. The app provides real time view from the drone's POV (really great resolution) and is the interface for accessing the settings and different flying modes (follow me, point of interest, etc...) So you really don't fly the drone from the app, that is done with the controller. My phone is an older Apple SE running IOS 14.3 and there have been no compatibility issues.
I highly recommend this drone if you are looking for a high quality drone with an excellent camera for under $400.

title: 720e
text: During my first flight session, I tested the altitude capabilities and paused when the drone was little more than a tiny dot in the sky above my head. To me, it was crazy-high in the air and I imagined I was at the upper limit; I later found out from the flight log that the highest initial altitude of that flight was 190 ft. In other words, less than HALF of the full altitude capability of this little drone, which is mighty impressive. And even at that low altitude, the images taken from the camera aimed at horizon level had a curve to them, lending the feeling that this thing was miles into the air and showing the curvature of the Earth (unless you’re a Flat Earth Society person and don’t believe that nonsense ;)

title: Fun to fly drone
text: Recreation

title: Great equipment
text: This is a great equipment if you want to learn how to flight a drone, has a beginners setting mode that keeps your learning process safe for you and for the drone itself. The app allows you to keep your videos on your phone and on the MicroSD card on the Drone (This is not included)

title: will NOT work with the drone's software if using an ellipsis jet pack for wi fi.
text:
excellent product. easy to fly. a bit awkward prepping for flight. big problem - if you plan to use an ellipsis jet pack for wi fi don't bother. worked with their tech support for 3 days and we couldn't make it work.
great people, but depending on who you get on the line, language barrier can be an issue. (jet pack must mean something else in their country) there is a recall out now for the jet packs but i think that only applies when it catches on fire in my pocket. other than that, i couldn't test the camera (wi fi issue) but excellent drone and real-live 24 hour tech support 7 days a week. i just wish my jet pack would go ahead and explode. final note, 5 hour recharge is a long time when you have a new toy with a problem.

title: Recommend HolyStone Drones.
text: A friend recommended the Holystone HS720E and told me about their excellent customer service. They were so responsive to an issue that I had that I’ve ordered three additional different Holystone drones as birthday gifts. The gift recipients also like theirs.

title: High Quality to Cost Ratio
text: This product is such a great bang for your buck, especially if you are a novice or just don’t want to put in too much to owning a good drone. The battery life is great and the customization is great as well. I highly recommend this product.

title: HS720E
text: Great Drone.  Excellent Customer service.  very easy to control.  will fly very high and very far.  Highly recommended.

title: Great advanced entry level Drone!
text: Product is of high quality construction and easy to pick up the controls.  The return to home feature is excellent and works well. This drone has amazing range for this price point and overall I am very happy with this purchase.

title: Looses control in the air! Garbage drone, DANGEROUS! Do not buy
text:
First drone was a complete and utter failure during very first take off it took off sideways and crashed into concrete after doing all the calibrations perfectly, i was able to send it back and get my money back.

About a year later, Holy Stone followed up with me and offered to send me a free drone to give them another shot. This time i was actually able to get the drone off the floor and fly it for a little while… until it would not respond to the joystick controls!!! Lost control of the drone at about 20M altitude it just would not respond to the right joystick at all. i had to emergency land it. I tried to fly it again just to see if it was an issue with the GPS or something… bad idea, during first take off the drone came straight towards me!!! I had to knock it down with my hand, got a pretty good cut and bruised finger. Needless to say the drone is now damaged and going in the garbage… before it hurts anyone else. I stand by my previous 1 star review, this drone is TERRIBLE!! Spend the extra money for the DJI drones. Glad i didnt pay for it.

title: Great Value
text: This drone works great, especially for the money you pay. It's a great value, has really good range and photos and video from the camera are so clear. The drone and remote are very easy to use. The only issue I've had is sometimes I lose Wi-Fi connection, but that could just be my personal connection issue. Regardless, I can press the "Return To Home" button and it comes right back. Highly recommend if you want a good drone with great features and not pay too much.

title: HS720E Is an excellent Drone!
text: I love the way the HS 720e fly's with grace and ease. I had at least two crashes, but yet the bird still will fly without a problem. The video and photos were topnotch. Just be careful do a preflight check and all will be well. Happy Droning and enjoy your HS720E!

title: HolyStone 720E Perfect for a beginner, like me
text: After several weeks of researching drones and reading reviews of the HolyStone 720E And all the great youtube videos, I ordered the HolyStone 720E.Its amazing well made product and the instructions are perfect. I'm sure that I become more familiar with it I'll be able to capture great video's and become a better drone operator. Thank you for making such a good product for a reasonable price.

title: Great gift!
text: I received this as a gift because I like taking pictures and tech gear. It has been great for learning, easy set up and controls for a beginner.

title: Great beginner drone
text:
What I like the most is the simplicity to operate. Even tho I have to admit that I tried to fly it indoors because it was to cold outside and I had a couple of minor accidents with a wall and then with my kitchen cabinet 🙄. However, the drone didn’t suffer any major damage other than some scuff marks on top. That can tell me how good the quality of materials are.
After those incidents, I contacted customer support via WhatsApp because I thought the drone suffered internal damage. When I submitted the ticket the automatic reply said they will contact me within 48 hrs. So, I went online to search for answers and I found out that was completely normal and it was 100% functional. Within 20 minutes Holy Stone customer service contacted me asking for more details of the issue but I already found out online that there was never a problem. Holy Stone have a great product and a even better customer service. I would recommend Holy Stone to anyone that is looking for a inexpensive drone with a great customer service to back up their products.

title: Great Drone Not Updated
text: Originally I had given this a 5 stars.  But after two destroyed drones I can't give 5 stars anymore.  I think there is some calibration issues with this drones.  First drone crash trying to land.  The stick un the down position and the drone fight to go back in the air even after holding the stick way longer than needed to land.  the drone flipped sideways tumbling until one of the legs broke.  Even after pressing the lock button blade keep moving had to grab with bare hand to shut off.  off course relieved several cuts.  Even after all that I decided to give this same drone a second chance and got it exchange for new one maybe it was user error.  At beginning no issues. It was doing great very steady take off landings.  great pictures and videos even took a video of our house that we are selling.  Until yesterday Took off after 5 second in the air it start moving on it own turning left and away.  I released the sticks and still keep doing it try to turn the other way and still.  Nearly missed a kid, vehicle until did a full 360 and hit my vehicle.  Keep in mind it was a very open area.  Kid and other vehicle were quite far.  I decided to return it and getting A DJI air 2.

title: Very Stable Drone

title: Terrible! Stay away!!
text: We couldn’t make it move forward. Theb had to read online about beginner mode needing turned off. We turned it off and all was good for a few minutes …….Then  out of nowhere it shot straight up into a tree like 100 feet up and then fell to the ground and broke. We didn’t even hit the joystick!

title: good step up drone
text:
I started with an HS110 to see if flying a drone was a hobby I could get into. That was a good little drone but with no return home feature that I knew of...it can get dicey if it gets high up in the air. It would also go off on its own at times as the calibration was hit or miss.

So I decided to take the next step to the 720. It took a second as the 1st drone I got was faulty. The right rear arm was too tight at the joint and when I pulled to open it up ...the plastic just snapped.

Ordered drone #2...faulty camera. Was broken upon opening.

Drone 3 came. Finally got to test this thing out on a cold ...very windy day. I was blown away. So much fun. The calibration is great. The drone will hover in place very well. The camera took quality pics even though I hadn't fully figured out its max capabilities. Now I have and it's even better. The thing really cut through the wind. The return home feature was tested 6 or 7 times...and boom....came right back. For a new drone pilot this feature really saves the day in high altitude situations.

I'm super happy with this upgrade. Credit to Amazon and its return policy. While I was frustrated by getting the first 2 damaged...they make it super easy to return and get another unit.

title: Remote for Drone did not work
text:
I guess it be like that... should have trusted the negative reviews.

I brought this drone and it did not even work.
Followed the instructions for Pairing [9.3 Pairing] and it just fails miserably.

I later than tried just sliding on the power to the right for the controller but the screen still failed to light up.

All in all, I couldn't even fly this thing.
I don't even know how I should write a review for a product that does not work as intended... afterall, this drone did not work.

I couldn't even pair it up with the drone.
My phone did pair up with the drone wifi and I was able to use the camera, but that's just me holding it up.

The drone never flew and that's just sad for a company to push out products that does not work.

The biggest worry when I brought this was me crashing it... now its appears to be in fact:

The drone controller not even being on as is it broken. Just utterly disappointed...

It’s as if they placed a knock off camera in a decent drone and claimed the video was 2k. My phone tossed I. The air takes smoother video and better quality. Place a better, clearer camera in this drone, and it can easily compete with the $1,000 dollar drones. As it is now, my sons $30 drone takes the same footage.

title: 5 Star Customer Service!
text: First thing I would like to say before I tell the story behind the picture is that this drone absolutely blew me away! From the camera to it's flying performance, everything worked great!! Now to the story. I purchased this drone for my cinematography/photography business that just started a few weeks ago with our first client and we needed a drone to get the shots. I did my research and went with the Holy Stone HS730 because it had everything I needed for a way better price than the competition! Now I'm not a professional drone pilot by any means but I know my way around them enough to be a self sufficient flier. I also know that to get better you have to practice, so I like to take my new R/C's to the parking lot behind my house. Since school is out here it is always empty, making it the perfect place to get some drone time in without driving 20 minutes to the nearest flyable area. Like I said before, this drone worked perfectly! Easy to pair with my phone and link up to the satellites. In less than 2 minutes we were flying, unfortunately the local birds did not appreciate my practice time and attacked the drone as I was about 30 feet up in the air. One of the birds connected square with the tail end of the drone pitching it 90° straight up causing it to dive straight down to the ground... I could not believe it... Less than 3 days after receiving it, it was destroyed. I reached out to Holy Stone, sending images of the damage knowing it would be difficult to fix. I was not surprised when the Rep told me it was not repairable, so I filled out a warranty form and before I knew it, a replacement was on its way!! Today when I arrived home from work, there it was! Less than 3 days after I contacted Holy Stone, they had me my replacement!! I cannot express my gratitude enough for this!

title: Great beginner drone
text:
This was the family's first Drone experience. It proved to be a good one. This was a great value when comparing its feature set to other drones in the price range. It feels well made, is easy to setup and comes in a great package.

There are just a few areas that I would like to see improved. The charger is a bit lacking and doesn't make a very sturdy connection to the batteries. A quick search on Thingiverse and a 3D print later, I have a better made docking setup using the existing hardware. While on that website, I also printed a few propeller guards that snap on and fit in the included case. On the positive side, this drone seems to be picking up in popularity so there are many of these custom models and accessories for it.

Battery life is great. I get about 21 - 23 minutes of flight time per battery, however, they do take about 5 hours to charge each. This has been a little troublesome as we are still trying to practice with the drone and it limits our usage, but it isn't a deal breaker in the least. Eventually, I'm sure I will be purchasing an additional battery.

Overall, I would recommend this drone to beginners or those who are looking for a very fun to fly, small and accessible drone that's easy to grab and valued at the right price to keep it a comfortable and relatively stress free process.

title: Awesome drone for expert and beginners
text:
Just bought the Hs720e cause it has a lot of good reviews, I was skeptical about it but I was shock about the build quality. It feels premium and heavier than I expected, looks very solid and legit. Great beginner drone that has an easy remote that connects to phone easily. It’s takes great video and photos, actually the first time seeing the roof of my house. Can’t wait to use it on the beach or the 4th of July to see some fireworks up the sky level.

I also love the return home feature, it gives me confident that it will not fly away and get loss. It is fun to play with and is way more powerful and capable than any other beginner drone. I highly recommend this drone for experience drone pilot and beginners.

title: DO NOT BUY GPS WONT CONNECT
text:
Don’t waste the money on this product, this drone requires 7 satellites to connect to take off, I drove around an area of over 100 miles and only found one spot where it would take off.

I then later returned to that spot after charging the batteries and guess what? No GPS signal so I can’t fly it anymore. I kept looking for new locations, in the city, out of the city in the country, absolutely everywhere and I got no GPS signal, it uses your phone to do this right? But guess what, my phone had perfect GPS connection I was able to get a 12 digit grid coordinate via MGRS. Dont waste your money on it, it’s cheaply made controller is trash as well looks like it could break just with changing the batteries.

title: Great step-up drone (before investing $$$)
text:
<Disclaimer> You need to understand that it is $300-drone! I.e. you get what you pay for </Disclamer>
The reason I’ve got HS720e is that I wanted fully functional drone that I can use for learning to fly (yes, I am a newbie) and didn’t want to invest a lot. Now it is a second week of my experiments – I am very happy with my decision. Here are highlights.

Good:
- Remote is fine - I feel that I am in control, sticks/buttons are responsive.
- Sony sensor is just plain great - the image quality (both photo and video) are way better than you could expect from this price range. Plus extras: manual ISO and balance of white (if needed).
- Drone is heavy enough (~ 1 pound) to withstand real winds. I’ve been flying it around 300 ft above the ground with 10 mph winds (gusts up to 16mph) and it was perfectly controllable
- “Return to home” lands within 2 feet from the starting point (couple of times even less), so I am feeling safe about running out of power
- GPS hold works fine (good thing it knows about both GPS and GLONASS)
- Battery life is reasonable (btw, thanks for the second battery!) – I am definitely getting above 20 minutes of flight time.
- Optical stabilization definitely helps (good touch – lights on the bottom!)

Bad:
- Beware of 5-7 hours of battery charging – just place batteries after the flight to the charger overnight, so next day you would have them full.
- The process of loading maps to the app is not clear enough, but I was able to figure out: start the app without connecting to drone WiFi and wait a bit – maps would be loaded eventually (at least that’s what happened in my case – Android, LG).
- No blade guards available to add – so you need to be careful with grass/leaves (and fingers 😊 ). I kind of solved this problem with landing pad, but still if you land on the lawn you better check blades.

Now let’s talk about competitors… The biggest pain-point of HS720e is that it doesn’t have gimbal (only electronic image stabilization). But the models WITH gimbal are either too light (DJI Mini is 250g!) or you need to add at least extra $200 (Hubsan Zino Pro). I decided to save some money and eventually get something of the Air2/Anafi/Evo (in all cases complete package is about $1k) – but before that HS720E feels like a great starting point: I am not THAT afraid of potentially crushing it into the tree. Also it gives me a change to understand whether the whole drone piloting is for me (lots of details: FAA registration, LAANC requests, fly/no-fly zones etc).

Summary: I hope that this work-horse will live long enough that eventually I can give it to my kids and step up to something more advance.

P.s. I didn’t try to fly this drone indoors – I think that weight category is for outdoors-only.

title: Great drone and great customer service!
text:
I got this drone for Christmas and instantly fell in love with it. I flew it a few times and the controller got a little stuck when I was looking up at the drone. It then went careening into a tree very fast and broke an arm. I asked holy stone’s customer service if they would send my a new arm and controller since the knob was a little sticky and they sent a whole new drone!

The knobs on the new drone aren’t sticky at all and the drone flies great. It’s perfect for a beginner like me because the controls are so easy. I love the return to home button too. The customer service people were awesome and very fast with their responses.

I fly this drone any time I get a chance. The video quality is great (make sure you have a micro sd card) as well as picture quality. We had a big storm a few weeks back and I wanted to check my roof so I fired up the drone and flew it right above my house to check out the tiles.

I love this drone and would recommend it to anyone wanting to get one!

title: My replacement is working good I gave the drone a chance
text: Hi this is an updated review to my previous about this drone... The first one had some issues I returned it for a replacement the second one is good so far I will keep you posted

title: Worked awesome...for a while.
text: I received this drone as a Christmas gift.  It worked awesome for a while and I was very satisfied.  It has 288 minutes flight time..  Until a couple days ago.  I took it out to fly, and went through all the pre flight calibration. When I launched it it took off almost straight up and then away.  All controls were completely unresponsive. It was completely out of sight and hearing..then I heard it coming back. I could finally get it to at least start decending. I couldn't get it to land but it was fairly close to the ground I pushed the emergency cut off, but it didn't respond.  The drone finally crashed into a tree and landed upside down still running.  I  pulled the battery out to kill it.  I  put fresh props on it,  put in a fresh battery in the drone and changed the battery in the controller.  Again did preflight calibration. I started the drone,  pushed the launch button.  It rose to about 5 ft and hovered.  I pushed the up stick and forward.  The drone went up then backwards hit the roof of a house  bounced off into the woods hitting a tree and crashing to the ground.  Nothing I could do with the controller made a difference.  This time one of the arms broke along with the bracket on the body.  Now I'm looking for another drone...but not another of these.

title: Camera Quality and FPV distance lacking.
text:
Bought this as a starter drone for myself to get into the hobby. Controller works fine but does feel a little cheap. Phone holder can be iffy with larger sized phones but it stays put once in. Drone is automatically set to "beginner mode" in settings and I didn't see anywhere that said this previously so I was going to return it because it was flying like crap but once I turned it to regular it flies just fine.

All that being said, there are 3 issues I have.

1) The battery charger seems to only work when 1 battery is plugged in at a time. Plugging in both causes an issue where it cycles between which it wants to charge. Really not that big of a deal.

2) There is no way in hell this drone gets 1,640 feet away from me. I start getting framerate drops and losing reception to the cell phone at maybe 600 feet. This is a HUGE problem because all you really get this way is a high up view of your surroundings and can't go anywhere else.

3) To call the camera 4K is an overstatement. The pictures look good if you're not paying too much attention or if you don't zoom in. But I've taken many many pictures now with this and none of them are anywhere close to 4K. See attached.

All in all it's not a bad drone. It's great for learning. The calibration is a bit of a pain but it's fine. However, don't expect to fly this thing out of your neighborhood or take any professional quality pictures with it.

7/10. (5 star rating systems make it difficult to truly judge)

title: Impressive compact feature rich drone
text:
Received for Christmas. Three flying days so far and very impressed. Assuming the electronics are reliable and the drone operates without problems, this will be one of my favorite purchases of 2020. Excited to fly more.

Pros: price, complete package, flight time (comes with two batteries - 23 mins flight time per battery), compact with folding rotors, great carrying case, resolution, feature rich with accompanying app (used iOS version); excellent user manual

Cons: takes 5 hours to charge each battery; battery to charger interface/connection needs improvement - recommend a larger cradle with more positive/locking connection; handheld controller battery compartment difficult to open;

title: Gate way drone
text: Got this drone as a gift. Opened my eyes to a new level of video photography. Man is this drone amazing. I now have 2 other drones and I cherish them all for showing me the world in a whole nother level. Thanks holy stone

title: It's a great drone for a novice like me.
text: I took it out and couldn't connect to the app. I flew it anyway with no problems. Called Holystone's customer service when I got home and the gentleman was able to resolve my issue quickly. Can't wait to try it with the addition of my smart phone. Great product and customer service. Highly recommended.

title: One battery is defective
text: Had problems with one battery but Holystone was quick to help me out with my issue. Very fast response and outstanding customer service. They stand behind their product to satisfy their customers. I am enjoying my drone all the time. Thanks Fiona for your help and services!!!

title: Great product.
text: I watched a lot of YouTube videos before I purchased this drone as my first drone. From the moment I opened the case I was impressed with the quality not to mention an extra battery. I followed the instructions to get it ready for the first flight which was super easy. I would recommend to Holy Stone HS720E to anyone that would to try it for their first drone. Well done Holy Stone.

title: Holy Stone Does stand behind their product!
text:
Holy Stone contacted me after my intial review, and quickly sent a replacement for the defective drone. I haven't had alot of time to test it yet. But I can say that it definitely works much better than the original, and it did include the manual which was very helpful. The problem connecting with my phone was likely due to using the wrong app, make sure to use the "Ophelia Go" app.

My initial flight with the new drone was good. I have a Mavic Mini also, and HS720E definitely is faster, and oddly even seems a little bit quieter. I would say the camera is at least as good, but lacks the stability part because it is not Gimbal mounted.

I will post a more comprehensive review when I have had some more flight time, but I would like to thank Holy Stone for standing behind their product!

Original Review:
Very disappoint with this drone, it has some great features for the price, and several good Youtube reviews. First the drone came with no directions of any kind. Even after watching Youtube videos I could not get the app to link up with the drone (Gallaxy S10). Reviews on the App indicate that this is a common problem.

Decided to try to fly with it with the remote, and come back to the issues with the App. Would not hold position or altitude. Tried two land it on a table, but the rotors wouldn't stop. Slid across the table, hit edge, and crashed to the ground. The rotors still would not stop, it was literally cutting my grass! Tried to grab it and got several small cuts from the rotors, holding down the power button wouldn't even shut it off. Finally pulled the battery.

Tried flying it again (from a distance), after about a minute of fighting to keep it in position it started drifting to the left and could not be corrected. Crashed into a bush, and to the ground. After about thirty seconds of thrashing around on the ground the rotors finally stopped. Sending it back!

title: Compares favorably againt the  DJ Mavic Mini
text: We have a DJ Mavic Mini already and it is great. We wanted to get 2nd drone but didn't want to spend as much money. I found the Holy Stone HS720E and it appears to have most of the features the DJ Mavic Mini at a lower price. We received the drone and it is awesome! I like it just as much at the Mini. I also did call customer support and they answered the phone immediately and were extremely helpful.

title: Excellent drone for the money.
text:
Just arrived today so after charging up the batteries I decided to take it for a spin after going through the remote pairing, calibration process and making sure I had a good GPS lock. After pressing the automatic take off button and with no input from me the drone rose up about 3 feet and made a hard left flying across the yard and crashing in to the side of my house :(

I retrieved the drone and it only sustained minor damage to one of the props so I went through the calibration process again and this time it flew as expected and I spent the next 20 minutes flying around the yard taking pictures and video of the new roof they are putting on my house.

I am extremely satisfied with the quality of the pictures and video that get stored on the microSD card (sold seperately) and the image stabilization works very well, these are the best images I have ever captured.

My only issue so far is with the Ophelia GO app for my phone, it does not seem to save the images in any of the usual locations (DCIM or Photos) so I am having trouble viewing them outside of the app itself.

Overall I am very happy with my purchase.

title: Quality camera drone
text: Nice budget camera drone. Overall the drone is well built and easy to fly. The camera takes really good photos and video. Each battery lasts around 20 minutes. I'm using it to practice aerial photography and cinematography before moving to a more expensive drone.

title: Great Company and Customer service
text: Bought a month ago, seems to be easy to fly and learn, had an issue with my drone and called Customer Service, they were very kind and willing to help. They ended up sending me a new drone. It’s been a long time since I’ve had good customer service. I was expecting a typical call center and that’s not how it was at all.

title: Great customer service
text: Great customer service a quick email and a very response solved my issues and they offered a free battery as part of their customer satisfaction program. Very pleased with the product and their service.

title: Holystone HS720E
text: I’m a first time drone owner, I did a lot a research and watch a lot of YouTube videos on what’s a good drone for beginners. I chose the holystone hs720e. There where a lot of good reviews on this drone, the first time flying it I crashed it twice both the only damage was a chip off one of the blades seems to be a pretty durable product so far. After flying it a bit you get use to the controls pretty easily, I was really surprised by the image quality of the camera and that there really isn’t much shaking do to not having a gimbal on it. I would really recommend buying this drone, I will be buying another drone from Holystone in the feature.

title: Fun!
text: Patients. Fly outside under GPS or in a large indoor area with level floors (no furniture). Learn to fly first before using the good camera. I would recommend.

title: Easy for Beginners
text:
[[VIDEOID:2825fa46d793f1bbf27503c248e3b27a]] Well Unfortunately I have to update my review.
after trying the drone out on my project, I decided to take it out to my property and get some aero footage. I set up take off and landing area, went through the normal setup for the drone and started my flights. The first was less than a couple minute just went up tested controls started the drone in an automatic circle flight and landed. Next I was ready to start shooting I had my flight planed out so I could get the shots and video I wanted. I pressed the take off button the drone lifted up to about 4 feet and then just took off sideways. I was unable to control the drone at all, but still had video feed and was able to find the drone upside down in the dirt road with the props still turning. I was able to shut it down pick it up and check for damages none to be found. Thinking this may have just been a glitch with the GPS or something I went a head and set up for another test flight. This time I double check that I still had the 18 satellites found displayed on the controller I started the drone and lifted off and immediately the drone took of out of control again. I retrieved the drone cleaned it up yet again making sure to wipe off all the sensors and the camera lens I ran one more test watching the signal indicator on the controller and after seeing it shown full signal I took flight again with the same out of control experience. I am currently waiting on a response back from US.HOLYSTONE now to see if there is a resolve for this issue. Unfortunately, at this time I would suggest more research be done before purchasing this drone.

I build commercial buildings and always wanted a drone for those pictures I cant take. I found the 720 here of Amazon and figured i would take a chance since i can return it if its not what I wanted. what I found however was a Drone that from the moment i unpacked it was super easy to set up and start flying. if you are able to see my short video you will see my very first test flight. I have never operated a drone of any kind, and the video I was able to produce was super clear, and stable. this drone has a GPS function that will help you while flying outdoors, but I want pictures inside the building where GPS has to be turned off. As a first time drone operator and the use of the simple to follow instructions that come with the drone I was up in the air shooting video within 10 mins of unboxing. I would highly suggest this drone to anyone who is thinking about getting one. Thanks for the drone Holy Stone, and Amazon.

title: My husband loves his HS720E drone

title: Possessed
text:
I bought this drone in January of 2021. I was very impressed with the ease of use and learning to fly a drone. I've only used this drone a handful of times. It is now September of 2021 and maybe my 5th or 6th time using it. I started it up and collaborated the drone. The second I lift off, the drone took off on its own and crashed into a tree. I tried shutting it off and it wouldn't shut down. I tried landing it and it wouldn't follow any director the controller. It finally came out of it and I ew it around for one battery time (about 15 minutes). I changed out the battery and started the drone up again. The second tye drone lifted off it took off on its own again and crashed into the side of the house and broke one of the arms. I will not be buying this product again if it will just try and fly by itself and crash into everything. Not impressed and now I'm out a couple hundred bucks because I bought extra batteries and propellers.

***UPDATE***
I contacted customer support to simply notify them of the issue that I had and the outcome. They asked a few questions and made some recommendations and they sent me a replacement. So far the replacement drone has worked really well. I did upgrade my review because of the great customer service.

title: This little drone can compete with the big ones
text: I bought this drone from a recommendation, It does everything that it claims. I've tested all the features and they perform flawlessly in a verity of conditions. The Return function is spot on within inches of the takeoff point. I've flown it in winds that I'm sure exceed the manufactures recommendations and again it holds altitude and track about perfect, with minimal impact on battery life. The "follow me" works well even if you run from it, the only issue is you can get it a little confused on with way to face the camera if you try hard enough but it sorts it out quick enough. The track feature where you draw on the map works quite well, the only thing I wish was different is you could have it not pause at each point but just fly straight through (maybe i missed it in the settings) Most importantly the auto return if you fly it out of range functions as it should every time, it is nearly impossible to lose this little guy so it would be suitable for kids or beginners.  The only negative I have for this little guy is that the camera is only 4k at 30fps, and the 4K image quality of the photos leaves a bit to be desired, that said at the price it is a small negative since it is not marketed as something for professional video.... If you are thinking of buying it you won't be disappointed.

title: This drone is okay
text: [[VIDEOID:d22ab75016013784fb8fdde6d905f48]] I am not new to drones. If you were a beginner I can see were someone might think this Holy stone HS720E is good. The range on this drone is poor. Looses fpv feed and even the radio signal at only 100 meters or less away even in an open field. The follow me and circle me features are really bad. It struggles to hold a solid hover in front of you. The camera is ok if the drone is not moving. Most images have a fish bowl look to them most of the time. The camera tilt is not proportional. Videos are just choppy unless going straight or up and down slowly. The video I attached was one of the better ones. Charging batteries takes forever like 5 hours each and only charges one at a time. So enough ragging on it heres what I liked.....The case is very nice! Drone looks and feels good. Flys normal with no issues. I just never really trust it like Im just waiting for something bad to happen. I know the price seems good but im returning it and going for a DJI mini 2. I have had a couple DJI drones in the past and they were both rock solid!

Stability was actually, in my opinion, pretty good, even on a windy day. It's not difficult to operate, just takes a little time to get use to it like anything else. It's worth the price and the sky 's the limit. Buy extra ion batteries for more hourly fun.

text: I was very pleased with the HS720E! You can tell they put a lot of effort into it. You not only get the Drone but you also get two batteries, a charger and a very durable carrying case. I highly recommend it and plan to purchase more drones from this company. Also their customer service is top of the line. They are very friendly and will help make you satisfied! So if your new to drone, I suggest you try this one!

What's special about it is it's superb range. easily flew to over 330ft.H and 375ft.D without once losing signal. Camera is great for 4k video, nice and stable video with a smooth camera tilt. title: Good

title: Not one, but TWO broken drones
text:
After spending several days searching for a decent drone in the $300 price range to be my first drone I determined this was the one for me. Upon arriving I was already set and ready to go with the Ophelia GO app downloaded on my Samsung S8+ and a SanDisk Extreme C10 SD card (since the reviews said that was the only way to get 4k photos and 1080p videos.

After unboxing it everything looked and worked flawlessly, or so I thought. I inserted the SD card. I paired the device to the controller and then to my phone. I calibrated the compass and the gyros. Then I took off for the maiden flight and was thoroughly impressed with how it handled and the range of the drone. I managed about 10 minutes of flight time right out of the box before needing to start the 5 - 7 hour recharge time. I tested all the features and found they too worked great, and then brought it in to land without a single issue.

So, up to this point you are probably wondering why I am giving a bad rating. "You say everything works great?"...Yes, however this drone is advertised to do 4k photo and 2k video. I go to the SD card folder and find...nothing. However some 720p video is saved to my phone and 1080p photos are saved...again...to my phone. I take the SD card out and put it in my computer and find a still blank SD card. So now I have 10 minutes-ish of poor quality video.

I assume I did something wrong so the next day I continue to tinker. I attempt to find settings (there are hardly any). I fly the drone with no phone connection and use the controller to film and video with the SD card inserted. Still to no avail I the drone will not write to the SD card.

Once I exhausted all the troubleshooting I could think of. I purchase a 2nd drone (SG906 MAX - works perfectly and writes to my SD card btw) and then contact Holy Stone customer support. On the phone I am greeted with somebody who is VERY hard to understand and I go back and forth for about 20 minutes when I am offered a SD card from Holy Stone to try and fix the issue....2 hours later I get a call back saying they can't do that. I then send an email an go back and for for several days when it is determined the SD slot is bad I am told to return it with Amazon. I returned it and waited for the replacement. I received the replacement and it is literally a repeat of the above. I contact support again, and then go through the same run around.

I cannot recommend this drone or this company to anybody looking for a drone that films with any decent quality. I know people have achieved 2k footage, but I have attempted 2 of these drones over multiple days and have not cracked the code other than this being a subpar device.

Go with the SG906 MAX instead.

title: Awesome Drone For Beginners
text: The Holy Stone 720E is the first drone I have owned. The thing I liked about Holy Stone 720E is the quality of the drone it really appears solidly made. The transmitter operates with two 1.5 AA batteries. I like the fact you can recharge the flight battery via USB. It is extremely stable. I was flying on a windy day and you would never know it as it hovered about 100 feet up. The FPV picture is also very stable with the EIS feature. Battery life is more than adequate, I am getting about 30 minutes per flight. This is a great product and I highly recommend it.

title: Great option for drone so far

title: Great price, really fun, and exceptional customer service.
text:
This is my second Holy Stone product and it does not disappoint! The picture quality is great and with the anti-shake technology they have added, it is also extremely stable. At this price point I wasn't sure of the quality/accuracy of many of the features would be (return to home, image stabilization, "follow-me", etc.), but am extremely pleased!

Setup is very simple (i.e. pairing to the controller, linking with the app, calibrating gyros, etc.). The drone comes with a very helpful users manual and there are countless "how to" and product review videos on line that you can reference.

Furthermore, I have had an exceptional experience with the Holy Stone customer service team. They have worked with me over the phone and email to troubleshoot and resolve any issues and have been extremely responsive. I can not thank them enough!!

title: Great Drone
text:
The only problem I had was getting the Wi-Fi to work so I could see video on my Android phone.
Go to settings on your phone and turn off mobile data. Ophelia go works everytime.

title: Impressive stability!
text: I was a little worried this drone would not be very fast since it is geared for stable video, but there is nothing to worry about, it is fast and fun, but not Cinewhoop fast and fun.  Slow speed is slow but works awesome for near flawless video, and still very nice video stability on fast speed.  Easy enough for my 11 year old son to pick up and fly by himself without me worrying he will crash or lose it.  GPS holds very well even in windy weather and the return to home is a useful feature especially when the battery gets low.  Sd card can be formatted from within the app, which is nice since Windows 10 no longer easily formats fat32.  Only cons so far are the camera focus and quality go down with light like cell phone cameras and the charger needs a redo but it works well if it can be left alone.  Overall it is a good value and build quality is very good.

title: Great first drone
text: I received my Holy Stone HS720E the same day I ordered it. Packing was great and the instructions were easy to follow. We have had a blast with this, and my flying is getting better every day! It is an incredibly well built system. The drone, controller, batteries and accessories are all high quality and they come with a sturdy weather resistant rubberized case that neatly fits all of the components. Setup was easy and after watching a couple videos online, I was in the air. The drone is stable in flight and has high capabilities to ensure safety for the drone and surroundings.

The camera pivots 90 degrees vertically and is exceptional especially with its stabilizing capabilities.. Absolutely perfect for beginners, moderate and experienced drone pilots.

I have also had some communication with the manufacturer and they have been nothing short of amazing. Quick responses and answered my question in detail.

Like I said, I was blown away from the start!

title: Awesome Drone
text: Great product, I have other drones but this HS720 E stands up to its name. This drone is easy to fly easy to set up and for the price it compares very well to some of the more expensive drones. If you’re looking for a good quality drone without a hefty price tag the HS720 is the way to go.

title: Best budget drone on the market.
text: So far it's really well built. Exceeded my expectations. The camera is amazing, and as always holy stone has come through.

title: Spend a little more for a DJI or Hubsan
text:
Bought this based on reviews here and YT. This is my 3rd quadcopter and, unfortunately I am not impressed. The drone has a very nice case and the build quality is on par with more moderately priced quads. It acquires sufficient gps signal in a timely manner, but the one I received toilet bowls after compas calibration and requires a second calibration to stabilize. It has flown off without input twice. Luckily,
I was able to chase it down while frantically moving the sticks to recover signal. The follow me mode is not a good feature due to the camera not being gimbal stabilized. The EIS works well for unaccelerated flight, but it pitches on its lateral axis when accelerating or deceleration, causing the camera to point up or down. The quality of the video is pretty good, but must be edited to achieve anything smooth. I have tried 2 android phones (a32 5g and s20 fe 5g) and the wifi transmission is very poor. Within 30 to 50 feet, the signal usually freezes and will return briefly. I believe the farthest I've had a decent signal has been about 200 feet. This is unacceptable for a 300+ dollar drone. I've flown it in unobstructed areas without buildings and powerlines as well as in my yard with neighboring wifi signals and both are about the same. I'm hoping it's the ophelia app and an update will fix the mind of its own and crappy wifi. I really want to like this drone, but I'm afraid that every time it gets flown will be the last.

title: Awesome, affordable, easy to fly
text: I am new to flying a drone and thought this would be an "ok" drone for the price. What I got however is an awesome easy to fly GREAT drone. I am amazed at how we'll it hovers and at how easy it was to máster. It has everything I wanted and an awesome camera. I love it!!

title: Flying within an hour
text: I received my Holy Stone 720e drone promptly from Amazon. I unboxed it, read the clear directions and was flying within an hour. The WIFI link to my iPhone 8 was quick, easy and efficient. The Ophelia Go app for my phone was very intuitive to use and required almost no reading of directions to operate. The GPS connection to the drone made for a very stable maiden flight and many flights thereafter. The video and photo quality was comparable to higher priced drones. I was amazed at the image clarity and stability provided by the software. Lastly, I had some basic operational questions and the Holy Stone Support Team answered them by email in the same day on every occasion. For the price point of this product, it is an absolute bargain. I would recommend this drone to anyone without hesitation. I hope you all enjoy flying it as much as I have.

title: Features, Customer Service
text:
I have been flying this drone for about three months now and have not had any issues. As I mentioned in another review, this drone had the features you would find in more expensive drones. That being said, for some reason, the drone lost connection and crashed into a tree. I reached out to Holy stone and they offered to send me the replacement parts for free. I That's something you do not see every day from other company. I highly recommend Holy Stone.

Update:

This drone eventually crash for no reason. This is a known problem with Holy Stone drones. They are known for "toilet bowling" and not responding to commands from the transmitter. Holy stone will send you replacement parts, but they will bribe you for good reviews in exchange of those free parts. That is unethical and unprofessional to say the least. I won't spend another dime on Holy Stone products.

title: The best one yet!!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:f7524180160186177f15dfcb6a77a306]] I received my 720E a couple of weeks ago and FINALLY (after weeks of rain) had a chance to take it out for a quick spin. If you look closely, you will actually see the rain drops. I was hoping to avoid. The weather has not been on my side during the times I have had time to fly this amazing drone. The point of my comment is that the camera is just so crisp you can see everything. The clarity of the camera is by far the best of all Holy Stone drones that I have purchased. It’s the most expensive HS drone I have purchased but sooooo worth it. The flight was smooth, simple to control, and steady as can be. In past, I have had times of nerves that I could lose control but not with this drone.

The drone is compact when folded. Comes in a nice carry case too. 2 batteries that give you plenty of flying time. Love the dual charger that allows you to charge both batteries simultaneously. The remote is great too. Feels great and the sticks are not flimsy like some other manufacturers products. The manual is not as easy to understand like some other Holy Stone drones, but easy enough to figure out.

I hope the weather is better for my next flight. I will post more videos and pictures. If you are reading my review, thank you. If you are looking for a nice, compact BRUSHLESS motor drone, if you don’t mind spending a few extra bucks over the others, I strongly recommend the 720E. From the moment you take it out of the box to the time you fly it for the first time, you will be so happy with your purchase. Way to go Holy Stone!!
