title: Uncontrollable disaster!!/great customer service
text:
I have had 3 drones. This drone was great while it lasted. Which for $350 buckets it should have lasted longer than 6 weeks. Bought it January 29, 2021. I have flown this drone no less than 30 times and loved everything about it. My wife and I went to Savannah last week, on my fourth flight at the camp ground for some reason which I assume was a failed motor it did a uncontrollable dive, hit the ground and broke up, broke an arm, cover, and camera broke off . It’s a shame because up to this point it was a joy to fly. I wouldn’t not recommend.

Update

Changing my rating from a one star to a four star. Holy Stone honored their 30 day warranty at 39 days. They even called to make sure I received the new drone. Great service.

Well another update, have flow the new drone 6 time with no issues. Today I was at my sons house in the country so I know there wasn’t any interference. Take the drone up to about 50 feet, the propellers just stopped. Drop like a rock. Don’t know what happened, no damage was done so I reset it, did another flight, same thing happened but this time it broke one of the arms and the camera.

This drone has issues. When it works it’s great, when it doesn’t, it breaks.

text: I just received the HS720E as an early Christmas gift. I've been playing with it for a couple of days, and I'm really impressed with the added features. title: Camera is great! Great beginner drone! Need more batteries!
text:
[[VIDEOID:6bbe5f471eae6525f006bf3756dc1138]] First of all, I looked for a long time at drones. I looked at many different brands, including and bigger name brand with 3 letters and I based my comparisons off of that. I wanted quality photo and video from the drone with the ability to move the camera on the remote. The 4k quality is good and the EIS helps with any jittering.

Not wanting to pay for....the bigger name drone.... This one is by far the best choice for a beginner that wants a quality camera without the price. The EIS is hard to find in cheaper drones and the ones that have it, have the price with it for a reason. The instructions for setup and calibration are easy to understand so long as you go step by step and not skip anything. Trying to rush will only result in the drone not taking off (my own beginners knowledge shining through).

The included case, two batteries, extra parts, and charger that will charge both batteries at the same time if left overnight are great additions for the cost. The case is hard plastic rubber construction. So it is sturdy enough to protect the drone, but not so much to be tossed around like hard case luggage. It is molded to keep items in place and the top lid holds all miscellaneous items. Even has room for a spare smartphone and charging brick for on the go traveling.

You WILL have to provide your own usb power adapter, SD card to be able to save anything at all and a landing pad if you plan on landing or taking off in semi tall grass. All these items are pretty inexpensive and worth it to buy on your own.

Connecting a phone (Galaxy S9+) was pretty simple, once I took off the case. Using the remote with phone was nice and not too overwhelming to hold. I recommend reading the instructions each time just to make sure you are getting a routine down as it does ask you to calibrate between each battery change or initial startup.

Pressing the return home button was surprising as it started to fly up, instead of down. I learned that it flies higher to get better signal and then comes back down. It will land within a 2ft radius of where it took off from. So landing on a landing pad will take some practice from the operator to correct the minor adjustments needed. I am pleased to learn that though.

My only gripe is the batteries charge slowly. I mean SLOWLY! 3-5 hours for one battery. Yes the charger holds two batteries, but charges one at a time. When one finishes the other will start.... Hence charge at night for less anxiety or go buy more batteries and another charger for more fun time!

I am still learning, but I wanted to post a review since I am starting to get used to it and I wanted to show a video and a few pictures, one taken by the drone and others of the drone itself. On my phone both the drone shots have great quality, hopefully Amazon doesn't skimp out on the upload.

Overall, it was worth waiting for the lightning deal to try this out.

title: Great beginner Drone
text: This is a great drone for someone just getting into the hobby.  First few flights were flawless.  I would definitely recommend this drone to anyone looking for an affordable drone that still has all the features of the more expensive drones on the market.

title: Somewhat true add
text: I love the drone but it only comes with one battery. You can write a “good” review they must approve and than they say they will send you a second. Saying it comes with two batteries it just not true. I’d love to get the 2nd battery If I could, it was a gift so no way to rewrite the review as it wasn’t from my account. Lastly, the range is about 350’ to 400’ at most before your picture drops out. The remote with allow you to push it beyond this but if you can’t see it I can’t see trusting that. The return to home works great, 100% of the time it’s come back. It’s true that it also comes back if the transmitter signal is lost, this happens about 98% of the time flying so I’m very happy that works. title: Outstanding Customer Service
text:
I purchased the HS720E from Amazon and absolutely love it! I am a very novice drone pilot and this Holy Stone drone is the perfect drone to start with for beginners. I do not consider myself a very technical person but I had no problem as the remote is very user friendly and easy to understand . I flew it for a few weeks and found it easy to fly. But I had a problem and the drone crashed high in a tree, fell to the ground from about 30 feet and broke a motor rotar arm. Such a bummer!
I emailed Holy Stone customer service and a representative named Sunny emailed me back right away. I explained my situation and what happened with the drone, both before and after I crashed it. Sunny was very helpful. He asked a lot of questions trying to understand my problem while offering me various solutions including sending replacement parts to self repair of the drone.
In the end, Holy Stone was able to take care of the entire problem and decided the best course of action was to replace the drone. I am so happy, thank you sooooo much Holy Stone!!! I was really happy learning to fly this drone and Sunny took care of me and now I am flying again! Woot-Woot!! Oh , and the picture and video quality of this drone is amazing. I use an iPhone 8+ And when the lighting is right the 4K quality is amazing. Thank you Holy Stone for this awesome drone. 10/10 would purchase again!

text: I had the drone for little over a year, I was using it and suddenly it stop working and felt from the heights, it broke. I called Holy Stone costumer services, they were very nice, and also mentioned that the one year warranty was expired. But as soon as I explained them what just happened, they opened a case and start making many questions and asked for pictures. In just a couple of days they told me that it seems the drone may had a problem with the board or something, so, they sent me a new drone, through Amazon, and told me that I did not have to return the other one. Now. I have the new drone, it is working perfect, and I just got a new email from them asking me if everything was ok with the new drone. GREAT COSTUMER SERVICE!!!

title: So far, so good!
text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my dad based on a recommendation from one of his friends. So far, he’s having a lot of fun with this drone. title: HS720E IS MY FIRST DRONE - DID A TON OF RESEARCH - VERY HAPPY WITH MY CHOICE!!
text:
I wanted a folding quadcopter camera drone that was compact enough to fit in a backpack. It had to take great photos and video, not just good. The market leader in the segment of compact folding quadcopter drone cameras is the DJI Mini2, but for my purposes, given what I wanted to be able to do with it, not having a 'follow-me' feature was a deal-breaker, especially considering the near $500 price after taxes. That's when I found that there were actually quite a few drones available in the "under $300" category. Of these, several received favorable reviews, but here's what sets the HS720E apart from the rest for me:

The HS720E has a 4K UHD camera. There are plenty of those available in this price range. Many of them take 4K photos, but only 2K or 1080p video. The HS720E does video at 4K(UHD) with 30 frames per second, or 1080p(HD) at 60fps, which will allow you to produce HD slow motion video if that's what you want.

Better camera drones mount the lens on a 2 or 3-axis gimbal to stabilize the image when the drone gets gets buffeted by wind. The HS720E camera uses Sony image sensors and has Electronic Image Stabilization. I've seen video recorded with cameras without Image Stabilization, and the difference in quality is night and day - the nominal cost difference to get this feature is definately worth it, and in my view, makes a mechanical gimbal assembly unnecessary, which eliminates a possible point of mechanical failure. I've read more than a few reviews of drone cameras with 2 and 3-way gimbal systems complaining that the gimbal is stuck at an odd angle, or that the entire assembly broke following a hard landing... no thank you!

To get that great resolution, you need the drone to save its' camera output to an onboard class 10 micro-SD card. Yes, the photos and video feed are also transmitted by wi-fi to the smartphone, but that's going to be at a reduced resolution. HolyStone has increased the microSD card capacity from 32Gb on their HS720 to 128Gb on the 720E. You would think that 32Gb is a ton of storage space, but those 4K video files get very large, very fast... another worthwhile improvement, and the additional cost to buy a 128Gb card instead of a 32 or 64Gb card is negligible.
Talking about the product's features is meaningless unless the features translate into real benefits. With the HS720E, the benefits - aside from how much fun it is to fly - are the absolutely stunning videos and still photos that I've been able to take with each flight. Are they as good as what you would get with a professional quality drone that would cost at least $1,500? Maybe not to an expert's eye - but they come pretty close, and are damned impressive considering the price of the HS720E.

As this is my first drone, I can't personally compare the flying experience with other drones. But - I've had the HS720E for almost a month now, and I've been really happy with its performance. I've tested each of the available features (follow-me, waypoints/tap-to-fly, etc.) and they all work perfectly. I've tested the transmission range and found it to be just as documented on the website and in the manual. The flying time on a fully charged battery is just as advertised. When the drone detects that the power level has dropped below 20%, it automatically enters return to home mode (RTH), climbing to a pre-set altitude to avoid any potential obstacles, returning to a point above where it took off from, and then descending to a smooth controlled landing, within a few feet of the take-off point, if not right on the spot. The same thing will happen if the drone loses its wi-fi connection with the remote control unit... but the drone can, and will resume the connection if, for instance, the operating range is exceeded and then reduced as the drone makes its way back to you - you can cancel the RTH function and resume flying with the remote conrol.

Finally, while there are several drones on the market with similar feature sets at around the same price point, HolyStone's customer service performance sets them apart. I read reviews for other drones where the users were grateful to receive an answer to their email within 24 hours... and that was the extent of their interaction with those companies. HolyStone has a toll free customer service / tech support phone line, a website with a chat function, and of course, email. They answer their emails within a couple of hours max - usually less, and if you just really need to have a back and forth conversation with a live human, well - I've made a couple of calls to their help line and have never even had to wait on hold before a live rep answers. This is important, because flying a drone can be tricky. Questions will come up... Hopefully problems won't occur... But in either case good customer service is priceless, and HolyStone definately checks that box. There's a bewildering number of choice out there, but after almost a month of experience with the HS720E, I am satisfied that I made the right choice.

title: Full-featured, stable, and fun to fly.  My first drone - and am not disappointed !
text:
I have had the Holy Stone HS720E drone for a year - my first drone. Before I flew it for the first time I made sure to carefully study the manual (well-written) and watched a number of YouTube videos about "getting started with the Holy Stone drone". It has been easy to use, fun to fly and responds well in winds. I have not yet tried the "follow me" or the pre plotted course features and have used it mostly for capturing views around our boat and shoreline views (we live in Southeast Alaska).
However - more importantly is the response and service from Holy Stone. I finally made a control mistake and flew the drone into a tree, much to my embarrassment and broke a left rear arm. In short, I worked directly with Holy Stone in Chino, California - specifically Cari - who walked me through the process for getting the drone repaired. Daily emails to check in and help, and if there was more than a delay lag on my end, there was an automated email just "checking in". Nothing but compliments for their service - and the drone is great !!
Final comment - since owning the Holy Stone, which was a gift - I've read reviews on other drones and other features. Price / features and performance of the Holy Stone make it a great buy that will not disappoint. Practice, practice, practice ...... and stay out of the trees.

title: The drone can fly but has issues with Wifi connectivity
text: The drone itself is really nice and the controls work really well. The problem I have with it is the wifi connection. Every time I try to connect to its wifi it would either disconnect right after take off or within 30-40 meters which means I can't use the camera features to take photos or videos. I find this to be the most important part in having a drone because I want to take pictures over 200 meters. I have seen many review videos that shows how well it can fly and record footage but for me I haven't had the best luck with it. I contacted support and they do give really good advice and are really helpful but nothing has changed on my side which include trying airplane mode, reinstalling Ophelia Go and M RC Pro apps, trying different mobile devices, and recalibrating the drone per flight. It may seem like a lot but it really isn't a long process. Its just very tedious in doing these tasks every time. I would still recommend this drone to all beginner flier who wants to try out a really good drone considering that I am one too, but just be aware of its functions. Not all drones are perfect but it definitely does the job to get experience before buying a more expensive one.

title: Great features for the price
text:
[[VIDEOID:8776b44d423e49fa995aae869cac4f84]] This is my frst drone and so far after 2 weeks of daily use I'd say it has been a great introduction to the hobby. As long as its not too windy the drone will take smooth, high quality videos and photos. Even on windy days the drone still gets some decent footage. For not having a gimbal the picture looks surprisingly nice.

I have also got some pretty good distance, my record so far is 1495ft away, according to the app's flight log. The return to home feature also works great. I can fly away as far as I want and when the remote control signal is lost the drone automatically comes back and lands where it took off from.

I'm definitely satisfied with this and plan to bring it on all my future trips and vacations. I'd definitely recommend it to others who are interested in getting their first camera drone too!

title: Great photography and videography Drone!
text:
First of all, this is not a toy. This is a legit photography/videography drone with great capabilities.

Ill review this with my standard pro/cons

Pros:

- Really easy to charge, setup and use. The batteries are charged with a standard USB-C cable, and they charge surprisingly quick

- The packaging that the drone comes in is phenomenal! The case can be used to take the drone and everything you need for it with you. This is a HUGE plus since my other professional photography drones (Mavic/Phantom) either come with a terrible case or no case at all.

- The form factor and material quality of the drone is what you would expect from a high end photography drone.

- The camera quality is really good, especially for its price.

- The App is really intuitive, and is really easy to setup

- The flight capabilities were really good

- It has a light that is really helpful at night

Overall, its a really good drone.

Cons:

- The Drone controller uses AA batteries. Its actually not a huge deal since we have high capacity rechargeable batteries. With that said, this is also helpful on long flights since I have had my other drone controllers run out of battery and you cant easily change those out.

- There are no front or side sensors - This is something that I got used to as a safety feature, but as long as you follow protocol and fly forward and away from objects you'll be fine. Thats the one thing that successful drone pilots have to master which is go forward. If you need to turn, dont go sideways, turn the direction until you see where you want to go and move forward.

- Range for my unit felt short (~ 1 mile), but the return to home and GPS features actually worked great when I tested the range. One thing I will stress is that you should not fly your drone out further than you can see it.

Overall, this drone is absolutely a bargain for the price. it has most of the features of the drones that are 3-4x its price in a package that just works well.

title: Good Drone, Not Great Charger
text:
This is my first drone and I'm still learning how to use it but it seems to be generally fine. I've put it into bushes twice while trying to use the follow me feature and haven't broken anything yet so it seems robust enough. I like the carrying case and how everything folds up compactly. One issue though is that the charging station is flimsy. The battery basically rests on the elements and it's quite easy to dislodge them. Haven't seen any arcing but I suppose that could happen and why it tells you not to charge on anything remotely flammable. I had originally thought I might charge them on the go and that isn't possible. Also have to shield it from the cat. Having a chamber like what is in the drone where you can snap the battery into place seems like a better design.

I'd like to be able to set the defaults lower than what is currently possible. 10 Ft max elevation would be fine for me right now. The mobile phone support board holder could be longer for me. My case is somewhat rounded so the support only reaches half way across the case and is somewhat precarious. I have a clasp on a tripod with the same issue so It's not something specific to this drone. I do have a belt clasp on the case that I think will attach so I will try that next time.

title: Excellent quality and performance. No reservations.
text:
After a few years away from drone tech, I got a HS510, which was a lot of fun, but soon left me feeling like I wanted a little more muscle.
I recently started with the HS720E, and after getting a feel for it, I really couldn't be more satisfied with the upgrade.
It was a natural transition with regard to control and function. The performance difference is amazing and puts me exactly where I feel like I'm at with my current skills, with plenty of room to progress.
I would caution that this is powerful and responsive device, and will allow you to fly outside of your comfort zone if that's what you do, intentionally or otherwise. That being said, the 720E is a pleasure to drive, and I get cranky if I don't get to put it in the air daily.
The drone body is substantial and very solidly constructed. Nothing flimsy about it whatsoever.
The remote be familiar familiar if you've used a Holy Stone device previously. The camera quality surprised me. The "E" is for electronic image stabilization I believe, and that bears out with rock solid stills and video.
I'm gonna stop running my mouth and go fly.

title: Amazing Camera!
text:
[[VIDEOID:8c7fe6d8462f120774ae9869acf8afd]] To start off this is by far the best drone Holy Stone makes. I currently own a HS700d which I love. I was looking to add something a little more compact and travel friendly. I decided to take the plunge and go for the HS720e and it has exceeded my expectations.

What I love:
- Rock Solid Camera. Holy Stone really hit it out of the park with their new electronic image stabilization. The photos are excellent and the video rivals stuff from more expensive drones. I feel like I am able to take videos that are similar to more expensive drones.
-The controller fits my big hands perfect. I felt comfortable flying for 45+ minutes. The display is easy to read and very user friendly.
- The smooth flying no matter what conditions. Even on slightly windy days the drone would stay at altitude and not move.
-The return to home feature worked perfect every time. Sometimes drone companies advertise this feature but then it doesn't work as designed.
-I really love the carrying case they supply with the drone. It is very compact and holds all your accessories very well. I felt that if i dropped the case my drone would be protected.
- Holy stone's app was very simple to use. With a view clicks I was ready to go. I also appreciate the feature where it tells you what stage your in during calibration

Things I disliked:
- I found almost no dislikes. My one complaint is the time to charge the battery. It really isn't much of a huge deal because this package comes with two batteries. I charge both batteries overnight while I sleep and by morning they are good to go.

I am very eager to keep exploring with the 720E. When I am done flying with my two batteries I always feel like I am ready to get back out there. I also let two of my friends fly who are both novices. They could not believe how simple it was to operate this drone.

Last but not least I feel the need to touch on how highly I think of HS Customer Service. They are literally available all the time to answer any questions I've had. It's nice knowing that the manufacturer is involved and always has your back.

title: Customer support is great

text:

title: Awesome
text: I have been registered with the FAA as a UAS owner since 2016 but have never actually owned a drone before buying this Holy Stone HS720E. I am sure it doesn't measure up to the multi-thousand dollar professional drones, but for what it is, I think it is awesome! I'll let others with more drone experience do the technical reviews, but for me it is two thumbs up.

title: Best Drone Available at This Price Point

I would highly recommend this product to anyone who would like to own a DJI Mini II but wants to save some $. The batteries are very loose when plugged in and it takes about 5 hrs to charge. On my second flight the drone took off on me and crashed into my neighbors garage door at high speed. I thought for sure I would find it in a heap, broken. To my surprise it was only scuffed in places. I even tried it again and this time, no problems. Whether it was user error or the drone/app, I don't know at this time. Looking forward to trying it again. title: Fun to fly. Stable
text:
I love this drone. It's a reliable GPS drone that I can trust when letting up on the sticks. It will drift on ya at times, so keep it away from obstacles. Trees and walls tend to suck this drone towards 'em, so don't do any precision flying. It's a sturdy flier that can take some wind due to it's heavy feel. It looks good hovering in front of you and is not very noisy. The EIS was the selling point for me, and you will get smoother videos without to much shaking. Hard stops will be very noticeable. The video quality? Well, I'm not thrilled, but it is better than most drones less than $400.

title: Great Drone with Good Features!
text: After researching some camera drones to try FPV, take pictures and videos, I decided to give this company a chance.  I did not want to spend a whole lot of money, but I believe this one makes a great drone to start off with.  It is easy to bind with your smartphone and controller, once you learn how to do it.  It is easy to control and the video feed is good.  The design looks really nice and the construction is really solid and durable.  As an example of its durability, the 2nd time that I took it out, it was flying normally for about 15 minutes and then all of a sudden it seemed to lose propulsion and dropped from about 4 feet into the hard cement ground.  At that moment, I thought the drone was done and would not function any more.  Upon inspection, it sustained some scratches on the top of the body and the props (surprisingly still intact, which I thought they were gonna snap since it hit the ground so hard!)  I rebinded it to the controller and my iphone and it still flew and the camera was still functional!  I just hope it continues to function properly, but so far so good.  Overall, I'm happy with this drone and I hope to take it out more and enjoy different locations from a bird's eye view!

title: Excellent drone for the money
text:
This is the first drone I ever purchased, and it was simple enough for me to learn how to fly it very quickly. This drone has a 4K camera as well as GPS, auto return to home, follow me mode, and waypoint mode.

Helpful specs from my usage:
Max range: 800 - 1000 feet (my typical experience)
Max height: 390 - 394 feet
Flight time: 18 minutes of regular flight, 3 more of low battery flight (21 total minutes, windy conditions)
Charging time: 5hr minimum, may be up to 7 at times if both the batteries are completely drained

You can anticipate getting at least 20 total minutes of flight time in normal flying conditions. It enters low battery mode at about 18 minutes and promptly returns to the proximity of its take-off point. It will want to auto-land immediately, however you can override it’s urge to land for about 3 minutes, at which point it will automatically land within 18 inches of its takeoff point. In low battery mode the drone reduces flight height to 98 feet and within 328 feet of its take-off point (home).

This drone is incredibly stable and can hover in winds of 30 to 35mph, which is truly surprising considering the price point of this drone. It’s maximum flight height is around 394 feet. Also, be aware that this drone can reach speeds of about 40mph so don’t fly it wide-open for more than a few seconds as it will immediately leave range of the controller. The drones functional control range is approximately 800 to 1000 feet under most flying conditions. If you are flying near buildings or dense tree coverage like forests, this range becomes reduced to about 350 feet. Also, the higher the wind speed the shorter the control distance. When I flew it in 35mph winds and nothing overhead my range was reduced to about 400 feet. It gains altitude quickly, approximately 30 seconds to reach its maximum elevation (390 to 394 feet). Descending back to the ground takes longer, about 1 minute. The only thing I would want to change about the drone is the charging time on the batteries, which is 5 to 7 hours. There is no noticeable difference in charging the batteries 1 at a time or as a pair. Also, I wanted to take a moment to mention the Holy Stone company. They are extremely helpful and can be reached by phone, email, or text message 24/7/365. They will immediately respond to you and will be eager to assist you in any way they can. I had lost my case and spare propellers and they offered to send me a new case if I needed one!

title: Drone flys erratically, no control whatsoever x 2 drones tried!!!
text:
I really wanted this drone to work. After flying it a bunch of times (maybe 20 times) and really getting the hang of the drone, one day I took it out, calibrated it, waited for 10+ GPS signals (like I always do), took off, it hovered then it just flew erratically into the side of my house and crashed. I returned the drone to Amazon and purchased another thinking it was just a glitch.

Second drove, I opened the box, charged up the batteries, connected the app/drone to my iPhone, calibrated to the remote control, waited again for 10+ GPS signal, took it off, maiden flight on this one out of the box, it hovered about 5 feet then started going into “point of interest” flight. I had to go up in altitude or it was going to go into trees and houses. I pressed the “return to home button” on the app and the controller, but it still did “orbit” flight while descending and not coming anywhere close to me. Kept orbiting and drifting northward, away from me. I had to change the controller mode from low to high and back to low, but finally was able to gain somewhat control for it to fly back to me and I successfully landed it in my driveway, not crashing into anything. I attempted 3 more flights, all of them taking off erratically, and I was prepared to immediately press the land button, only for it to land while drifting and having to press the land button again for the propellers to stop.

I am done with Holy Stone…time to spend a little more money and just get the Mavic Air 2. I really wanted to like this drone. So sad.

text:
I purchased the Holystone 720 and 720e for me and my 10 year old grandson. I’m a first time drone owner, the drones are very solid in flight and user friendly. My grandson learned very fast how to handle the drone and is equal if not better than me.

However on on flight I attempted to fly my drone without the GPS being engaged and learned it was a mistake. The drone struck a tree and broke the back left arm. I contact Holystone and talked to Donni who ordered me another arm with detailed instructions for repair. Holystone has great customer support for there customers.

Outstanding drones with great customer support!

title: Excellent warranty
text: Ive had this drone for almost a year.  The wifi went out on it and I couldn't connect to it.  I tried everything customer service recommended, but it still would not connect.  Sometimes it would see the wifi, but not be able to connect to it.  They finally decided to make it right and sent me out another drone to replace it.  This was a backup to my dji mavics so it's good to have this one back in the fleet.

title: Great buy with a lot of features
text: I have been looking for a beginners drone (reasonable price, enough aviation function and decent image capturing quality) to experiment.  I read several positive reviews about the Holy Stone HS720E GPS drone and it's on sale during the Amazon Prime Day sales so I took advantage of it.  Once I received the drone I can not wait to take it out and try it.  My first impression of the drone is that it is a well built drone with a good list of the functions- useful flight mode such as Follow me and Orbit flight.  It also equipped with 4K video quality and electronic stabilization imaging function.  Recently I took my newly purchased Holy Stone HS720E GPS model drone for a test flight I have a lot of fun doing that. The two batteries come with the bundle have combined ~56 minutes which is plenty to have some fun time.  I'm still testing other function and will return to update my review.  So far I am happy with the purchase and will continue to enjoy my drone flying experience.  Attached is an image I took with the drone over a farm field in about 15 meter height.

title: The both batteries dead after less than 10 minutes.
text:
The frame where to place the phone does not really fit.
After all everything is ok.

title: Great drone for a great price!
text:
Loved the stability of the drone right out of the box. EIS makes a big difference for the image and video quality. The low flight speed made the images glide giving quite a professional feel to the video without and jitters. The dual battery charger is a bit awkward to use - plan on overnight charging since it can take up to 5 hrs for each battery, and the dual charger only charges one at a time.
Highly recommend this drone!

Also wish that holystone provided a light weight video editing software with this, so at least a music overlay can be applied on top of the video.

I have larger hands, so I always seem to need to put screws into the center of the sticks to lengthen them. I've found this to give me better control but the remote itself is a bit small for my hands.

title: It was awesome until...
text:
Bought the HS720E approx. one month ago.
Due to all the rain and wind we have been having in my area, and my work hours, I have only gotten out and pushed the limits on it 5 times.
I read all the "crazy fly away" horror stories and make sure to follow all the recommended pre-flight checks.
Got the 2 battery deal so i got close to a good hour of flight time.
Everything ran fantastic!
The controls responded well, the RTH was only a foot or 2 off every time, the video (off the SD card) looked great.
I was showing off my vids and recommending to everyone as a drone that had great features at a minimal price.
Today was a nice day, minimal winds, took it to the max height, got some great video, hit RTH, it came right back as it has always and I thought I would just fly around a bit as I usually do to run down the batteries.
Flew it forward at about 20 ft of the ground AND THEN...........

Lost sight of it as it " blended in" with the trees I was flying towards but the video showed it was far from them video connection about 3/4 of the distance that I usually do, let off the controllers and hit RTH.

Waited a minute.

Nothing.

Tried RTH a few more times.

Nothing.

Started to walk toward were I was flying to try and regain a connection the the phone to see what the video was showing.

It was showing branches.

I started searching.

After an hour looking in the woods, some guys working at the park came up waving my drone at me saying " Is this what you are looking for?"

Hell yea!!! Where did you find it?!?!?!

They basically found it 30 yards to the right in a tree beeping from were I was looking and last saw the video cut out.

So basically when the video cut out, it went off on its own.

Took it back to were I was at and went to fly it again.

it acted like it did not want to take off, then it went off to the left, controls did not respond or the kill switch and then it crashed and had to pull the batter out to make it stop.

I change all the props and put a fully charged battery in it, when through all the pre-flight checks and the same thing.
No respond from the controller (battery level indicator showed full), kill switch did nothing, went where it wanted, I had to grab it in the air and pull the battery to make it stop.

So...
It was awesome until...

title: Major GPS issues!
text: First drone, received as a gift, crashed when it went out of control, started circling and crashed. It was replaced by Holy Stone under warranty. Followed all instructions, and watched the on-line videos carefully. Never flew with less than 12 satellites. The second drone showed the same GPS issues - without warning it would start flying in a gradually increasing clockwise circle until it crashed. Again contacted HS. They confirmed that the GPS unit was faulty, they said "damaged", and offerred to sell me a new one. There are many stories on internet platforms that describe this same malfunction. Would not recommend this drone.

title: Defective | Great Customer Service
text:
Calibrated the drone, got it up high in the air, maybe 30 feet, then I pressed the home button to get it to return and it b-lined right into a tree. I climbed up into the tree and got the drone out of it, only to find the wing broken. Understand user error is common, but I followed all of the directions and then this happened.

I contacted customer service two months following my purchase related to my issue. Customer service got back to me right away and fully refunded my drone purchase while issuing me a mini drone! Very pleased with how they responded.

title: HS720E - Excellent Done
text: Ok, so after viewing hours of drone videos on YouTube I picked the HS720E from Holy Stone. Be careful as there seem to be some sellers that will offer last years version HS720 NOT HS720E. Get the HS720E - Its worth the extra money.  I am new to done flying but have now flown this done for about 4 hours and it works just fine. The batteries last about 20 plus minutes and unfortunately, take some time to charge. I have (2) batteries they both will fully charge overnight and I plan to get 2 more batteries. The drone takes great 4K video and the photo's are amazing and you will not be disappointed. Using the app with your phone takes a little time to learn and you can fly the done without using the app and phone if you want. Overall, It's a great drone, easy to fly, and is a good price.

title: Excellent choice for beginners
text:
Drone: Very impressive! It has all the features that a beginner will need. These features made it very easy for a beginner to learn to fly. The quality of the drone is very good. In flight it is stable and accurate. The video quality is very good. The storage case is also very nice.

Controller: A typical controller for a beginner’s drone. Easy to learn and use.

App: Learning to use the App with my iPhone 11 Pro was straight forward. However, the text and icons font on the iPhone display is very small and difficult to read especially in bright sunlight.

Battery Charging: The charging system user interface is very sparse. You are unable to determine the exact charge condition of the batteries except for fully charged. The connection between the batteries and charger is not secure. I have to use rubber bands to help hold the batteries to the charger connection. A major issue is the charging time of 5 to 6 hours per battery, which can only be charged one at a time. The instructions tell you to be present while charging. With two batteries, this makes it very inconvenient to be present for 10 hours or more.

The package comes with two batteries, a very nice feature.

Documentation: The instruction manual for the drone and app is very sparse but adequate to get you in the air. I would like to have more details in the instructions. When I had a question, I called Holy Stone support and was very pleased with the support I received.

Summary: Overall, this is a great drone for a beginner. The features, stability, and quality are impressive. The charging system and sparse instructions are the only reason I’m not rating this drone five stars.

title: Flew away to never be seen again
text:
Received this drone as a gift. It worked the first 4-5 times I used it. I changed the battery and started having issues. The back left motor started acting up and it start having connection issues with the controller as well. The back rotor would not spin as fast as the others.

I charged and put the original battery back in and tried it again. It worked for a few minutes. Then it started going around in circles before it flew away. I lost the drone and the new 128gb SD card with my vacation photos.

Called Holy Stone CS and could barely understand the associate. He was less than helpful. I just wanted to know if I could track the drone by any other means. This was not my first Holy Stone drone, My other drone works great. But I expected better hardware at this price. A little empthy on the call would have prevented this review...

UPDATE: 10/27/2021
I called Holy Stone again. I was transferred to a manager named John. This call did not go well. He was very rude and condescending. I am very disappointed with this entire experience. I was going to contact the person who gave me this gift, but I don't want them to have to deal with their customer service department. I suggest shopping a different brand.

Update 11/5/2021
I called CS back again this time with a serial number. They would not help, because it was not purchased through Amazon. It was sold as New via EBay. I am posting this here, because I originally thought it came from Amazon, but I wanted to share how terrible their customer service is. Buy DJI...

title: Great First Drone Overall
text:
The Good: (Drone)-
- Feels sturdy
- Very high quality for the price point
- Compact when folded
- Easy to control for beginners
- Auto land/takeoff
- Simple, User-friendly app.

Could Improve: (Drone)-
- Propellers sit very low to ground. Purchased a landing gear separate that helped a ton!
- Folding in the arms correctly can be confusing
- The "follow me" function had to be at just the right height for it to work
- The batteries had to charge for 10+ hours before both turned solid green
- Battery life is standard but not ideal imo.

The Good: (Controller)-
- Compact when folded
- Holds phone tightly and secure.

Could Improve: (Controller)-
- Controller will not fit larger phones (S22 Ultra) - Had to use older, smaller phone
- Rectangular grips feel awkward to hold
- Material feels much cheaper than the Drone
- Folding antennas can be confusing.---------

Overall:
Great first Drone for recreational use. The controller could be better but very happy with the Drone quality, features, and flight.----------

*TO CONSIDER:
- Drone does NOT have Remote ID Broadcasting. This is a new regulation that will be required within a year. According to Holy Stone, their drones will be "updated" for this. Not sure what that entails for current models already sold. Could be a deal breaker for some but it's still worth the price imo. Do your research.

title: Enjoy watching your money fly off into the sunset
text: I just purchased this drone and while I liked how compact it was and its features the right flight stick was unresponsive at best and ultimately did nothing.  The first flight I used my phone and could not get the drone to do anything but go up and down and rotate.  For the second flight I thought maybe the phone wifi link was the issue so I launched it with just the controller.  It took flight and hovered for a minute, and then I watched as $300 lazily flew off toward the horizon until the controller lost connection and I lost line of sight with the drone.  Not sure if it became self aware and flew home, but $300 bucks for 2 flights and about ten minutes of use is just not worth it.  If you are interested enough in the hobby instead of throwing your money away on this save it and buy a legit drone from a company that doesn't have a poor chinese to english translation name.

title: Holy Stone HS720E --- Great drone, exceptional value, quick customer support.
text:
First the BAD: I didn’t notice it at first but the seals on the Holy Stone box had been taped over with clear tape. When unboxing the actual drone I noticed a couple of things that caused concern. There was damage to some of the propellers, scratches on the drone body, the main drone batteries were already charged and there were already batteries in the transmitter. This unit had definitely been returned and never checked out properly before reselling. The spare battery, charger and misc. extras had also been opened. I had just purchased a used drone and paid for new.

Because I initially thought the Holy Stone box still had its clear seals I contacted Holy Stone support first. They quickly got back to me with how to proceed to get a new replacement from Amazon. As always there was “no questions asked” from Amazon. They immediately sent out a replacement and I don’t even have to box and ship the first one back. I just drop it off at the nearest Kohl’s store.

The GOOD: This is my first drone and I did a lot of research before buying the Holy Stone HS720E. Price was of course a concern but this drone had many features that were available in much higher priced drones. A big plus for me was that there are many HS720E specific YouTube videos available for setup, calibration, and flying. Also there are videos for use of the various transmitter functions and the Ophelia Go App.

I’ve only been able to fly it a few times since receiving it because of bad weather in the area but so far I love it. It's an easy drone to fly. It's remarkably stable, the GPS works well, and the video is great. The manual is very well written and easy to understand. The drone and the provided case have a quality feel.
Many reviews and research indicated Holy Stone has the best customer service and I’ve only had this limited experience, but so far I would agree. It is nice to know they stand behind their products. I really like this drone and think it is an awesome buy, especially for the price. I will be doing more business with this company for sure!

Amazon! You need to pay attention to returns and not ship them out again as new.

title: Not worth the money
text: The drone would go up and down with out issue. Not to reactive to move left,right and forward/reverse. Lost signal randomly and would crash. Not worth the money. Spend more money on a drone that listens to your responses.

title: Worth it just to be this easy
text: I hesitated trying to find a better deal but went for this model because it was 4K for picture and video and the other reviews and many video demonstrations said it was easy and intuitive.  They were right.  If a drone were a big learning curve, I would have put it to the side as another failed novelty purchase.  But an hour reading the manual and I felt like a tentative expert. Another hour of flying and the drone almost feels like a familiar race video game.  The only negative is the camera does not auto position on the subject in Follow Me Mode, but maybe I’m just missing some nuance.  If you don’t have lots of extra time or energy to spare and want to ensure you are out enjoying a drone lickity split, this is the one to get.  And the battery feels like closer to half an hour, awesome since some said closer to 20-23 minutes, which was the one concern I had with not really being able to enjoy flights before the battery gets drained.

title: Excellent customer service
text:
After reading lots of reviews from other customers and plenty of research, I purchased my first Holy Stone HS720E a couple of years ago. I was very satisfied with the performance and the video/picture quality I provided.
I was so satisfied I have recommended to others and just recently purchased another one.
Holy Stone products are solid and good quality. Compare to other drones holy Stone has great prices and their customer support is excellent.

title: This drone is amazing
text: I am brand new to drones so did not want to go crazy on purchasing a really expensive one.  This drone is amazing.  Within a few minutes of unpacking the box and reading the manual, I had my new drone in the air.  I have only used it a few times around my home getting used to the controls, but I suspect once I get it out to a large open area I'll be able to become more familiar with it.  I don't think if I could have asked or expected more from a drone at this price range.  I am anxious to take it on vacation with me next month.

title: High-quality drone for a fair price
text: I've only had this one day. So far, so good. Great little drone; I love it.

title: Holy Stone hs720e is one great drone!! Holy Stone customer service can't be beat!!
text: The hs720e comes with everything you need to fly with! Hard carry case, 2 batteries, extra blades,screws, screw driver, charger, transmitter,and the drone! The drone is solid built, has landing lights, for late flying and they will help you see the drone, against the sky if you are having hard time seeing it. It is very stable, hovers at all altitude, camera is great! From straight ahead to 90degree down, I've not experienced any vibration in mine! Flys great for beginners in beginners mode, or turn that off, adjust perimeters, and it will fly amazing fast ,high,and highly manverable! Transmitter has led display on it to show, battery,time, range, height, distance, gps connection, allin one! Your phone connects to the transmitter, to see where your flying, take pictures, video. Flight time is about 25 to 30 per battery. This is one great drone for the money!  Their customer service is by far the best I have ever experienced, they answered every phone call, answered every question, never said it was the  customer fault.  Mine got problem in return to home, it was about 3 days old! Called told them my problem, new drone on the way! Don't know of many companies like that!

title: Need to know
text: This drone is very easy to use, once you figure out what you need. Before flying , you must calibrate the drone, follow the instructions.  Hold horizontal, rotate clockwise 3 times.  Hold vertical, clockwise rotation 3 times.  The app options are a mess.  I tried them all.  Use Ophelia GO.  It guides you to connect you wifi to the drone.  Go into settings and turn off beginner mode or you are going to have a bad time.  The parameter restrictions made me fly my drone into a tree.  There is also a mess of videos that don’t help at all.  Good Luck!

text: I reviewed many drones over a long period of time. Its also easy to use and we have student workers from time to time film for us with just a short lesson before hand.  Our school loves the drone so much we are considering having a drone team at our school and make it part of our extra cirricular program.  Very nice, and affordable drone.  Ive used the same model for the last 3 years.  Its been great.

title: Super easy to fly!
text: This is my first "real drone" and as a newbie to flying drones, I was always worried about losing or breaking a expensive drone. for the price, this drone wont break the bank, even if you somehow lose it. First thing I noticed was how easy to set up the drone was and how easy to connect my phone. The drone is super stable and so easy to control. the only thing I have noticed so far is the "follow me" mode is not the best and lags behind and does not necessarily keep you centered in the camera view, sort of bummed, because this is why I bought it.  I have not had the chance to test the other modes of flight yet, but ill assume they'll do fine. Camera is decent, but the gimble adjustment is a little touchy and hard to find the right angel for the camera, this may be due to lag between the drone and the controller.  Overall, I would highly recommend this as a beginner drone.

title: Customer service
text: Customer service is awesome.  Unfortunately my drone lost gps signal and was nowhere to be found.  Told holy stone and sent me a free brand new replacement.

title: Easy to Fly
text: The camera works very clearly and records good videos and pictures. I like how the drone will just hover in place. The return to home feature is great.

title: Great Starter Drone!
text:
Was my first drone ever and it was very user friendly. It takes great video and the electronic stabilization works very well, I do recommend it providing you don’t need a lot of speed/altitude from it. Including the coupon this drone comes with two batteries and a dual charger at a sub $300 price point.

After some light research I landed on this drone by google’ing “best drones for fishing”, that was my mistake. This drone had issues with signal loss at what I thought to be short distances, thankfully the RTH worked great and I didn’t lose the drone. Holy Stone also has great tech support and they agreed that I may have ended up with a bad unit and offered to replace it or return it with no hassle. I opted for the refund and they even offered an additional discount if I would consider trying them out again in the future.

If you’re curious I ended up with a DJI Phantom drone, much faster and much better range but also 4 times the cost. Two additional DJI smart batteries cost as much as this HS720E drone kit. Yikes!

So you better ride it around smart. Find giant field with no trees or other tall objects. Remote is not really effective after 50-60 meters of distance. Parts on Amazon and little skills with youtube videos helps to replace them. Definetly requires quite sometimes training to go wild!🙄😏

title: PERFECTION!
text: [[VIDEOID:66b18d7c1dc3149fdf5cfa20c0ba6505]] This is my first drone experience. It didn't disappoint. The instructions are easy to understand. The drone flew without any hiccups even though there was a nice breeze. The 5 star reviews posted truly represent the product. I am hooked. Only flew for a short time today because I didn't have a chance to fully charge the batteries. Sorry the video is shaky and not professional. It was my first time after all!. Thanks Holy Stone!

title: Great drone for the money
text: Easy to setup and get going. The slow mode is good for getting acclimated to the controls. I’ve used it at the beach at altitudes around 365’. The pictures and videos were awesome. Used it at night during July 4th to capture fireworks. Also used it to find a wasp nest at the top of my chimney. I did, only because of user error, almost loose it in a swamp. My error was I didn’t calibrate it correctly before flight. As soon as it went up it took off horizontally and I barely fought it back and it ended up hitting the back of my camper and crash landing. But it didn’t damage anything. I was able to restart it, recalibrate it and back up and running. I would recommend this drone to anyone looking to get into flying them. And it seems that most of the parts that would break due to crashing are sold fairly reasonable on Amazon.

title: This is a very easy to use drone.
text: Overall this is a very good drone for the money spent.  This is my third drone, and is a huge step up from the prior two in quality.  I had some initial trouble with the setup, but I believe is had to due with obstructions in the line of site.  It worked really well even in some moderate winds.  That will drain the battery faster however.  I am still learning some of the features but enjoying it.

title: Great drone for beginners.
text:
Overall, we really like this drone. It seems like it was priced well. The drone seems to be made well. It comes with two batteries and a very nice case.

My 11 year-old son learned to fly it quickly. It is easy to calibrate and control. The range with video doesn't seem extremely far; however, we are using an old iphone 6 with it. I am sure a newer phone would maintaing a connection for a greater distance. Also, I did download the app on my note 9. The app with Android appears to be better. We had some weird glitches with the iphone where an error message would pop up in chinese. However, it only did that a few times. It gives an error message at the beginning about connecting the phone via WiFi. I can't tell what they mean in the message, but connecting your phone to the Holy Stone wifi in your WiFi settings is the easiest way. Also, the charger connection seems a little cheap but has worked fine. We will see if it holds up.

title: Great experience! Amazing drone!
text: Great first experience with a drone!  Better than I anticipated.  Easy to set up and use.  Excited for my next flight already.

title: Pretty fantastic for beginners. I imagine that I will also be loving this as I continue.
text: In my unending wisdom, I ran the drone into a tree after the first 3-4 flights. Structurally it held up really well aside from a broken arm. It was super easy to fix and continued to teach me more about how the drone works and how I can fix things at home. Really helped boost my confidence towards getting into flying drones.

title: Amazing drone!!!
text:
I just got it today. This is the second drone I've owned. My first drone was more of toy. This one is amazing! It has a very steady hover, even in breezy conditions. The image stabilization makes the videos looks super smooth. I've just started playing with it and already I can't believe how easy it is to fly. I bought it to inspect my gutters and needed a camera that could point straight down. The remote 90 degree camera movement is very smooth, not jerky. It's so easy to control. Once I get some practice, I'll be able to get closer to my gutters, but already I was able to get great shots of where my gutters need cleaning. I live in Florida, so if we get hit with a hurricane, I'll be able to inspect my roof for damage and send pics to the insurance company. Besides, this thing is very fun to fly.

The pics are screenshots off my iphone, so don't judge the image quality. I'm getting a micro SD card to save the 4K videos and photos. The images will be crystal clear off the SD card.

I shopped around, watching a lot of youtube reviews. I didn't want to spend $500+ for a drone. This one was half that. The fact it came with a nice case and second battery sealed the deal. I saw a few reviews comparing it to other drones costing $500-$900. That's not a fair comparison. Still, it holds its own against the higher priced models. I love this drone!!!

title: Very Stable Flight
text: Very Stable flight, easy to maneuver long flight times however the long charging times are a little bit of a drag, otherwise great drone for its price range. Also, be aware the features with the app are not compatible with all models of smartphone so I would check specs for the drone against your phone before purchasing.

title: Bought 2 Returned 1-1/2
text: Well for starters everything was good on the first one, then it decided to take a mind of its own and the control wasn't able to control it and it crashed.  I sent that one back and got another. Ok so the second one worked great for a couple weeks the just this passed weekend everything was going good and then the same thing as the first it just took off out of control and it lost in the bayou!!! So I just sent it back for hopefully a full refund!!! We'll see not holding my breath

title: Returned After First Flight
text:
I really wanted to like this drone. First, I bought the HS175D. I flew it once in Washington right next to my father-in-law who was flying a DJI mini. Mine was toilet bowling and drifting after multiple attempts to calibrate the drone and gyros. The DJI was extremely stable. I don’t return many things on Amazon but I sent it back.

I then bought this drone (HS720E). I flew it once in Utah. I had the same experience as the HS175D. I calibrated it multiple times but it drifted really hard to the right with no wind at all. I sent it back
and forked out the money for a DJI mini 2.

The drone was easy to setup and operate. If you don’t care about the drone holding a stable gps location, then this would be a solid drone. Hovering in a very stable gps location is just a very important feature for me.

title: Easy to use and fairly straight forward startup.
text: Great beginner drone, I’m having a blast with it. Connections between controller, drone, and phone are quick and easy, and it’s pretty tough built.

title: Great for beginners
text: This is the first drone I purchased as a beginner drone and as far as that goes it feels real easy to take right out of the box and take to the skies. The camera quality isn’t the greatest but still pretty good. Overall I am very satisfied to learn how to be a better drone operator with this drone.

title: Recomendado.. excelente
text: [[VIDEOID:b9775b21568a31fd068018a1773352da]] Excelente producto recomendado a todas las personas que quieran unas experiencias diferentes en volar este dron..

title: The camera stability is great.
text: Great product.

title: Worth the money
text: Easy to learn. The GPS features are very accurate. This is my first drone.

title: HS720E
text: This drone is feature packed! One of the best cameras currently on the market at this price point and the EIS technology is actually really good. You get so much in a compact size including the case which is a nice addition. The led lights on this drone are super bright, easy to see while flying at night. The 2 led flood lights are amazingly bright you can even see them in the daylight. Setup is easy to do along with calibration. I’d recommended this to anyone looking for a great drone at a budget price!

title: Very good Drone for the money
text: I've only had this drone a couple days. Here's what I don't like. The drone starts up in mode 2. So it's reactions, and movements  are fast on start up. On my first flight with no wind the drone did not maintain position after take off. Trying to correct the speed, and adjust position caused my phone to come loose, and I crashed. Second flight. I replaced my damaged propellers,(included) and flew again. The drone was much more stable, and flew better. I will buy some extra props. I think it would help if Holly Stone had a digital manual. The paper manual included is kind of small. Customers need to know that there is a tab on the lower part of the phone holder that will securely hold your phone after you unfold it. It holds my Galaxy s10 with an otter box case securely. This is important! You won't have a good experience if your phone keeps coming loose.  Okay. Here's what I like. You get a LOT for your money. Very nice case. It will keep your drone, and accessories safe and secure. 2 Batteries with pretty decent flight time. External controller with it's own screen that compliments your cell phone screen. The camera tilts from 0 to 90 degrees and takes excellent pictures! This drone seems to fly very well after you get over the "leaning curve". I will update this once I've flown it a little more.

title: Great Drone
text: This is a great drone for a beginner or an experienced drone pilot. I was a little reluctant simply based on the price, but after getting it I am amazed at how well it performs. It is very stable even while flying in windy conditions and it takes really good photos/videos. Customer service is also a great resource if you have any problems or concerns. I called after having a slight issue and they immediately handled my issue.

title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.
text: I had a malfunction with my drone and i lost it. After 4 days of having it this was frustrating. I contacted holy stone as a last effort after looking for drone for 7 hours with 8 close friends. They showed me some things in the app to locate my drone. Not salvageable  they sent me a new one to replace my original drone. No fuss. Just good customer service. Will recommend again.

title: Save your money and just buy a DJI mini 3 pro..
text: Save your money and just buy a DJI mini 3

title: Uncontrollable drone.
text: This drone sadly is trash I recently purchased this drone and was so excited for it charged the battery and first problem is you need aa batteries for the remote ok why not a rechargeable one. Then already ready to do a first flight here is where the problem went yup it took off great then I lost complete control the drone would not acknowledge what I wanted it to do , I was finally able to land safely. I boxed it up and called customer care for a refund. Do not buy this product.
